8LZcVUXdilB5brEYNEXtOg.text: Had a wonderful experience at Ponchos over the weekend. Stopped by for Happy Hour which is a huge plus on the weekend when most places in town don't. Tasty stuff drinks and exceptional tacos, a must if you're in Downtown Summerlin abs looking for a spot with good eats. I will make sure to bring my friends and family next time they come into town to visit.

N80Gy6PPOML3YEZqh2mbSA.text: My husband and I ordered a two item combo (taco & chile relleno), guacamole, two margaritas (one mango, one traditional on the rocks). My husband had three margaritas & we split the entree, no other food ordered. We thought it was quite expensive. Our bill with tip was $102. That's without the guacamole which they gave us complimentary due to our wait for drinks, even though we never complained. That was nice. The guacamole portion was very large, but the entree was average size with a small portion of rice & beans. The food was good but nothing "wowed" either of us. The taco was our favorite. The guacamole needed salt. The service was not great, but we tried to give them the benefit of the doubt since the restaurant had just opened the day before. We waited a long time for our initial drinks. We sat in the bar and it was pretty full, two or three empty tables. The restaurant is beautiful inside. Exactly what you'd expect from a Mexican place. We came to the conclusion that if we are going out for Mexican we'll go to Juan's Flaming Fajitas on West Tropicana. It's cheaper, the service is great, the atmosphere is decent, & the food is outstanding. Conclusion- been there, checked it out, will go again if a friend wants to meet up there for a drink at their suggestion, but I wouldn't suggest it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancho&#39;s mango margarita
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancho&#39;s two item combo- beef taco &amp; chile relleno.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole

dW8xVcIe2MXZY_OqpQ-0xQ.text: Kiwi margarita, chips and salsa, and taquitos were so delicious. The wait for the dining room was forever so my husband and I opted for a high top at the bar. They were only serving appetizers tonight but we didn't mind.   My kiwi margarita was delicious. Made from real fruit! The salsa was on point. Taquitos were super yummy and so was the guac they were covered in.   My husband and I can't wait to go back and explore the rest of the menu.   I will update my review after I see more of what they have to offer.

lADV0KEhwgFEleF0I3wGQg.text: Leaves something to be desired. The customer service was excellent, unfortunately that is the only thing that was.

iqEECorC1ZEFYaDcztg1YA.text: Great service! Great environment!  Nice HD TVs, cool bartenders. . . Incredibly overpriced. Food is great but holy shit, it's Mexican food, $18.95 for a Carne asada quesadilla, $7.50 for Negra Modelo draft. . . Am I on the strip or something? Even though food and service were great,  never coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tab at Panchos. . . Way overpriced

VIsvedrOFIbOR0kh05lz2Q.text: First impressions would lead you to believe that your are about to experience Authentic Mexican Cusine but you will be sorely mistaken. I ordered the Carne asada  platter if you will. The meat was way under seasoned, actually void of any flavor. The beans are good and the rice is adequate. The chips and salsa are complimentary and provided the best flavors for the meal. The price is way out of line with the quality of food served here. The one thing that does stand out is the great service we received.

CUwpcluff1Gh8lPc2CKaWg.text: This place is gorgeous, filled with artifacts from all over Mexico. Beautiful venue for a wedding or party. The food is great too. I highly recommend The Birria Chef Ramon dish, which was phenomenal. The flavors danced on my tongue Mexican songs of lament ;) the servers are great and there's an attached bar that plays sports as well as live music on the weekends. Definitely a great place to check out.

dn93TzvcKtlW6fhOSjJOEA.text: Beautiful authentic atmosphere! Unique style to this building and a long complex menu. Service was perfect!!! And that's hard to find these days. Food & drinks were delicious, although on the pricey side. Average cocktail $10-12 Average meal $20-25

LAyc26A-NVTLshz3Yrb1aA.text: The ambiance and service are impeccable, and the food is absolutely wonderful. I've tried a few different menu items on different visits and I've never been disappointed. The Waite staff is very attentive - even those who are not responsible for your table. Not overpriced. I've just moved to Las Vegas from TX - and the cuisine at Pancho's is every bit as good as my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Lone Star State.  I'm a definite customer from now on.  I really have nothing negative to say about any of my visits to Pancho's.

ncYB8yRCUaSTNuknZ2QwTw.text: Best tasting authentic Mexican food. The chef is from Puebla Mexico and its evident in the dish selection. By far the most authentic taste outside of Mexico. We had the spicy margarita's and they were amazing, followed by the tortilla soup which is the best I've had in Vegas by far. I had the Mole Pipian and it was really well made and seasoned, the portion was big enough to have left overs for later. My wife had the Tinga Poblano and her dish was superb. And we finished the meal with a delicious flan. I would highly recommend this place.

ogShLI7F75tIsV-8eqpL7A.text: Very friendly staff, great selection on menu, delicious flavor. However one issue is that our guacamole appetizer was barley served 2 minutes after our salads and then our meals were brought to the table in less than a minute after the guacamole was delivered. Timing was off!!  I also felt that the menu is over priced $5-$6.  I've spent less money at 5-star Mexican restaurants.  The atmosphere was very Traditional, inviting, and beautiful. I'm very interested in exploring their happy hour specials.

-sZLpaOi1JpdiiB9DiDofQ.text: I gave 2 stars because of the overall visit but I am willing to give it another shot being that this place is just a few months old. Our server was awesome and very pleasant and accommodating. The food selection was great and everyone else in our party had a great dinner. But what messed it up for me was when my food came out with rock-hard rice kernels, it just ruined it completely. I hope they learn to check their rice cooker for old and expired rice. It's just gross.  I asked for the manager and he was very understanding and offered a free dinner of my choice upon my return.

xZx61a7Df00db6pDridaeQ.text: This place is interesting. Chips and salsa was good. I had a beef taco and a chicken tamale. The beef taco was full of flavor and was really good. The tamale was so dry I couldn't eat it. The price point was kind of high. The fried ice cream is a scoop of ice cream covered in Frosted Flakes... not what I was expecting at all

xLUvkTqRDK9jjg2NLDILtg.text: Service was great, had appetizers at the bar. Chips and salsa good, margaritas were great. They had an awesome band playing until midnight on Sat. Good place to just hang out listen to music have a drink. The band that played last night played alternative rock, was told they will be back on Thursday can't wait to see them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great music.

T2Ey4LP3if0gj9Ae2p5Prw.text: Had dinner with the family. The food was good, but way overpriced. We wanted to get the guac appitizer but at $15 that would be a no. Sodas come out in what looks like a large shot glass. Two sips and you're done. For the three of us, with no alchocol, it was $85 with a tip. I'm not opposed to paying $20 + a person, just not for mexican.

eFKINqsSQE1N6-ar2Ma3_w.text: We've been to Pancho's a couple times and they have both been pleasant visits. The servers are attentive and courteous, people continuously come by to pick up empty dishes and refill drinks. The food is totally delish. We have had both brunch and regular menu dishes and we always get to take some home since the plates are pretty big. We will come back for sure.

hv41sVhQRZxDmuktq34vaQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere. Very friendly staff. I was kind of put off by the price but then I saw the portions! You get what you pay for! Kids portions were huge! My kids could have split one dish  but I have to say that this was very good Mexican food and I would gladly come back again.

CBGUvmvAj54TmDep0XgcEw.text: Beautiful restaurant and a nice menu.  The enchilada in the mole sauce was a bit bland for me.  However the chicken inside was good if a bit dry.  I like this place and will be back again.  I hope the next dish is better.  This was just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchilada de mole

eEoGZU8BMyspdJeqQzTmWg.text: We had appetizers which were ok, followed by lunch for each of us. I will start by saying that the best tasting appetizer on the combo plate were the chicken wings.  I had the burrito ranchero and found it to be bland and mushy in texture. The service was also lacking.  Our server was ok, but there was a long wait between the appetizers and lunch service, so long that we thought they may have forgotten our order. Did not feel that it was worth the $65 tab and do not plan to return.

onHiCxFMfF6Ekmhxpor18w.text: Food is good, service was excellent. I ate there twice, the second time they didn't make us pay for my dinner, mine was free for bringing my friends along who were visiting from LA. That was so cool

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-kaUgNGBFL0gY969Ht_YUA.text: Great food! First time I was here the waiter was informative about their social nights. The following experience was not so great. The waitress dropped the ice cold water on me, apologized but left and didn't come back. Had to wait until I got another waitress attention in order to get help. Smh...

Cz2zoRDMmc4KPDEnvY-wrg.text: Yeah entrees might be $5 too high but the food was very good and the manager was extremely nice. He stop by again afterwards to make sure everything was fine.

EXv1iCsaUqcFa37ArptgYg.text: Great atmosphere, pricey but good food. Beautiful live plants everywhere so it feels like a tropical garden somewhere in Mexico so A+ for the environment. Over estimated wait times so don't let it scare you away if they say 45 mins in my experience it was more  like 10-15 mins. Guess they're just covering their bases. Great location on DT Summerlin, near Trader Joes.

6VDEeEMItxjiuKdtJ-wtBQ.text: Meh - it was just ok but I guess for folks who don't know better it will be fine. I ordered the chicken enchilada suiza- dry. Their specialty margarita was good.

Q5aAf8ultZWemioM7iBelg.text: Beautifully designed restaurant inside and out. The Margaritas are the best! They are very tasty and strong! I had the Naughty Maggy (Cadillac Margarita) and a Mango on the rocks, both so good. To eat, I had the Anna's Pollo. It is a chicken dish, I wish I would of taken pictures but it was too good. Overall experience was great. Good food, good drinks, amazing ambiance!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango margarita on the rocks!! :)

g9-zgHIHOB5zAzIkAbxNBw.text: My family and I went here after a long day of shopping. The service was good, and chips and salsa were fresh. The food was very good, but on the pricey side. The kids menu alone was $10.00 ( this is the reason for 4 stars). We would definitely go back as we have been unable to find a quality Mexican restaurant in Vegas.

PnzSRCOpeEA834QtpCLyQQ.text: Absolutely beautiful restaurant! Extremely overpriced! Incredibly slow service on a Friday @ 5:30. Strawberry margarita was probably the worst I've ever had.

mTSg8GdpVPcAL8UyawSTww.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Chicken Enchiladas Suiza were excellent. Been here twice in a week!!

emPgeOp4gIoiq2RpWe4pxw.text: Great service in the bar and amazing food. Our server Jason was the best. Went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect even though he was extremely busy.  Definitely coming back.

vX1bbKAVaZYemKwjV5GGaQ.text: Can't say enough, it's our "go to" place for THE best nachos around. Service is great, people are so friendly AND always inquiring about our satisfaction, and where do they get those fries? A must have!

0WRJV3Q8SHvvIgwwggA9FQ.text: Fun atmosphere, nice decor! Shrimp Diablo Puffy tacos great, carme asada really nice! The place to go for a birthday with the obligatory sombrero!

iX-9drZeqytNHyhEgIpBwA.text: First time coming here and I must say, it's super nice! The staff were all so friendly, especially our waitress, Marta. The restaurant itself is beautiful with a lot of greenery. It feels like I'm inside a traditional Mexican home, eating traditional Mexican food. I'd definitely be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried ice cream!

QGd4MhzpeO1cEOPXELGNXA.text: Very good !! We've been in NV for 11 years and could not find a Mexican restaurant  in the valley that compared to California  style food and we finally found this place ....loved it!!! The atmosphere  is super nice too!!!

W2_xcGDxFzvVvL9DBnBEag.text: I highly recommend dining here! David was our server and he did a fantastic job!! They have been open for 3 days and I give them a tremendous amount of respect for the how efficient they were! The food was fantastic! Summerlin definitely needed this gem of a restaurant! A big shout out to David, Sam, Hugo, Abbott & Doug! They made the evening run so smoothly considering how packed they were!

FM9kEPtvLkybRyf8jlA9MA.text: Met a friend for their Sunday Brunch.  1st time for us and we both agreed, the restaurant is very beautifully decorated.  We sat near the water fountain which created a relaxing and inviting atmosphere.  Our server Miguel was awesome, attentive and fun.  We were brought a complimentary glass of champagne and a small bowl of fruit while waiting for our food which by the way, was delivered quickly and perfectly hot (hate cold eggs!).  Neither of us ate the fruit, not sweet, out of season, appeared a bit old --  they should forego it altogether.   Overall a great experience, just a little surprised when we received the bill -- tax and our 20% tip (would have liked to have given more to Miguel to be honest) came to $90.00 total.  We each had one margarita,  one brunch item and we split a brownie dessert.  Seemed a bit overpriced to us but I would definitely go back, the food was delicious, excellent service and atmosphere but would definitely forego the $11.75 margarita and stick with the champagne.

VI9k3aS8cwNC_h_r3MQwDw.text: Too expensive! It's Mexican food! For gosh sakes  rice beans flour tortillas atmosphere is good in the bar live music too but way over priced.

TCHI0KSioaEOZCpy4KVFhg.text: The service is great the food is good but the  price range is high and to top it all off they don't serve menudo or pozole are you kidding me it's a Mexican restaurant

p3lgMPH_RWJ4CS9YsV1-sw.text: Ultimately disappointed. The food is good but just good. One would expect much better quality food with the prices Panchos lists. The building itself is very nicely setup and decorated. The staff is very attentive and friendly also. But $18 for a "queso dip" - listed as an appetizer mind you - that is composed of mostly cream cheese is exactly the type of robbery you can expect from this place! Note: I'm only giving an extra star for the friendly service and warm environment.

oYTESx-2qj2b-90gmhfVwg.text: Excellent service. Good food. I had a cold so I want to come back when my taste buds can really taste.  Had a nice little duet in the bar.  Served a full menu in the bar. Our server was Helen and she was great.  I would recommend that you try it.

Rdijgev-MJHZ8hHuyfiCBA.text: Food, service and ambiance get 4 stars. Value gets 2 stars - IMO very overpriced.

sdGbvrNlImW3SZjE4yn9Hg.text: This  place use to be good the first couple times. My husband and I went last night tortilla chips were bland but at least they were warm, when we received the Entree's mind was warm but not hot I had my burrito De Mar sent back but when it came back out it was fishy and drowned with too much sauce my husband said he should've sent his back his plate was on a fajita skillet and his plate wasn't sizzling or hot either . His steak was over done Nope we weren't happy at all and we won't be back !!! All good Memories of this place are Now bad memories

SulHNPwfhaeTJgSnpFbG2g.text: Amazing place, delicious food, best Mexican food here in town!! And great costumer service, Octavio, Hugo and Cinthia made our lunch very pleasant and they always make sure all the time that everything was okay

0Wq4kqoN8ynxnXDu3RlAnA.text: Loved the location convenient in downtown Summerlin but the quantity of food is a rip-off. Ordered a tortilla soup and I thought it was the side did clarify if this was the dinner size and he said yes . 3 spoons and done . Please fix this much needed Mexican restaurant in Summerlin. Waiters can be told to be cheerful might have been just a coincidence. Will definitely go back there and hope they fix a few things .

rOV-MljslZTstKKUlXj3XA.text: Panchos has great food, great margaritas and the ambiance is awesome.  The inside is like sitting outside in a Mexican villa. Tropical trees and a winding staircase make it seem intimate even though it's just one room. The food is excellent and they have a gluten free menu. I usually get the mole chicken, it comes with the rice and beans as usual. I get corn tortilla to sop up the sauce. The margaritas are a nice size and they don't skimp on the tequila. You can get any one of the dozens of tequilas they have on the menu. I tried the queso fun dido but I didn't like it. They told me it was their own spin, meaning people must order it then complain. The fun of fun dido is wrapping The gooey cheese around a fork and wiping it in the tortilla. Panchos is very runny and I didn't care for it.  The free chips and salsa are excellent, one of the best salsas I've had. Got a little kick to it, which is how I like it. I recommend this place highly

Hbsn-iAx2Az50u1Wt1gjaQ.text: I used to enjoy coming here but after my family's experience, we've decided to never return. Myself and my wife ordered enchiladas my wife's were warm but not hot, mine was cold, so after talking to the waiter he said this happens a lot and will fix it right away. So my family continues to eat  despite my wife saying we will wait for your plate. I said please continue to eat I dont want your food cold, so a couple of moments later our waiter returns with a fresh plate, yeah the plate was hot to the touch but again the inside of the enchiladas were again cold. This time asking for a manager and waiting for him to come to our table, finally he shows ( younger man ) I explain the situation and he said I'm sorry and you dont have to pay for your plate. I explained to him that even my wife's food was cold, so he said he would comp that as well. After going to this place a lot I expected that he would comp the whole meal since all four of us really were uncomfortable because I wasn't able to eat with my family. I mean we've even had birthday parties here and the food and service was excellent. I am very disappointed with them. I hope that a owner or general manager reaches out to me and offers a refund for the awful food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I plan on disputing the charge doe such poor quality food

9EhRx8hGZ8jKRqw8022n4w.text: By far the best Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. We have been living in Vegas for a few years and have yet to find authentic tasting mexican cuisine. Until now.  A great atmosphere, you feel like you're sitting in Mexico when you eat here.  This will definitely be our go to restaurant!

4g9I8Tc0H5q2OiXusxa1Qg.text: HaHaHaHaHaHaHaHaHaHa!!!!!  First off - $20 for a steak quesadilla, guacamole for $15 - AYFKM?  I could go on and on about what a ridiculous absurdity this place is, but I think it's best summed up by the following:  Pancho's - please FOAD!  I have this strange desire to laugh out loud in the face of the fool who opened this place - even if it gets me a sock in the eye.  I ordered the carne asada quesadilla and a beer.I figure a quesadilla is as good of benchmark for Mexican food as any, after all you get a tortilla to see if it is freshly made or not, steak or chicken to see how they season their meat, guacamole and salsa all in one dish. The kitchen took 20 minutes to make the quesadilla, but clearly spent no more than 20 seconds plating it. The presentation was what I would expect from Taco Bell, not a top dollar Mexican restaurant.   If after looking at the pictures you agree that it does not look appetizing, just wait till you lift up the first piece and see the waterfall of grease pouring down. I seriously had to grab a handful of napkins to soak up some of the grease that would not drip off of each piece on its own. After each slice of quesadilla was removed and de-greased, the plate was left with an ocean of grease that was starting to declare war on the guacamole.   But I wouldn't feel sorry for the guacamole, at $15 a serving, it has the budget to defend itself.  If there was something you could add to insult, after insult was added to injury, it was already added to that nasty quesadilla - it was just plain awful. The steak had a flavor, but a flavor that should be added to rodent repellent, not food. It left a nasty taste in your mouth that would not go away, even after drinking a gallon of salsa.  The salsa was decent, I have to admit. But then again it was free. The guacamole wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't worth $15.  I never got to judge the tortilla, it was soaked in so much fat there was no way to tell if it was handmade or not.  Let's just sum this crap-hole restaurant up this way:  "Poncho's - please leave Downtown Summerlin and never return. You are a cancer on an otherwise precious young flower that deserves a chance to bloom."  Having said that, the bartender Steve was a pretty decent bloke.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This quesadilla had so much grease you could deep-fry a Chevy.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are some of the napkins I used to soak up the grease from that nasty quesadilla.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does anybody in the kitchen care about presentation?

URytl7I0NAoSlGLS81hgMw.text: Ended up here last minute for lunch. The decor inside really does remind you of a Mexican villa, beautiful! Service was fast, salsa was a little water down but they were quick to refill our chips/ salsa every time.  I got the enchiladas Del Mar with crab and bf got the pancho combination. Food was delicious and they don't skimp on portions or meat! My enchiladas were overstuffed with crab.  Biggest complaint was the prices are high especially compared to Viva Mercados...guess your paying extra for all that decor and being in Summerlin. Also wish entrees came with soup fideo and kinda weird all the food comes from upstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas Del Mar

ELYx3w9Iq8600L-iODwH6g.text: This was probably my 3rd time here. We decided to stop for a margarita & dinner after trick or treating. The food the past few times we visited was just ok, under seasoned to our choice, lacked salt. BUT this time everything was Amazing!!! Excellent!!! We ordered chile verde plate & a taco plate. Rice & beans were great!!! Meat was great, perfect amount of spice! Staff was very nice. Besides almost taking my leftovers and tossing them. We will def be back again.

tSA17czozRhgdC2x4P1aRQ.text: Very middle of the road OKAY. I've always passed by this place on my way to Trader's Joe and my friend said it was good so I decided to try it out. We had the queso fundido, tortilla soup, and chicken fajitas.   The queso fundido was just meh - the queso fundido is wayyyyyy better at Viva Mercado. The tortilla soup was warm and good, but I probably wouldn't get it again. And the chicken fajita (always the safest bet whenever you try a new restaurant) was good, not great - I mean it's grilled chicken and veggies...I hope you don't mess that up.   Anyhow, would I give it another shot? Maybe. My friend had the taquitos and those looked good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rice and beans that go along with the chicken fajitas.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fajitaaaaaaa

-eAyE1EzaOz6qxZXhZMvug.text: Me and my family absolutely love this place!!! We are from the Bay Area and we have been looking for a really nice Mexican restaurant. Pancho's reminds us of our favorite Mexican restaurant, The Acapulco, in the Bay Area. I will agree the prices are a little high. We all agreed it was worth it. The food was great, the service was attentive and the drinks were amazing. Their happy hour is nice and we really enjoyed the vibe. Can't wait to go back!!!

s_o2UKCkZOJ2rZilOjPu9A.text: OMG! love this place! my daughter loves the tinga - which u can't find in many mexican restaurants.  i get something different every time and am never disappointed!  margaritas are amazing!  ambiance is nice, right in summerlin mall.  great place to eat and service is amazing!  gotta try it out!

g6f759-oRAam0JdoMo5n_g.text: I have had little interest in visiting Pancho's and I have to say I was less than impressed with what I encountered while dining there.  The restaurant is large and great looking but they seem to be all flash, no substance. The food is overpriced, very overpriced and nothing I ate was memorable in the least.   The chile verde burrito I ordered didn't have much flavor and the flavor it did have was a little sweet and unappetizing.  Service was standard. I have no interest in returning to Pancho's.

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream

_7cS72vCXWhFKiev2m9Lpg.text: Some of the best carnitas I have had in a long time! Their carnitas burrito was huge. Great service and nice atmosphere with beautiful stained glass windows. Their prices were a bit higher than what we typically pay for lunch, but the portions and quality ingredients made it well worth the extra cost.

fM-UYF8prBrxWivl_4Ym5A.text: Such a Beautiful restaurant! Staff is very friendly and food is Delish! I like sports and music and the bar area offers both as well as a Great Bartender, Jay I believe is his name.  Always a very enjoyable experience that I've not only told family members, but now also co-workers about my experience.

EPZmYf4w7yY5twXE1iKATg.text: Pricing is ridiculous still.   It is way over priced.   Food is average.

mPEbk1KEMRgA1M0Nb2kYAw.text: Yesterday was my first and last visit to Pancho's. When we first arrived, I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It's a beautiful restaurant with colorful tiles and stained glass; numerous plants add to a very tropical feel. Service was horrible - almost nonexistent. I had to ask for a menu twice and waited 15 more minutes to get one. The waiter never came and took our order. Never. I shared nachos with a friend who has arrived ahead of me. I  gave up ordering. My other friend never ate as he was so turned off by the whole experience. The chips and salsa were very good. When we asked for more from a passing staff, we never got a refill. So we left and told the hostess that we'd never come back.

qAvPbkKgmzEysYkvZSnICQ.text: When you go to ponchos you definitely pay for the atmosphere not the food. At best the food is mediocre, but you can get the same options at a much cheaper establishment. They have a wide range of of options but is way too expensive for the price. A soda alone is $3.75. Not worth it at all.

FV-TChjIUgWgqbtfkO1QCA.text: Preposterous. Avoid this place at all costs unless you like to be ripped off. As a Vegas local, I do NOT like to be price gouged just because a business has an expensive building and high overhead. I have a million other choices. Just because it is Summerlin also does not excuse how ridiculously marked up Pancho's entire menu is. There are plenty of restaurants in downtown Summerlin that are good and don't have these outrageous prices.   I made the mistake of not checking Yelp reviews before trying this place. I wanted an unbiased opinion because my friends and I have been waiting for this place to open for so long. It seems a lot of the Yelp reviews echo our thoughts as well. The exterior and interior *are* very beautiful. I like the openness feeling when you walk into the front entrance. The seating for waiting is a little awkward, some wooden benches and not enough of them. There is a fairly sizable bar area but we did not get a drink in the bar. My visit was on 12-5-15 on a Saturday night at around 7:30pm. We were given a pager and waited about 20 or 25 minutes, then we were led up the staircase to a small table overlooking the downstairs.   The ceiling and decor are elaborate, yes. It's very beautifully decorated. Our server was nice and friendly enough. I didn't catch her name, but service wasn't anything to write home about. And that's where anything positive ends.   They don't have a drink menu anywhere, and the little drink signs on the tables only list the brand of draft beer. NO prices anywhere. My friend ordered a Pacifico draft and I ordered a Titos vodka and club soda, and ice water. Guess it was our bad to not ask how much the drinks were...   This place isn't authentic Mexican anything. Complimentary chips and salsa are cold chips and store-bought jarred salsa with zero flavor. No hot sauce to be seen anywhere on the tables.   My friend ordered carnitas enchiladas ($19.95) and I ordered tacos de pescado (with salmon) also $19.95. It seemed that NOTHING on this menu is under $19.95... everything was extremely overpriced. The price did not reflect quality. My tacos came out and there are just two of them, and a slop of some weird beans. Yuck. I tried to pick up a salmon taco but it just falls apart. It had a lot of fillers in it, where the heck is the salmon? It's chopped up into tiny pieces, and the rest of the taco is filled with tomatoes and chopped iceberg lettuce. Disgusting. It lacked flavor, so BLAND! I tried to pick it all apart with my fork, it just wasn't worth the price.   How many freakin people do you need to constantly interrupt us to check on our table? I can count at least 6 people besides our waitress who kept trying to take our plates away. I felt a bit rushed and I don't like that. My plate didn't even look like I touched it, and my friend had quite a lot of food still, and an older gentleman came over to our table and asked if he could take our plates away. He already had his hand on my platter before I said anything, and by this time... I was SO over it. Just take it. It's too bad, I was still hungry but completely lost my appetite here.   There was some band setting up downstairs in the bar area and we could hear them practicing. Our waitress, although she was nice... seemed to rush us with the bill. Then when we got the bill, holy cow we both about lost it. $9.75 for a short glass of vodka and club soda!!?!?! $7.50 for a Pacifico DRAFT!??! WHAT!!! Our bill for two people, two drinks each, and two basic dinner entrees came to $79.95!! I saw they had tres leches on the dessert menu but seriously, $9.95 for a piece of moist cake? No thanks.   After seeing the bill with the drink prices, my friend and I were completely ticked off. And then, suddenly when we wanted to pay there was no one to be found upstairs. After all those people that were stopping at our tables, suddenly they all just disappeared. We flagged down a different waiter and settled our bill. Just a total let down experience overall.   If you want real Mexican food at reasonable prices with REAL homemade margaritas and salsa.... take my advice and go to Juan's Flaming Fajitas on Ft Apache and Tropicana on the southwest side of town. They treat you way better at Juan's and their food is so much better. Wish we went there.   Shame on the owners and management for overcharging! Never coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their prices are outrageous here
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this is only a vodka and club soda. For $9.75???? This isn&#39;t the Strip  I should be able to keep the glass for that price
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rrFJycxnkJ53xOtXz45qMA.text: Sit down Mehxican restaurant. The place is beautiful, 5 stars if that was all you were rating on. Go into the bathroom, i mean holy cow! We went on a Monday, to catch the Vegas Cakes show and the place was pretty quiet. We sat in the cantina since that was where they were showing it and it was occupied by one other table of people and sat with a shark floating overhead. They have high tops and a couple regular height tables to choose from. Not sure if it was because we sat in the cantina, but the four of us received one menu and one happy hour flyer, the good news is we were going to be there a while so we passed the menu around. Ordered a couple margarita and they packed a punch, children had virgin daiquiris which they enjoyed. You get chips and salsa which is nice, chips were edible, but nothing to get excited about. The salsa was decent, but expected a lot more flavor for a high end Mexican place. Monday had 2.50 tacos in the cantina, we should have stuck with these, the tacos were decent and 2.50 would be a good deal. Two tacos, maybe half a cup of rice and same for beans will cost you 6 times that. The chili relleno was soggy, tasted alright though. My son beamed over his chimichanga Service was pretty good after we ordered. Check in on yelp to get a free fried ice cream. This is a fried ice cream with a lot of cinnamon. Cannot complain since it was free and it was dessert! So the food was decent, better than the rest of the countless Mexican restaurants in the valley? No.  So it boils down to okay food, good drinks and awesome decor. Our bill was well over $125 before adding a tip, with 4 drinks two of which had alcohol. Way too much, sorry.

VZ5iJyn17PcIHD-v3-fuXw.text: Really good  mexican  restaurant.  Mexican restaurants  aren't  really the most fresh as far as I've  experienced  them.  This one is pretty  good.   Definitely  not cheap. A little  over priced  actually  but its probably  the best mexican restaurant  in town.   Great costumer  service.  The best actually.  Just a little too expensive.

hOz5g7CpJkqgd4OXjLtkew.text: This is a very nice Mexican restaurant.  The service was great , the food was great , and the restaurant was very nicely decorated.  Beautiful Mexican tiles, Tiffany lamps, and a French bar .  You can read all about it on the last page of the menu .  The mole sauce was excellent and the Rajitas were sizzling at table side .  I will definitely be back .

AnS0WbM36yuGlIDp_3H1NQ.text: What a beautiful place! Be sure to check out the entire place even if you don't like the food. I only ordered the nachos (on the appetizer menu) and it was not bad. Everyone else in my group loved the food despite its high prices. There's music every night starting around 9 or 10 PM. I'd come back although I will not sit in the bar area as it has bad acoustics, thus making the place super loud.

gpT1n3vklpm5DfyVwsiahQ.text: Pancho's rounds up to 4/5 stars due to its beautifully crafted location, but mediocre service and food.  Location: 5/5 This place is gorgeous.  There is plenty of beautiful art to gaze upon as you graze on your complimentary nachos.  There was live music when we came in about an hour and a half until closing, and it really lifted the atmosphere of the place.  Service 2.5/5 Our server was not very attentive to our table.  We didn't get our water until after our food came out, and we had to ask another waiter to get it.  I feel that many of the reviews have felt that the price for the food is a bit steep.  I wouldn't complain about the price if the service was a little better.  Food 3/5 I would say the food is about the same quality of food you would get from a Cheesecake Factory.  Again, the price is a bit steep for the quality of service that we received, but the live music and ambiance helped me forgive this.  Overall 3.7/5

gaapyCK6yXeNzmY1u8M1RA.text: We wanted to try this place since it opened and decided to go early at 5pm on a Saturday. It was completely dead! The atmosphere was great. It's really nice inside. There is a fountain, tall trees with lights and little birds hanging from the ceiling. Very cute! Unfortunately that's about all this place has to offer. The food and drinks are outrageously priced! My combination plate consisted of a cheese enchilada and a chicken tamale, rice and beans and it was $18.95! My husband got a combination plate with a taco and chicken tamale and it was also $18.95. He had a soda and I had water and our bill was $42, with tip it was $50. The food was not good. The tamales were very dry. My cheese enchilada had no taste to it. My husband said his taco was ok. I think Roberto's has much better food. We checked in with the Yelp app and we got a coupon for a free Fried Ice Cream. We thought ok, how can you mess up fried ice cream right? Wrong! It came in a fried tortilla shell bowl sitting in some dark brown watery substance. We had no idea what it was. Was is chocolate? Still have no idea. It kinda tasted like oil, cinnamon, sugar and a tad bit of caramel. We tried to spoon out some ice cream and it flipped over because it was a round ball floating in this strange substance. It tasted ok, but not like any fried ice cream I've ever had.  Maybe I'd try this place again but not for food. Maybe for a drink in the bar. They really need to drop their prices. Just because it's located in Downtown Summerlin doesn't mean it should be overpriced. I'd rather go down the street to Macayos for much better food and half the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fried ice cream floating in some weird brown substance.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The little birds hanging from the ceiling.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The stairs and some tall trees inside.

cbN0tnYlYVIHk0outqclWQ.text: First time here, love the fresh salsa and chips to start.!Food is exceptional!  Get a combination so you can try three different items. Chili relleno, taco and enchilada yummy Fun Mexican atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fried ice cream

-_99y9QC0hw1kPX-CKxA3Q.text: Margaritas and Steak Rajitas . Delish . Great food Great service. Definitely a favorite place in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RIynqYd5gOHYZNxfU7tXNQ.text: I am giving this place one star simply because I can't give them zero.   We sat down at our table and two people who sat down after us were greeted prior to anyone coming to our table. We sat down for about 10 minutes and then asked the host to please send a server over. When our server finally came over, she was just okay. She brought us our food and never came back to check on us or see if we needed anything else. We had to ask the busser for additional items we needed. After seeing our server nowhere in sight, we asked someone else for our bill.   On top of the horrible service, the menu is extremely overpriced. I spent $17 on a steak quesadilla and $12.75 on a regular margarita that wasn't even that great.   Needless to say, save your money. The food isn't worth the misery this place puts you through.

cDJlIfuPVrdkR4lGhGZA2Q.text: Here's the deal, if you grew up in LA and you like enchilada sauce and white style Mexican food, you'll like this place. Sure, there are places that are more rustic and more authentic, perhaps less cliche, but this place fills a void in the Las Vegas arena of Mexican fine dining. Everything was tasty! Bring your parents here! It has a place in my rotation for sure and I am a regular at the more authentic places. Great job on the decor too, it felt like a place that's been around a long time.  My only criticism is price. It's 10-15% more expensive than I'd like. Let's face it, that building wasn't cheap! Maybe when things settle they'll give us a break or some coupons or something.  As far as the negative reviews, most of them sound like what happens when you open a new place. It'll get better.  The fountain was clean by the way!

5DlZFeeFErJ3KK2xPDj4vQ.text: Well... $18.00 for a carne asada burrito is a bit steep. My boyfriend and I had a 2 for 1 coupon and thank god we did.  These prices are ridiculous.  We ordered 2 margaritas and wish we hadn't. Food was okay. Nothing memorable. We sat in the bar area and our server ghosted us. We had to ask other people for refills and other things Etc. save your pesos.

orSSSmoFEChDUGeJnlfqBg.text: Went here with my aunt. It's one of her favorite places.   The decor/atmosphere was really nice. The service was good. The food looked and smelled amazing...but was really just ok tasting.   I'm kind of a Mexican food snob as it's my all time favorite food on the planet and eat it several times a week, both at home and at various restaurants.  Since it was my aunt's favorite new place since it opened I had really high hopes. So I was a little disappointed that it was only ok tasting.  It was VERY expensive too! Lunch for 2 with a margarita each was around $60 with tip! Come on! That's way too much for two people for mexican food.

3eNAmMjYv5A5JIyzHr70pw.text: Prices are high for the quality of the food. Ordered the green pork enchilada and was not impressed. Also, tried taco Tuesday in the bar area and it was a ghost town. Although our tacos were out within five minutes of ordering, they were not worth eating. They had absolutely no flavor and were greasy since the taco shells are fried. The ambience of the restaurant area is very nice, I just wish they had better food.

4HZPK5M_5eAfcSSkOWaxRw.text: Are here last night with my family. Great service and good food! Cultivated atmosphere. Love when the managers at restaurants ask how their service is going! They also gave special treatment to my daughter with some ice cream and balloons just because :).

cSRq3UlchvIL0Z_waAAK3g.text: Happy hour is below average. Most appetizers $7+ beers and margaritas $5.50+. A little under staffed.  Large portions, mostly deep fried and quesadilla's. One salsa option with the free chips.  Live music a plus on Mondays.

QDYO5g_pqCY7-NEZnQ5QYQ.text: Second time here,  just keeps getting better.  The food still delicious,  cocktails on point.  Celebrating my son's birthday and couldn't have chosen a better place.  I come for the food, love the decor but the service is what it should be.  We dined at the bar,  the bartender was all over it, we even met a regular who joined us and covered our tab (thank you again) but now I know why he is a regular.  I too now will make this my must stop by when in Vegas spot.

EXQZsMyMZB71gbp_xGg7PQ.text: Our server Karisa was very nice and pleasant . I will recommend this place to my friends and family !!!   Madison was the best server ever!! :)

iKuh94f1ye_q3-7F1tC9GQ.text: Nice food. Great staff. Over all just a great place. Our waiter that we have always gotten is named Lee. A great server and can't wait to go again.

qpXqyKxvbygWQT9H04UHqg.text: Good food, beautiful ambience, and great service!!  Will definitely be back!!  Loved reading about the history of the place.  If you are in Downtown Summerlin, check this place out!!

GF8mRnRYeZ-uPFyGi_przA.text: I'm not normally one to leave bad reviews, but we had an all around terrible experience.   The waiter managed to get both of our orders completely wrong. However, not wanting to waste the food, my girlfriend accepted the incorrect taco plate after we discussed the issue with the waiter.   Only problem was it was much more expensive than what she actually ordered, and the guy charged us for the more expensive plate. Wow.  I did not accept the wrong food, but was inexplicably charged for the more expensive combo he had originally brought me. Unbelievable.   Then on top of that, the food was very mediocre. That's probably being kind. My enchiladas tasted like they were made with American cheese.   We won't be back. Prices here are out of control considering you could go to Javier's for the same price and actually get some great food.

6PQYYdTTFxV6P6tdm6-Htw.text: This place is outta sight! I love the steak quesadilla! OMG! And the SALSA is incredible!! I have been there 3 times in 1 month and the service is always on point! You have to try it! Although it is a bit pricey, it definitely worth it!!!

_lIk4L6_KbS6JpDe5GN3ZQ.text: If you want good sit down Mexican food this is definitely the place to go. Service was wonderful and although prices are a little steep the amazing food made up for it. Had ceviche to start then a delicious carne asada quesadilla and some enchiladas. Plus it's a cute place so nice for dates or even small family dinners. Best all around that I've had in Vegas

Y2JTYw87M3tP6T8DEKBjXw.text: This beautiful place should offer better quality food if they want to survive in Las Vegas! Servings are skimpy and overpriced.

IVb1jGK1c92NNOpMB-RmsA.text: Very bad food. prices too high. carnitas were cold and dry, tortillas were cold and not hand made, beans and rice nasty. not returning here.

jeY0gBo7K2ju_M5C69LyFA.text: During my 2 years while working on a cruise line in Hawaii we always used to stop on the side of the big island of Hawaii which was called Kona and tender boat in and they had this amazing mexican restaurant called Pancho & Leftys. I know this Pancho is related to one in California and not sure if the one in Kona is related in any way but the chips and salsa and everything about there menu reminds me of that restaurant in Kona.If I could give this restaurant more stars I would as it is some of the best mexican in Las Vegas.I am a die hard mexican food fan and have been to some of the top rated mexican restaurants in southern california to southern texas and let me say this food is so good.For Vegas this is one of the best out there and it may not touch some of the best out there I recommend it.

vbREQLT76zAskNVQAaZCVQ.text: Surely wish we had read the reviews prior to dining there. Having lived in Mexico, I do miss  Mexican cuisine. We were there in the evening after Christmas shopping. There was a horrible musician (that should have been a clue to leave). Politely put, I had Food Poisoning.

5OgJZFoOmJdYrYMD3iY1LQ.text: I'm giving Pancho's 5 stars for the overall experience. We enjoyed all of the food with just 2 exceptions. The complimentary corn chips were dense and hard. This could just be a matter of taste but I like them light and crispy. I asked for them to fry up some flower tortilla chips, which every other Mex restaurant I've asked to do that, does so with a smile. The waiter asked the kitchen and reported back that the flower tortillas were to thin. I had flower tortillas with my meal, they were normal tortillas, so, translation, I don't want to. And the guacamole was on the bland side. This is quite possibly the most expensive restaurant I've ever been to but when you read the last page of the menu, you discover why. I'm guessing a build out of well over a million. After dinner we went downstairs to have drinks and listen to a rock cover band, a much needed venue in DT Summerlin. We've said since DT Summerlin's opening that a music venue was sorely lacking. thanx Pancho's for filling the gap.

Y4wHO3UaaRb7_br9NDFLFA.text: I went for opening night.  The food was awesome and the decor was stunning.  The servers were nice and well trained despite it being opening night.  I highly recommend Panchos.   I have been to Panchos in Manhattan Beach and this place like the original  will soon become the go to place for big parties, family celebrations, intimate dinners and a night out on the town with live music and great margaritas.

FpVk9-20MmS_UUvQqcE-JQ.text: I think the food is excellent. It comes as close to Southern California Mexican food that I have found to date in Las Vegas. The red sauce particularly on the oven burrito is delicious. I would eat here weekly, but there prices are a bit high. Certainly a restaurant to have on your short list!

O7giG5Kc_4gzar3E6yOssQ.text: The service here was over and beyond. Everyone you encounter is kind and thoughtful. I wanted a lemonade as I am pregnant but didn't want a fountain lemonade. The server offered to have a fresh one made for me and made sure I was happy with the custom order. He left some extra for me on the table so I could have a refill. Manager came over and made small talk with us at the end of our meal. Found out we were expecting and gave us a complimentary dessert. Food was good too but service was memorable. Genuinely nice people.

-aKkwFJ4Mwhn4Mde4trFuw.text: The food was not good. In fact, I would be hard pressed to remember a meal this anti-climatic.  The service was great and the building is lovely. Won't be going back. Ever.

EecWMn9NWUk57ozq_MJoLQ.text: $70 for a taco plate and chimichanga and one glass of wine! Nothing special in the menu. Same thing offered anywhere. The decor was authentic but the poor wait staff - kitchen is up 2 flights of stairs. I tipped extra just because I felt sorry for them.

2hpPy4Tovjg3WpdSb1fR_A.text: Service was good and food was decent. It's high priced for Mexican food though- nothing I would return to spend money on when there are other options in town that are more reasonably priced for the same if not better food.

kLq7mABsPe5kcIMh1YENww.text: We walked in and saw a stage, and you know me - I know that screen and the set up when some karaoke is about to happen. Well, what to you know - There's karaoke every Tuesday night. I love Pancho 's

I4YTh3sZ7-98m4bnj4Mshw.text: Very disappointed-service was slow.  It took a long time for our guacamole which was unfortunately inedible because somebody dumped so much salt in it. The chips were not crisp but still managed to be greasy and slightly bitter. We ordered a vegetarian tostada not noticing that the dish had no beans included in it. So the dish only had rice and greasy veggies spiced in an unappetizing way.  The waiter told us that the rice is cooked in chicken broth which is a no-no for True vegetarians. We went away hungry after paying quite a bit.  We will not be back.

6aRHWL-IFy6V049mBx5WXQ.text: Super over priced. A family of four at a Mexican food restaurant shouldn't have to pay almost $80.00. My kids even ate off of the kids menu. Charging 13.95 for guacamole is preposterous. Some of it was my fault for not checking the menu but I didn't expect to pay 13.95 for guacamole. I got the bill and my jaw hit the floor. The are much better options for half the price else where around Las Vegas. The food and experience id not worth the high price.

MVixaTQkpmFJUu9mbLTm6w.text: Great service and atmosphere.  Food eh.  Unfortunately, a little bland and way overpriced.  Margaritas were good.  Had burrito ranchero, chile rellano made with pablano  and chimichanga.   Probably not returning.

c-gKwLKgsIRYGvpDwSQV_g.text: I typically am not the one to leave reviews but after reading some of these 1 star comments, I feel inclined to share my opinions.  My experience at Pancho's was spectacular! It was just what I was looking for to start my weekend after a very long Friday at work. When I walked in, I felt as if I was transported to the middle of a Mexican jungle, instantly all my work stress was left at the door. The lush greenery, authentic aztec/mayan relics, stained glass windows, and beautiful water fountain created a very calming and soothing ambiance, in what was still a very busy restaurant. The wait time was brief. When I got my table, I ended up getting seated upstair. This was great because I received a wonderful view of the entire restaurant. Sitting upstair you could really get an expansive view of all the detail that went into designing this restaurant.  As soon as I sat down, I was greeted with warm chips and delicious salsa. The waiter was extremely professional and instantly introduced himself. He asked if we had been here before and then began to give us the story of Pancho's. Very interesting story, I had no idea the history and tradition of this place that dates all the way back to 1945 in Southern California.   The menu at Pancho's is extensive. They serve classic items like a combination plate but I suggest exploring one of the many authentic dishes they have to offer. In particular their seafood section! I ended up going with Enchiladas de Langosta however the Shrimp Diabla Puffy Tacos did catch my eye. While I waited for my dinner, I ordered a Naughty Maggie Margarita (A MUST ORDER AFTER A LONG WEEK OF WORK)! This was one of the best margaritas I have had in Nevada, 3 or 4 of these and you are in for quite the night. As I finished off my chips and salsa I was quickly replenished with more before I could even ask, love this type of service! Especially when the chips and salsa are this tasty. When I received my meal, it was fresh out of the oven, the cheese was still bubbling and I was warned of the hot plate. These enchiladas were excellent, the lobster was cooked and seasoned nicely and the chipotle cream sauce stole the show. It was accompanied with delicious rice and beans. Very large portions, I was extremely full and I highly recommend this dish.   After enjoying my dinner, I got up and headed downstairs to the bar. When I walked into the bar, I was excited to see the ample amounts of space and TVs. I sat at the bar and ordered another Naughty Maggie Margarita which was of course accompanied with some more chips and salsa! I thought I was full but ended up finding some extra room for them...I guess they were that good! The bar was perfect, comfy seating, great margs, beautiful women, and lots of sports.  As the games were ending, I noticed that a band was setting up. At this point, I was ready to leave but wanted to know what was going on. The manager, Abbott (very nice guy), informed me that there is live entertainment 7 days a week. He told me, the entertainment consist of comedy, karaoke, and live music depending on the night. I was thrilled as I knew this would be my next date spot, I mean who does not like live entertainment and strong drinks! I ended up staying to hear a few songs from the band. Classic rock cover songs, yes please!!!!   I highly recommend Pancho's for any occasion and definitely suggest checking it out for yourself. The atmosphere alone is worth the trip!

3CbspYA4b3ZAtAn55m7a-g.text: We visited Pancho's for the first time today.  I really liked it.  I LOVED the decor, it's really cute inside, with an indoor patio feeling with lighted trees and colorful tiles and a fountain.  I bet it's pretty at night - will have to go back and check.  The staff were all very nice, from the host staff, to our server & busser.  I ordered Enchiladas Suizas, and they were very good.  My brother had a Quesadilla with Chorizo & Eggs, and he said that was also very good.  As some others have said, it was a little pricey, but that is not a particular concern of mine.  It is also a little noisy, but not too bad.  I recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind the high prices.

Ri-pYqBjxkK2c-cjnEM-ig.text: This restaurant is not worth your time.  The service was horrible.  The waiter never came back to see if everything was or ok.  Never refilled a soda? chips? salsa? asked if you needed anything?  The manager  dropped by the table wrote of the cost of the sodas we ordered Big deal!.  The manager said he would write off on one entre instead just wrote off the sodas.Don't waste your time!!

hV_GO-P75DWMp0XIpFhDWA.text: Went on Monday for lunch, wasn't impressed with the food itself especially for its cost. I was expecting a phenomenal dish but was left disappointed due to its lack of flavor and texture. The only reason I give this place four stars is because of the service, my server David was awesome, he followed up with me and I could really see he cared about my experience. Although the service was great, I may not come back until I hear they have an improved menu or are under management that cares about the food they are trying to sell.

k55zjmEFcKYpzj3e3urpUw.text: Great Mexican Food . The service was also Awesome. Beautiful ambiance that Reminds you of Mexico.

krcx-L5sydC7BIsPtWcOrQ.text: First time here, the hostess was extremely unwelcoming and very rude. Didnt seem like she wanted to be there. The server was very nice

WtLU8rz_70ANrcz0tJI7wQ.text: Ok food, good decor and ambiance, but WOW! the prices don't reflect the food. Overpriced and just ok.

VEFLEOS2JdWn9uSLvVzCkg.text: I LOVE the interior of this place. It reminds me of an early 1900's Spanish villa, and the tile staircase leading to the second floor is absolutely stunning. If aesthetics are important to you, you'll enjoy Pancho's. The food was good, albeit pricey. I would recommend coming during happy hour to score some of the discounted drinks and apps. I'll be returning for sure!

RLKWCksk835VfEGUGG5hDA.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I have found  in Summerlin   The food is excellent -the staff friendly and the restaurant very nicely done

oEDlzkmW1D8YiHkWeErilw.text: We had been wanting to try this place but were sadly disappointed.  We most likely won't be back.    Pros:  Nice atmosphere, wait staff was friendly and attentive, fast service, good drinks, good chips & salsa.  Cons:  Food was mediocre at best.  Chili Relleno was small, overcooked and had some unidentifiable chewy things in it!  Cheese in all dishes was gooey and hard to eat.  Rice was dry.  No happy hour rates if you sit in the restaurant (first place we've experienced this!)  Prices were much higher than other places we go and you get less food.

S_K9ay2aqOHdRUjohuFsFA.text: The restaurant is really nice and I loved the decor.  Our server was great.  We never felt rushed and he answered all our questions.  The food was not really "authentic" but it tasted ok.  Nothing to brag about and the prices seemed a bit high for what we got.  The bar area is big and separate from the main dining room, which is nice, and was playing live music when we were there.

hP2ImJDeVf9oF1TzS4wvBw.text: Wonderful atmosphere like being in old Mexico and good food although it's a bit pricey for Mexican food overall. Not their fault, just depending on the price point one is looking for.

TT8lnl5jlxvwrBuRnr_7sw.text: Amazing experience. Hector was our server and was so accommodating (even with my picky requests). Food was so extremely good! Perfectly seasoned and flavored. Highly recommend the lobster enchiladas.

Sd0LAM_GD3EXccPXislMZw.text: Good little Mexican restaurant great drinks great atmosphere and the staff was friendly. I think the food tastes good but had so many margaritas lol but it was a great night.

PEPVf8F0gZ4NEvGjDloV9g.text: Worst Mexican food I ever had . Bland tasteless , canned mushrooms . No seasonings at all .  You don't make enchiladas with flour tortillas. You should fire your chef . We won't be back . Better food at Roberto's And way overpriced !

yL5l0tTkESTYiSf5eUK9BA.text: 2 words Top Top great customer service and amazing food must try we got the fried ice cream carne chimi and the trio los panchos all excellent

RLutlmXhbGXVhPD7YCApxA.text: This is such a cool restaurant. I love the way it is decorated. The wait staff is friendly and attentive. The salsa had a nice kick. The margarita was strong. I really enjoyed the Steak Picado. The sauce was delicious. To top off a great meal, the free deep fried ice cream with check-in has me comatose now!

60yteRZVBMa-iQRN7Piamg.text: Bring your wallet! Just because this place is in Downtown Summerlin, they think they can get away with charging outrageous -- and I do mean OUTRAGEOUS -- prices for simple Americanized Mexican food. Yes, the restaurant is gorgeous inside, with colorful clay tiles and a fountain in the middle of the dining room, but they are putting the high cost of their primo real estate onto unsuspecting customers' backs.   I love Mexican food and Pancho's drew me in with an appealing menu. The first sign that this was going to be a disappointing meal was when the waiter brought out complimentary chips and salsa for the table. I judge a place by its chips, and these were pretty awful. They were cold, not salted at all, and honestly tasted like they were out of a big bag. They had to be. Ditto for the salsa, runny and bland and just gross. Pass.   Next up was the queso fundido with artichoke hearts. This tasted more like Paula Deen's artichoke dip than Mexican queso, so don't order this if you just want tasty melted cheese. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. Wouldn't get this again.   I was dining with two friends and one had a beef quesadilla with a margarita, and the other had fajitas. I ordered the Especial de Cabo. The food ranged from truly inedible to mediocre, and all of it was grossly overpriced (see the pattern here)? NOBODY was happy with their meal.   The kitchen was easy to work with and swapped out grilled vegetables for the rice, which I appreciated. The veggies were good and the flavor of the dish was acceptable, but what was so nasty was the huge puddle of water that settled into the bottom of my plate. It was extremely unpleasant to have to dig my food out of this murky water. The kitchen needs to do a better job draining the water and grease off of the food! As expected, my meal was very light on the meat (chicken breast, shrimp and crab meat -- it had like 3 shrimp total and one little scoop of crab meat), but there were at least some decent sized avocado chunks. This was a pretty good low carb dish in terms of creativity and flavor, but it was just too pricey for me to justify eating it regularly.    The biggest offense here is that the tortillas aren't homemade. Every good Mexican restaurant ought to make their own tortillas. (At least they brew their own iced tea, and it was delicious).   One friend ordered the fried ice cream for us to share and it was the superstar of the meal. But really, how can dessert NOT be delicious? I laughed at the miniature American and Mexican flags that were stuck in the top of our dessert because this had to be the most inauthentic Mexican meal I have ever had!   The service was abysmal too. We had to wait forever for drink refills and for the check, and our server brought out our queso appetizer without any chips or any plates, so we had to sit there while our queso got colder and colder. Epic fail on the inattentive service.   The three of us were left with disappointing meals and a disappointing experience all around and a whopping check for $165 for lunch. LUNCH! One hundred and sixty five dollars!!!! Talk about a genuine rip-off in the greatest sense of the word!  I won't be returning to Pancho's.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream for dessert was good. Flags made me LOL.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The total amount of crab in my lunch!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of Especial de Cabo.

2n0iTggmCIpkE2rinV9yEw.text: I'm giving Pancho's a 4 star rating because we did have a great experience. The staff was welcoming and informative, even management cake over and offered a money saving suggestion for next time. (Thanks Jimmy!)  My three littles each had enchiladas. They enjoyed them. No complaints.  I ordered Enchiladas de Avocado y Artichoke. It was lovely. Everything I could've hoped for after reading the description. My jalapeno margarita scored a 7/10.  Hubby enjoyed some steak tacos & a beer.   In addition to our entrees we also ordered a large Guac for the table. $15! I know we are in Summerlin but JESUS!  Our check came to $123. Roughly. Typically I wouldn't budget a dinner for the 5 of us for over $80. Fortunately I snagged a coupon for 1 free entree and left a $24 tip. So $130 out the door.  So to break it down for you: Expensive. Great service. Good quality (fresh) food. Don't expect authentic Mexican cuisine.  The restaurant itself is BEAUTIFUL.   We will probably avoid coming back with the littles and stick to the happy hour and bar areas for just the two of us. Big savings over there.

2ZQXAnujaWygxMrhe_LoTw.text: There must be a shortage of water at this place. It took almost twenty minutes to get a single cup. AND THEN the waiters would just run down the stairs with entire platters of steaming hot food and it made me scared! The paintings were creepy and looked like michael jackson! And when they FINALLY brought my water I didn't get a napkin with it! To conclude this review, my quesadillas were basically just soaked in grease to the point that I could barely eat them. And who puts garbanzo beans on a salad! my only compliments go to the pretty hostess. NEVER AGAIN!

oKd1gaV8kKTjvwNU4BYPTg.text: I grew up going to Old Town San Diego for some hearty (albeit touristy) Mexican food, which nevertheless, was always enjoyable. Pancho's looks like it belongs right in the heart of Old Town and it was a nice suprise that reminded me a little of home.   The ambiance is wonderful. You ffeel like you're sitting outside but not in the insufferable heat or wind that Vegas has. The servers running up and down the stairs was a little unnerving.  The food is a little pricier than Lindo (which was our previous preferred spot for disappointing Mexican food) but you're paying for ambiance, and for us, convenience. The service was very attentive and sincere.  We enjoyed the pescado ceviche (yum! - the more sour the better), Carne Asada quesdilla (meat was tender and flavorful), and the shrimp/crab enchiladas (I was so happy to be able to choose one of each!). For dessert we had the FREE... FREEEEEE fried ice cream! It was a good ending to our meal, especially since it was free (when you check in on YELP).   I wish they had horchata to round out my meal. They do have an extensive selection of spirits and cocktails which looked good.  I'll come back for sure! I'm always getting coupons for Panchos in the mail so even better!

lc4PTnNAmHmcs2DUKCrVxw.text: 5 stars well deserved!   So the ambience is great. 2 floors and beautiful decor. It was a nice surprise, as the outside does it no justice.  I was also impressed with the customer service. Our server Miguel, was very friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone who came by the table, whether it was for water or to pick up a dish, had a smile and was very pleasant.   The food was great. I had the shrimp fajitas. Lots of jumbo shrimp!   The combination plates are good too.  The prices were a bit High but you get what you pay for. Will be back.   I wish the staff here trained some of the other restaurants I've been too!

7k_dAADkFFWGbeUu-gZvzQ.text: Great atmosphere and great food! Came here for a reunion and was surprised after reading all the reviews.  The fajitas were delicious, better than any other restaurant in this town ( and I'm a 45 yr local) , service was spectacular and drinks were spot on!  Just know that Happy Hour is at the Cantina only.  Will definitely be back!!

v0y3-Y552WBX3_JNMeIedg.text: This is the second time I've "popped" into Panchos after waiting too long to eat and both times I've only sat in the bar (full disclosure). The first time was around Christmas 2018 when hubby and I stopped in for a few quick appetizers. It was such a great break. I thoroughly enjoyed the keyboard player entertaining the crowd with Christmas tunes. The second time I came with my daughter and we purposely sat in the bar again to enjoy the keyboard player again (I've come to know his name is Grant Peacock). HIs music is very entertaining and makes for a lively atmosphere while dining on DELICIOUS food! If you're looking for a weeknight evening out with food and music, Pancho's is definitely an option. My Carne Asada salad was perfection, the warm chips they serve are fantastic and the service was right on par. Pricing is a little on the higher side for a Mexican restaurant, I will admit. However, the quality and taste of the food, coupled with the entertainment, made my dollars well-spent. One of these days I'll actually sit in the restaurant, but for now the music is what captivates me each time. Oh and those chips! Go out and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vWPkdjwma6llwoD6g95h2A.text: This was my first time at Pancho's & I absolutely loved it! Our waiter Alfredo was awesome. He was personable, professional and on point! The customer service from the entire wait staff was on their A-Game. The bar tender Daniel was a mixologist & a great personality.  The food was amazing! The flat iron steak in the quesadilla was oh so tender & authentically flavorful. The chips were warm, lightly salted & salsa  refreshing. Eating their food was like a party in my mouth! From the food to the customer service to the decor & live music, I will be returning to this wonderful restaurant.

hy28pO4X--uQIHRnxft3Yg.text: Good food but not great, especially for the price.. There are so many of these fancier Mexican spots that all have that same americanized taste! Service was good and the ambiance is well executed, just not enough flavor and that's the most important part.

j3VnGMQPgbdkmUKibiq65w.text: Downtown Summerlin Pancho's is My new "go to" place!  Awesome atmosphere, delicious food, fabulous staff, kid friendly, and flowing champagne on Sunday! If you can...sit in Miguel's section and tell him Diego sent you! Especially if you have kids.  Live music every night and margaritas that will knock your socks off! Have fun!!

CpuwR8pWRBbu08mVoZWrxg.text: The food here was amazing!!! We had ceviche and quesadilla with beef!! My only complaint was the music was a bit loud. Definitely try to sit up stairs it's more intimate.

vaiOLIESm1AQs5GWV0dQPw.text: We (about 5 of us) had our first visit to Pancho's last week Saturday. It is a beautiful place inside and out. We decided to sit in the cantina for the live entertainment.   The food was a bit pricey but tasty. We ordered the queso fundido as an appetizer, seafood chimichanga, chicken chimichanga, seafood enchiladas, and langosta tacos. Our favorites were the queso fundido and their house salsa.    The singer/keyboardist was amazingly talented and takes requests. He was a total crowd pleaser.  We already have plans to go there again tomorrow night. We are looking forward to another Saturday evening of delicious food and fabulous entertainment.

rPkOywJW-m6TI9Batvr4rw.text: Free chips & salsa ***salsa was very good-spicy Food was also very good  Service also very good I would definitely come back here again ... Oh, and free ice cream with checkin. Don't think it could have been any better
