5iIB57KcvXJn4Wk7GsJOFA.text: Not a great meal.   The star is literally for the company and the nice looking building.    I was yet again disappointed in another execution of so called Mexican food and why they think it's acceptable to charge so outrageously for. It's not like you get gold plated beans served here. In my opinion you can't even call it Mexican just because you stuff a tortilla with rice and beans. Maybe we are actually helping to pay for the building, decor and uniforms.  I actually was whishing I was at Cafe Rio since at least their rice is eatable instead of hard grains that can do some real tooth damage.   The seafood burrito I ordered tasted like the seafood was one minute away from going bad.  It was just not okay by any stretch.  And it wasn't just my dish.  I think only 2 out of the 6 of us enjoyed their meal. The average isn't good.   The server was okay in the begining and just got mediocre towards the middle and unhelpful at the end. They seem to put more emphasis in replenishing the chips than anything else, but too bad I didn't come here for the chips.  I can't even take a risk coming back to try something else.  Also if paying $$ for Mexican food makes you think it is high end or of better quality maybe you need to try a $ Mexican food place and compare... just for kicks. Que mala comida sirven aqui. No costea, que lastima por querer aparentar tan prestigioso lugar.

XaOB1wd4MPi0lW2pCB7muA.text: I love eating at ponchos. I've eaten here so many times, really a lot. It's by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in las vegas. I grew up in summerlin and it's my favorite go to Mexican food craving  place. It's very pretty inside, also very clean and I've never had bad service there. I usually get the combination plate 2 beef tacos, it's very good. I get chips with the bean dip, it's very good. And I usually get the tres leche dessert, soo good. The wait staff is always very nice, I think overal they forgot my drink order one time.  And my food always comes out hot. It isn't priced cheap but in comparison it's not far off from the other Mexican restaurants in summerlin, and I don't mind paying a little more for the pretty ambiance, good food, and friendly wait staff. Also location is great in downtown summerlin, convienent, lots to do.

A604434ufjGjXkA__S-6QQ.text: Had to try it.  All the reviews were different and it was hard to determine if it was worth it. Well I loved it. Staff is warm and friendly.  Great food options and large menu.  Typical traditional Mexican food.  Very good.  I thought very flavorful. Tacos were great. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0wugYhOqj1annGkrRh4lSg.text: It's very rare for me to eat at a 3 star restaurant (yes, I am a food snob) but I will make an exception when it's a brand new restaurant.  I don't think it's fair to rush out to a brand new anything and expect it to be running like a well-oiled machine.  Everyone and everything is new and needs a little time to get acclimated as you do at a new job or at something you have never done.  I was willing to give them a chance and I'm glad I did.  I have been twice in the last week and both experiences were great.  The hostesses are warm and welcoming and get you seated fairly quickly.  I was able to make reservations which I always appreciate and they sat us before the entire party arrived which is a plus.  Both servers were attentive and got our orders correct.  The manager stopped by our table both times to make sure that all was well.    My husband really likes the cadillac margarita and the fajitas.  The queso is very different (cream cheese, cheese and artichoke hearts) but was very good.  You can't skip dessert at a Mexican restaurant...Flan, Tres Leches and Fried Ice Cream...oh yes!!!  I need a new paragraph for this item, the Carne Asada Quesadilla.  Oh my word!!  It happened to be cheat day and a quesadilla sounded delicious but it's hard to find a good one.  I couldn't be happier that I ordered one here.  The tortilla was super fresh, perfection really.  The cheese was plentiful.  Then there is the carne asada, oh man!  If you are a fellow quesadilla snob you know that your quesadilla could come out with big chunks of beef, no thank you, or fatty pieces of meat, um no, or hardly any meat at all, no bueno!  However, Pancho's has got it right with perfect small strips of super juicy carne asada with perfect flavor.  Oh man was it good!  Cheat day + Pancho's Carne Asada Quesadilla = One happy girl!  The prices reflect location, it's Summerlin!  If you live in Summerlin you are use to paying a higher price tag and if you are driving from afar you must realize you are driving to Summerlin.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diabla Shrimp, big shrimp and good flavor!

uTbX0-Co-Cpoa2DeDTuNNA.text: Weakest attempt at a Mexican restaurant. Chips taste like they come from a package rather than fresh. Top shelf margarita has a flavor like Pinesol smells. Others dishes were ok but nothing worth writing about. Add to that, irs expensive for what you get. I gave It a second star because the service people were nice and friendly. This was our first and last trip to Pancho's.

4p6VGBUMMcau-BdGm2gF3Q.text: Definitely the place to go if you are not that hungry and just want a beer and some appetizers.  Their chips and salsa are really good and the place is beautiful.   Their entrees are not good at all and they are very high priced.  My husband ordered a burrito and it was mush. A mushy $20 burrito.  I ordered the street tacos and had to send them back Then, I ordered the shrimp tacos. The tortilla was falling apart and they were just filled with lettuce. When I finally bit a shrimp, there was almost no seasoning so all I could taste was lettuce.  I ended up paying for a meal and not eating it. :(

m_c3PjRYFZlng0jgbmXBDg.text: Generous portions, great margs, speedy service and a fun atmosphere! Prices were a little high for the type of food but seemed normal for this area in general.

DMjLK6RX6nFlroeJxh9dwg.text: Ripoff with Coupons, 1.  soda $3.75, entries overprices by $5-7 so coupons of $16 are only really worth about $6. Food is nothing special. So you have to buy 2 drinks,  over charged $2.50, plus an extra $5-7 on meals so pass the so-call Mexican restaurant.

iFdFtpRR1ZEE38vns-bRaA.text: I am writing this the day after my less than stellar dining experience and I am still annoyed.    I feel like a sucker for ignoring the overwhelmingly negative reviews of this place and giving them a chance.   The short version is that this place sucks. Horrible food. Mediocre service and exorbitant pricing.  I promise you any other Mexican restaurant is better than this place.  EvenTaco Bell has better food  Consider yourself warned; don't waste your time or money on this poor excuse of a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s the next day and I am still annoyed with my abysmal Pancho&#39;s experience.

xgaJ0m4KxNbfasDwvRFmOA.text: New place! New vibes! Familiar tastes...  I've been watching this building come together for months so I was super excited to finally walk through the beautiful doors.   When it comes to first impressions, it was love at first sight. A major wow factor! Whoever designed this place deserves 5 stars. They brought the beauty of Mexico to us in Vegas! It reminded me of the movie ~ Original Sin with Angelina Jolie.   I do have one note about the design and that's the little room behind the beautiful staircase. I highly suggest that room is used for private parties & events only because customers don't get the True experience sitting there. We were guided over to it and I said no way, then we were sat in the lovely courtyard & I couldn't get enough of that space! Art, central fountain & greenery surrounded us and I loved it all.   The service was fantastic & I'm even going to give a shoutout to Jason who took great care of us and was also very sweet & funny.   The food was good, not amazing. I've definitely had better but everything also tasted better sitting in this space. We also only tried one thing but that's how it goes sometimes. We ordered the enchiladas de Langosta which were filled with lots of luscious lobster. Prices are high here but they definitely didn't gip us on the seafood. I also need to add that the portions are HUGE. We shared and couldn't even finish everything.   The black beans lacked in flavor & were a tad undercooked. The green rice was perfect and the creamy chipotle sauce was super rich, a tad too rich for me. Overall it was good but not amazing. I needed bolder flavors but I'm still interested in going back & trying something else. The menu itself offered a lot of classics & a few unique dishes so it'll have something for everyone.

FJIQBfbUYZt2-Ya7FVBjdg.text: Went here for lunch the other day & I loved it! Our waiter was friendly & the restaurant decor was very nice & festive. The food was delicious & the servings were very large. We ended up needing to go boxes because we couldn't finish. Our entrees came with fruit & we got free chips & salsa before our meal came out. Our waiter even gave us a free dessert to sample afterwards! We all left very full & satisfied!

ub9FEO2FBRlY_lypr3zDTA.text: This little jewel is a fabulous destination, a favorite of mine when visiting Las Vegas. Great location, the decor is so charming you feel like you are in your Abuelitta's kitchen. This visit I had the Burrito Carnitas Especial, and fried ice cream. Excellent vegan and vegetarian choices! Our sever Miguel was the best! Do yourself a favor and pay them a visit!

TYLYsT40u_O_nAvR8kFrCg.text: So this place is super expensive.  If you want "blow your socks off" Mexican food then don't go to this place.  The restaurant does have a cool atmosphere, and I was super excited to try it but honestly I was disappointed in the food for the price.  Also guacamole for $15?! that better be made with avocados with gold in the center.  The margaritas were tasty but again I think I would rather stick to Macayos than frequent this place.

euh5RN_5sIs0_AXKTnt6tg.text: Wow. Incredible design and amazing ambiance. My wife and I were seated fast and next to a water fountain! Salsa was on point and tortilla soup was great to. My wife had ceviche and I am chimichanga, fish was fresh and the chicken seasoned well. Best of all MR. Doug Was a wonderful host.  I'll def be back.

tnwmm7VjwPqBmnomYf5MVA.text: It's a beautiful restaurant with a nice, semi romantic ambiance. Our server, Ivan, was really good, attentive, charming and gave great recommendations for cocktails and food. Complimentary chips with a spicy red salsa and warm chips were an awesome start. I got the chimichanga de mar, grilled shrimp, onions, pico and I think it had cheese and maybe a little rice in it, really liked it but it was huge so I have leftovers. We will definitely go back, our bill was 71 with a $15 tip so just a little expensive but worth it for a nice date or family dinner. It was my boyfriend and I,  we each got a house cocktail and an entree.

ZUCTA5iQnebbq_3qHLAPHg.text: The food at this location is fantastic. The service however was horrible! Our waiter was ok but the bartender serving us was a total snob and downright rude!!! It's a shame because it is a lovely location. Need to hire people with a personality!!!!

ONTCLCzJ6uveqfcM91LLDw.text: I've wanted to try them since they opened up but just never got the chance to.. we finally tried them last night and i was a bit disappointed. Our waiter was great he was very nice and didn't leave us waiting too long before checking if we needed anything, he even comped us the tortilla soup, however, for the price of the food, I don't think it's worth it. It wasn't very flavorful, I had the diablo puffy tacos and it wasn't spicy at all. Great environment though!

6dgGpNtsQlv55-Ewi05Z5Q.text: Located in the Summerlin shopping area by Trader Joes, Pancho's offers good Mexican food and a nice atmosphere.  After a 20 minute wait on a Friday night, our buzzer went off and we were seated at our table of 7. Our waiter came over to deliver chips and salsa, take our drink orders and answer questions. My hubby rapped in Spanish with him after noticing some food item mentioned Tijuana and really the food origin was Mexico City.  After discovering the waiter and us had lived very close to one another in Mexico City, he brought us over guacamole. Delish!!!  Food items ordered; chicken fajitas (very good, mushrooms with onions and sliced bell peppers), chicken mole (good), a mixed pork and chicken platter (said to be tasty) and chicken tacos and a taco salad for the kids (all said to be very good). It's definitely not "authentic" Mexican, it's that Americanized Tex-Mex, but it's still good. The prices are a bit steep, but that's to be expected in this area of Summerlin. Total bill for 7, 4 kids meals, 3 adults, no cocktails was $145, tip not included. We ordered cocktails at the bar, 2 beers and a vodka-club was $40-ish.  Service was amazing, drinks refilled immediately and our waiter and multiple bussers came to add drinks, clear plates, etc.  We lied and said it was our friend's bday and could they sing happy bday to him. They came over at the end of the meal and gave him fried ice cream, put on the sombrero and sang. Oh, the stupid stuff we do for a 40 second laugh... We're lame.... Yesterday we had our Super Bowl party catered by Pancho's; platters of chicken enchiladas, carne asada, marinated chicken, rice, beans, chips,salsa, very good!  Will definitely return to Pancho's when we need our Mexican food fix.

q7qHxukzt1HJ12D5n0Jo4g.text: This place is beautiful, bright and airy. Service staff is professional and very nice. Our busser was outstanding. Our food came out lightning speed. Everything was my liking but the Food.  It's so sad they can't serve better food.  I don't mind paying little more for the better location, the better service and the BETTER FOOD! We ordered the tacos, enchiladas, tamales, salad and guacamole and none of them are up to par. They are not bad, just not that good. It's a shame.  Five stars for the service and the  atmosphere and three stars for the food.

9fLH1FNuV0uMaczHrkypFg.text: I feel like the food has decreased in quality and taste.  I had the birria today and though I wasn't expecting it to be authentic taste, I did expect the cilantro and onion to be fresh.  The tortillas were a little stale too.  Our server was excellent though, kudos to her, she seemed to be working way too many tables but still kept her composure and smile.

waiNzE4uO_cq4J6CNcLq0w.text: Excellent food and service!!! Claudia was exceptional!!!  The atmosphere was amazing!!  I will be back!!!

NeQdNqQrQ895K9q0IGq66Q.text: Best place to eat real Mexican Food in Las Vegas.  Miguel was our waiter and gave us excellent service. Would recommend to anyone that goes to Las Vegas.

v1-JlCWA-RDS1Bm82ve4yg.text: Let me tell you about panchos.   Firstly the ambiance is amazing. They had a live band playing and they were awesome. Playing a great variety of music beautifully. We were sat next to the water fountain and it was beautiful.   Secondly the wait staff. Jose was our main waiter but every single person who passed our table took a brief moment to check on us. Whether it be to fill our drinks or ask about the food. You can tell they all have each other's back.   Third the food, it was amazing. And print. We sat at 645 and they had out food to us by 7 and that's with us not knowing what to order!   It was a little pricey but it was so very worth it.

rbB7-GMrW2WR-jqM0dYbKw.text: Well just tried this place because of location.  Took the wife and kids.  Service was horrible.  So slow for a Tuesday night..Food is over priced and lacking flavor and any heat.  Which you'd expect for a Mexican restaurant. $10 kids meal for a crappy cheese quesadilla.. yeah no thanks.  Even the kids can make better ones at home. Plenty of other places that are happy to get my money.  $141 for 2 adults and 4 kids...will never be back!!!!

g3GV3wZdUlQMfCJM7S5j6g.text: Life is about managing expectations and mine were too high before going to Ponchos.  I don't get it.    Place is beautifully appointed with the upscale Mexican decor and vibe, staff was attentive and friendly.  I am never insulted by prices, but for the food and drink I received, I noticed no difference in my culinary experience than I would not have found at Lindo Michocan down the street.  My fish tacos and refried beans were good, but I felt they were the exact same quality I could get other places.   Sure my fish tacos came on a lovely Michael Aram looking silver platter, sure the staff checked on us attentively a dozen times in the hour we were sitting there, sure this location in the Summerlin hot spot of Downtown Summerlin, but the quality of food is nothing off the charts to warrant the price nor my return visit.  I am not saying I would not ever go back, but if given a choice, I would choose not to and go elsewhere.

3TNesUV60tWaQKDubLOaDA.text: Horrible, horrible... horrible!! Over priced and not good. I ordered the tortilla soup that is $8 assuming is was more that just a cup of soup. And I got the smallest cup of soup.   They only have 2 types of margaritas and we all ordered different flavors and they all tasted the exact same. Nothing about them was "peach" or "banana" flavored and they are $12 each. I would just order a classic margarita if you go. I know you can get a better margarita at Applebee's for half the price too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8 tortilla soup (it&#39;s a cup)

vAT6KeKPYPOH2hLx7LKZwQ.text: This is an awesome Mexican restaurant.  Great ambience. Great food. Great service.  The Especiale is our favorite.  Love their salsa.  We are from Texas and have searched for a place like this since we moved here in 05.  Try it. You will love it.

cu_nptPxDPqhGNP7Qk6qyA.text: Ambience was great.  Food was just okay. No real flavor. Just spice.  Expensive. I ordered a chicken plate for 16.99 and it was mainly rice and beans. Maybe had 6 small chunks of chicken. They forgot my soup that was supposed to be included. No lunch special deals.  Service was okay. They didn't refill our waters when empty. Service was on the slow side.  The place is nicely decorated. I really enjoyed he atmosphere. Too bad on the rest of our experience.

CHMKCprgPXatvMt-8Djxyw.text: I will never return to this restaurant ever again. 2nd try and it was awful.  The food is just boring. The decor is the only thing this place has going for them.  The 'street tacos' had zero flavor. The shrimp puffy tacos were absolutely disgusting. The 'puffy taco' was cardboard. I'm convinced they put cardboard under a heat lamp then put it on my plate. This is just sad and I really wanted to give this place the benefit of the doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Diablo puffy tacos
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor Tijuana

rqlygi_h0FulVOPE8amtQA.text: I always bring home my leftovers, but rarely eat them.  This time, I not only ate them, but was sad that I didn't leave more.  I had the Ranchero burrito with shredded beef and pinto beans.  I really enjoyed it!  The chips and salsa they brought to the table when we first sat down were perfect!  And I'm very picky with my chips & salsa.  My son ordered the beef taco salad, and enjoyed it as well!  I will be going back very soon.

PpDvZgxHFeneQnuHsgQskA.text: To start off, this place is gorgeous very nice seating area and the fountain was a nice touch. As  for the services, the server didnt know much about some of the entrees and also couldnt say what the names were. The food was alright. I ordered the carne asada burrito but was told they dont have that... odd right? Anyways they have a philly burrito (Which is the equivalent to a carne asada burrito but they failed to mention that) Presentation of the dish was nice but quality of the food lacked, the meat wasnt seasoned per "carne asada" just tasted like peppered steak.  Drink selection was pretty basic, didnt have any common "mexican" drinks  Prices???? Extremely expensive for what you are getting. In my honest opinion it is a bad replica of Lindo Micohacon.  Wont be returning.

A3iplYgecxpFVSpN_pjSHQ.text: Pancho's always delivers tacos are great with fresh ingredients each time I have been in.  The fried ice cream is yummy.

NwSZvZTola5ut_rROJtNdg.text: Average food, but great service. Be sure to make a reservation as this place gets packed...as evident on a Thursday night with every table full. I hosted a group of clients and everyone enjoyed themselves. Beautiful decor, especially the downstairs area with fountain.

YsOfMyoTdHnVeIxpOozLgw.text: Very surprise of how wonderful this place is, highly recommend for family or a date Dinner. Food was tasty delicious, defiantly going back again.

RubtzhUvhynfRSVpEwbo0w.text: Very surprised that Pancho's is not rated better overall! An absolutely beautiful and pristine restaurant, friendly professional staff, and delicious food! We had tortilla soup, chicken mole,chile rellenos, margaritas, and the brownie desert. Everything delicious and perfect!  Half of us are local and half are regulars at Red Rock; we will DEFINITELY be back!

BcJrR-RdFUFm09B4SzZxzw.text: We're happy hour super fans!   Service and food are consistent. Nine out of ten times we get the Botanas appie and a couple drinks each. Prices are reasonable and servers are attentive, but leave you to enjoy your food and drink.  I start thinking about this place on Wednesday for our happy hour Friday!

WpSaxLoeqoS2ZaQDClgbTA.text: My husband is from Manhattan Beach and grew up on Pancho's! We were so pumped when we moved here and live next to one!  This location is awesome! The staff is AMAZING and CONSIDERATE! I love places where the staff takes the time to be kind and explain the menu all the way! The food is WOW! If you love authentic Mexican food, go here! The experience and quality of food makes us always come back!  Yum!!!!!

uBHS95J_SSHrbZDir2vtfg.text: Nice atmosphere, good food, more of a fine Mexican food which is fine every now and then. Staff is always friendly. A nice place for a date night with your spouse.

yik0ccG-zPTUZVqUHn710A.text: Panchos Located in Downtown Summerlin Las Vegas NV.  Gorgeous Mexican Restaurant!! Beautifully Decorated Throughout.  Super Staff! Friendly and Efficient   Appetizers Are Really Good- note- Get The shredded beef nachos ;)  Atmosphere is perfect for a family gathering or a nice dinner for two.   Dinner was pretty good. Our waitress Carrissa was extremely professional, friendly and offered Wonderful customer service. That is ALWAYS a  plus when you go out to eat!  Our Appetizer (Shredded Beef Nachos) came out promptly. It was more than enough for the 3 of us to share.   The shredded beef was really good and the nachos had an exact amount of cheese, shredded beef, jalapenos ratio going on to make it a delicious meal within itself.  My enchilada sauce was a bit different. Not quite red, not quite brown basically a combo of the two colors. It wasn't hot at all. Maybe it was tex-mex? I'm not sure. I personally did not care for it. I think I will go with a Verde next time.    Husband had a shredded beef burrito which was delicious minus the cheese sauce NO BUENO. It wasn't good at all.   Personally, I believe, if the sauces were changed it would help the dish be the amazing dish is was meant to be!! Nothing can kill a dish more than a  meh- nah sauce that drowns out the delicious flavors under it. For now,  I recommend skipping the sauces. Just my opinion of course.   In all fairness- My suggestion is that  I  would love to see this restaurant create another Red Chile sauce. You know more traditional Mexican Red Chile Sauce please :)   Beans and rice were pretty good.  Based on Location, Atmosphere, Customer Service, And Delicious Appetizers I Would Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panchos Menu Located in Downtown Summerlin Las Vegas NV
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panchos Located in Downtown Summerlin Las Vegas NV
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panchos Located in Downtown Summerlin Las Vegas NV

W4gJOREy-Ve4HbYiidILHw.text: This was my third visit here. First one was a delite with my granddaughter for lunch. The second was a 70th birthday celebration and we enjoyed the atmosphere food and service for our party of 40. Very disappointed today. We had a party of 10 family members. Two were traveling so we picked here to meet. Upon my arrival I was told they had been waiting 10mins....then we waited another 20 mins. We were told they were waiting for a table to leave so they could sit us all together. After 30+ minutes we then asked if we could sit in the bar area since some of our party was on lunch break from work. So we entered the bar area ,we moved our tables together and the bar tender now had a large paty to help!!!. She managed to serve us on her own, unlike the large dining room couldn't handle us.

mIFEW32wMZkB_ota0WtceQ.text: The salsa was tasty.  My husband has the carne asada taco plate. He said they were awesome. I had the pork carnita plate. The carnitas were on the dry side, but still had flavor. The beans were amazing.  Its hard to get food refried beans! There was a keyboard player in the bar entertaining us.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.  The food was on the pricy side though.

rL3oAEHu-Ln-8smHbtWFlg.text: Absolutely horrible! The place was dirty. The metal stand that my fajitas came out on had never been cleaned and was caked with old rotten food and sauces. The plates, when they came out, looked like a cheap 90s era platter from a chain. The rice was dry, the guac was old and already turning colors. The chicken in my fajitas was gross, it tasted like it had been cooked in old lemon juice and dirty water. I got super sick after eating here. And the cost of this place makes no sense for what you get. I do not recommended this place to anyone. Never eat here!

DmOvvwvUHeheeUlzmAbb9Q.text: Excellent Enchiladas De Mar I had , 6 oz. if wine Cabernet was not the best I won't have that again. Otherwise a great experience. Ambiance excellent deco great a lot of wasted space bar area great for eating and watching sport tv small stage for maybe a small guitar group that plays Spanish flamenco during early evening. I will ask others of my family and extended family to come hang and eat the food enjoy the ambiance I know they will experience the different food and let you know what they experienced

YIDEW1LJW_K_y8qxdKn3hg.text: Can you say overrated? Can you say expensive? That is exactly what I think about when I think of Pancho's. Don't get me wrong it's nice as heck in there, but not worth the prices. I been to Pancho's about 4 times and I'm just shocked on why it's so expensive.   I ordered some carne asada tacos and it only came with two ok size tacos for 17 bucks! You get the other nonsense like beans and rice. Let's be honest we are there to eat the tacos not the beans. I thought they gave you soup with every meal, that isn't True. So why is it so expensive for some decent tacos!   You get chips & salsa which is always nice. If they ask you for guacamole say NO it's 9 bucks! The food flavor is just normal. Trust me the only thing that stands out with this place is the scenery inside. Not worth the price for average tasting food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XED8UT2Zc_Ww6XySwKr7Yw.text: Portion here is very large. Enough to share depending on your appetite and choice of food. You wouldn't think that this place is big from the outside. Love the atmosphere and the balcony. Lots of places to sit. The waiters are very friendly. Try the Cadillac. It's very strong and very worth it.

vqPX_odeBZHilzPdHu_jwA.text: Just OKAY. The restaurant itself is really nice but you can definitely tell who it caters to.. as if the location wasn't enough. So the food just isn't anything WOW or worth trying again. The staff was very nice. Everything is clean. But at the end of the day it's about the food, am I right!?? And the food just didn't wow me. It stays busy.. again location. Simply not worth the wait.

vTNG0XINEPMA3uz98ldW5Q.text: I went here with a group of friends last night. The place has a good Mexican feel with the decorations. The meals are very overpriced with what you get and the food is okay and not the best tasting. It doesn't taste like authentic Mexican food. Customer service was mediocre. Also some of us had the yelp free cream deal and the waiter wouldn't give it to everyone that had it. He limited our table so we were upset about that. I got the lobster enchiladas and within a few hours I spent most of my night and morning throwing up and in the bathroom. It was one of the worst experience in my life. I called the manager the next day and her name is Mallory and she said she would check into the expiration date of the lobster and she apologized and said that there has not been any experiences of any food poisoning or anyone reporting any sickness and that it was probably just my stomach. I felt that was bad customer service. She said she hopes I come back and did not offer anything else. It was the only thing I ate that day all day and I know that was what made me sick. So this is why am rating them only one star and I will not be back to this place at all. Check other reviews on this site because there is a lot of bad reviews about this restaurant also about the over pricing and the taste of their food and other people getting sick. I've been a manager for over 20 years of my life and I would've accommodated my customers better than she did. She was not very nice on the phone and accommodating at all and she made me feel like it was my stomach and not her food.

92c2zzLsUYYjA6BvWdr6-w.text: Have seen this Mexican restaurant in Downtown Summerlin for a year or two but hadn't been compelled to try it. Well ... today we went about 2:00 for a late lunch.  We had the Chili Verde meal and a Carne Asada Salad. Both entrees were very good. Generous portions and quite tasty. Fairly authentic Mexican (not overly Americanized). Complimentary chips and salsa provided at the table. Service was prompt and courteous. Prices are reasonable but not cheap. We will definitely be back when we are again hungry for Mexican food.

RlxD9IazSt4rftRCbjb08g.text: Let me start with the good. The atmosphere was warm and inviting as were the staff. By this account I was expecting to have some great authentic style Mexican food. What we got was anything but authentic. The tortilla/ chicken soup and the abondigas  soup tasted like they were made from the same soup base. The flour tortillas were horrible store bought. The Spanish rice was bland and the frejoles de la ollia.  Were straight out of a can.  The sopas were marginal at best. I've had better "Mexican" food at taco bell. Very over priced for store bought food. Very disappointing.

kR0QOE5peyHha-YXzJLpAQ.text: Man today we stumbled up Panchos and I wish I had tried this place out sooner.. we discovered it from the directory in downtown summerlins shopping area but decided to try to check this place out . It is in the parking lot where Trader Joe's is and has lots of parking .  Upon entry I fell in love with the decor ..  We were here around lunch time and had Agustin as our server he was super friendly . Their menu is large and it isn't "cheap" which I admit at first alarmed me but let me tell you the quality of the food definitely made up for the cost .  We got our free chips and salsa and chowed those down a long with our Diet Coke which came with a little pitcher that lasted our whole meal . It's a pet peeve of mine to run out of soda so I was stoked about that .. I definitely saw tons of stuff on the menu I wanted but opted to let our server choose by asking his favorite item on the menu .  Just my luck he loved the Philly Cheesesteak Burrito and helped my Mom pick this chicken and mango salad and they both were awesome . Which was delivered to our table with a smile and friendly greeting from Gustavo.  The steak was super tender and the veggies delicious but not too over powering and the red sauce on top was top  notch neither of us could finish our whole portion but man did we try! I tasted the salad my mom GoT and the chicken was really flavorful and not chewy and the greens and fruit were super fresh it had mango and grapes and pepita seeds ? I think but either way it was yummy!  If you check in here you can currently get a free fried icecream but we were too full to try it out ..  Over all for $40something we got two sodas and entrees and could of had dessert.. but even Hector was super friendly while clearing our table ...  When we were leaving I stopped to take pictures of the bar area ... guess who else is super nice??? Daniel the bartender who wanted to pose for a photo and who comes around the corner ? My server Agustin to joke around saying I don't want one of him..  It's clear to me this place employs the right people who must have good management keeping them happy .. definitely can't wait to come try some margaritas and happy hour specials

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LPWPYgnF35JjUCafnopDPA.text: I would give this restaurant more of 3.5 stars. Wonderful ambience, decor etc. Food was good, just not my favorite taste. They brought a small pitcher of Dr Pepper to our table which was great! The salsa was thin. Chips okay. Lots of cheese in the cheese enchiladas. My husband got the taco salad and loved it!

AKm_VWq0WKSii1du5dGlzw.text: The prices have gone up, way too high for what you get.  A taco salad with about a tablespoon of chicken is not acceptable.  You can use a coupon that is sent through the mail, however, you have to purchase two drinks and they are pricey too.    Food is tasty enough, staff is efficient enough, but there are too many other choices for Mexican food that is just as good and reasonably priced.

prjExKG1ESlY1yuPLjN6iw.text: Great food and drinks. The happy bar scene is exciting and full of energy. Try the trio dish you won't be disappointed

vvYK4FOiHOwMqWkGb8r8TQ.text: No lunch specials and well overpriced.  Very nice decor inside and I'm sure it's in an expensive rent area, but $4 for a soda and no a la carte menu puts a lunch with two chicken enchiladas at $25 per person.  I can go to almost any other Mexican restaurant in Vegas for lunch for $15.

XPCshtuEUsFCksLeMm3syQ.text: Nice atmosphere and great location.  However, overpriced, $40 for lunch for two. Complimentary chips and salsa were very good.  Entrees mediocre at best. Hubby had Tacos de Carnitas. Meat was obviously overcooked, dried out and looked like yesterday's leftovers.  We will not be back.

Ie0yxD987GeZ45_armxCgw.text: Oh, brother.  We live nearby and friends invited us to join them.  We had a reservation and did not have to wait on a Saturday evening.   The place was PACKED and SO LOUD we couldn't even carry on a conversation.   The prices are outrageous and the food average.  The drink prices are crazy-high as well.  We will never return.  There are SO many good Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas I really don't see why anyone would go here, but to each his own, as "they" say...

SwvLR6G-hXEhB9i_mEGFIA.text: The place is beautiful but the food was obviously canned sauces, beans, and lacked flavor. Way over priced. Al a cart tacos is more expensive than a meal and they are regular sized tacos 3 for $20. The Camarones a la Diabla was enchilada sauce poured on top of shrimp. Not good. No drink menu... the response was "it's like an open bar so just ask for something and we'll see if we can make it. " Wife asked for a Paloma which is a simple tequila drink. Didn't offer choice of tequila and it came with a very low quality well tequila called Zarco. Drink was horrible. My wife asked for a spicy red salsa and the manager came back with a bottle of Tapatio and a bottle of Louisiana hot sauce then explained that the Tapatio is good hot stuff! It's to bad because the place is very nice but we will not go back. I don't like writing bad reviews but I felt I had to. We love trying new places but we were disappointed.

y9zqtAcr4yy-Y42xtMV9Vw.text: the only star I am giving to this restaurant is for our waitress, she was very nice. The food was nothing special and they are very proud of it because the prices here are insane for the quality of the food. The "front desk" service first put us in a table in front of the kitchen exit, not a place to have a table and I asked her to give us another table, so she moved us to upstairs and the table was almost in the middle of the hallway next to the stairs railing... well half of it. Restaurants are planned to sit people comfortable... here you have the feeling they are trying to add as many tables as they can. We are not coming back because 2 Magueritas (not impressed at all both with size and taste) one appetizer (they basically warmed up CREAM cheese... yes cream cheese, and diced up some jalapenos and called that a cheese dip) a Taco salad and a quesadilla for $80.00 it is to much.. We normally have the same stuff on other competitor's locations and we don't spend more than $50... with more volume, and the most important... wayyyyyyy better food, with very comfortable tables.

MrLTYRPyUQcsLAzW17p2Bg.text: The ambiance of this place was great! (The only great thing about this place.)The service was terrible (we waited 15 minutes before our server even took our drink order)! The food was average at the very best and extremely overpriced. Small family of 4 with two kids meals and a taco salad and burrito was $80! No alcohol no appetizers. Not worth it. Likely won't be back.

XjhriH9TiEors4PNX3hdsw.text: Decor and atmosphere was very nice. I didn't like the tortilla chips they served bec they were too thick; made them hard to chew on. The food was good but overpriced. Considering the location, I guess they have to charge more to pay for rent. I don't know how long they can survive when appetizers start around $13 and main course is $18-20. I mean guacamole dip was $13..isn't that pricey for guacamole? I don't think I would go back just bec of the price.

YerdMMHQ5fiw78QuiMbq8g.text: Loved the food, yet pricey for Mexican food in Las Vegas.  Also, they need to make the soda drinks much larger.  We will be back.  We had no alcohol and are lunch bill was $49 before a tip.

68Xggz0e4CUwGiV03ysl8g.text: While it is a nice looking restaurant, the food is run of the mill Tex Mex that you can get anywhere. The only difference is that at Pancho's, the food is double the price. The drinks were good and I may go back for happy hour, but I cannot recommend this place. I would be really surprised if they survive another year.

Vco5NWzfbNj5IyHh2C8u2Q.text: Food was decent... But are you serious with your prices, Panchos???  $15 for guacamole!!  Expect to pay at least $18 per item (even an appetizer or salad)... Ridiculous.

M1GT2zmHmTev4GOAqsrlFA.text: Extremely slow service - very pricey- food was tasty. Will not return unless prices become more in line with surrounding Mexican restaurants. Try Frank & Finas or Flaming Fajitas. More reasonable comparable food.

NKd-VrFQCWshivsw3xV_UQ.text: My husband and I went in Sunday at 3 for a late lunch. We're always excited about a new Mexican restaurant and we love downtown Summerlin. The party in front of us left after speaking to the hostess, we were then told the wait was at least 1 1/2 hours. I could understand this with a newly opened restaurant but there were many open tables in the dining area and only 1 small party waiting in lobby area. If they are short staffing so soon after opening shame on them. Two other  parties left after being told the same thing. Not a good first impression, we will not waste our time again!

RIxZE3cI5c-CUUdMHk02pQ.text: The service was good, the bar was nice, but the food was not worth the cost. They brought us three flower wraps with a fajita dish the wife and I were sharing and charged us $3 dollars extra when we asked for a couple more. Go to Lindo's!!!! So much better!

9nV7JHawclx4SfHn95dajQ.text: Boooomb food! The Chicken Chimichanga was perfect, the Rajitas came out sizzling and the Philly Burrito was fully loaded. You definitely get your money's worth!

shdOzb-mP3BnQvMeUbm_cg.text: Food was amazing and worth the spend! Staff is hot! Service was fantastic. The band in the cantina was rockin!!! I'll def be back. My new fav spot in DT Summerlin.

bUkgspDs6fObvHFpMT9siw.text: Way over-priced.  Took the fam there...I didn't know the hi$tory of this place so I was surprised by the prices.  As soon as I saw the menu, I felt guilty for wearing shorts and not a suit, but the staff were nice to us anyway.  It's beautiful inside; the decor is great, but I agree w/ another review that it seemed a bit cluttered w/ tables which took away from the aesthetics a bit.  The food was good.  Better than your typical Mexican restaurant, but still not worth the price they charge.  I'll be surprised if they make it w/out lowering prices, who knows though, maybe there's a niche of rich people who like overpaying for ok food and passing up better restaurants in the area.  Supply and demand I guess, so I'm probably wrong.  BTW while we were there, 2 different families came in, sat down looked at the menu (prices), and got up an left.

x0TF_HiwLjm-Q8pjiLca7g.text: Since when is it appropriate for wait staff to be taking shots on the job?  Two very large shots within 20 minutes. By the time we left she was very obviously feeling tipsy.  I see a drunk waitress as Huge liability, but maybe that's just me.  All this while myself and others around me sat neglected with empty beverage glasses?  Food was ok but not worth the price my any means.   The service was ridiculous.

OwmVmALTIWVhshvm8lvaQQ.text: Tried this place three times. Food is ok, nothing special.  Way overpriced.

KcpFOUdjuR1RxYV1ZKVbkQ.text: Nice new interior and attentive staff.  I agree with many of the other reviewers; the prices are a bit steep for just average Mexican food.  Our party of 2 had one Margarita, one soda,  a shared appetizer, a taco entree and a fajita entree.  The bill including tax and tip was over $90; a bit high for the type and quality of food.  It was not bad and we will probably return but just not a WOW.  Also, this is an aside and perhaps just an issue for that evening but the bus staff was constantly bringing rolling carts of bus trays, glasses and dishes thru the main restaurant.  Our table was right in their path so we were constantly looking at carts of serving and kitchen supplies as were dining.  Again, maybe this was temporary but kind of odd to have bus bins 2 feet from your entree.

wXIZLzqHvsn7Tr5FS-Q_rw.text: Yummy yummy margarita. Little pricy but got a free fried ice cream with checkin. Had the enchilada trio. Well worth it.

pjcNZAR-_dGx_nMi--nwTQ.text: The atmosphere is great, as was the service. Unfortunately the food was just OK. Looks appetizing but lacks flavor and skimpy on the meat. Definitely overpriced for what it is. I hope the quality of the food improves because appreciate the attention they have given to everything else.  Until then, go to Mo's or Zaba's if you are at Downtown Summerlin and have a taste for Mexican food.

9uhrJ3yYUeJ42ApNs_Rq2w.text: This is really a 4.5! Pancho's was great. Nice place and great service. We had a party if 11 and there was plenty of room and the room were sat in was nice and loud like we are. Food was great with large portions and good flavor but is overpriced slightly. I recommend the shrimp and crab quesadilla and enchiladas deal mar!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas deal Mar

gQGT_VUYCI_HSSlexFrWVg.text: This place decor is awesome, those staircase are everything , service was really good Claudia was very helpful on suggestions  for us decide what to get, food was average Mexican gringo food! One thing I notice is on the menus they said the have Wahoos fish tacos! I wonder what Wahoos think of that.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diabla shrimp tacos! Nom noms!

fDUbYZhiH7IHCuFV878TeA.text: Best Mexican in Vegas. I asked to go there for my birthday Twice in the same week. I had seven people mad at me because it was 30 minutes away. But when we got there and saw the food they all told me it was a good choice. I loved the one in Manhattan Beach Ca. and they didn't disappoint and even had some of the same employees from Ca.. I see people complain about the price but the portions are really BIG. You can easily split a burrito and it would be plenty for 2 people. They also have a huge bar.

9H_US2CNH0l8A-2TR2oPyw.text: My wife and I were very impressed with the atmosphere and their staff.  Especially the server, she was very good. It's just not worth anything close to what they charge. Too expensive for the caliber of food.  Very basic dishes and not much flavor.  We just moved to the area so their mailer brought the restaurant to our attention.  I'm not looking to impress anyone.  Just looking to relax and have a good healthy meal, so atmosphere is less important. That being said I think I would rather go to Sharky's or Wahoo's for the quality of food and it's a fraction of the price. We were looking forward to becoming regulars because of their first impression but I think we decided to cross it off our list since the food is what really matter.

ld8sr8GNmivCWOPQDeIAqQ.text: Ugh, enough of the 7 nights a week live entertainment. Shit fire I can't hear myself think.  The Whitney Huston cover music really, really does not fit in.  Ah hell....! $6.50 for a Corona...!  Come on guys.  The staff was great, the food pretty good, but damn, $80 with tip for 2 people.    No bueno.

hbwPZ9oQGiUu-w9AX2yGZA.text: First time here... Food was fantastic!!!! Very cool decor inside, tables are spread apart so there is a sense of privacy!  Lunch crowd wasn't too bad although I felt like the food could have been served faster.  Service was great and everyone was so friendly and on top of it. Highly recommend "Birria Chef Ramon".... Delish

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco&#39;s La Pastor
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birria Chef Ramon (Sooooo good)

JLX3W5dOkc0Og-iL4wG3LQ.text: Came here for the first time cause we felt like some New Mexican food. Was greeted by very friendly staff and even more friendly Restaurant manager! Was taken care of the entire time by an attentive staff. Will definitely be recommending this place to friends and family! Food is a little pricey, but delicious nonetheless and made up for it in taste. You get free chips and salsa with your meal which is rare at a lot of Mexican restaurants nowadays.

w23e3oAueIM8iArY4szakA.text: I REALLY wanted to like Pancho's. We have always had a great experience at the Manhattan Beach location and loved going there. It has been several years since we have been back but at this location prices seemed a bit high even given the location.   The first negative sign was when we nearly finished our chips and salsa before our order was even taken. The second negative was when I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and never received it. After our main entrees arrived I mentioned this to our server and he apologized and later gave an additional discount which was very nice. The last negative was food quality. Let's be honest, most Mexican sit downs seem to taste the same unless they have a signature stand out dish/item, or the style of cooking/preparation is different. Pancho's was no different. There was nothing about their food that justified the price point.   Unfortunately,  we didn't even stay to use  the Yelp fried ice cream offer. We paid and left. However, I had the last laugh and ordered a second helping of the free chips and salsa...

i7OnGClMm_HCOf4kDg2KWw.text: Love the way the place looks.   The food was great! Great waiters!  Guacamole was too expensive though...  But overall I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the number 8 which was a shredded beef taco, enchilada, and Chile relleno
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa were delish

0KXMtyFe4rsGyG-Z7EGQtg.text: Alfredo was the best waiter! Great margaritas Cadillac w/chili rim , try the beef  Colorado was awesome  must ask for bean dip on the house ! Best Mexican in Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dtfvl1-QDaiKk4JueljLGg.text: Mmmhhhhmmm! Great food and excellent service!!!! Absolutely loved the atmosphere. Dim lights, beautifully  decorated, and the tables aren't stacked on top of each other. Awesome happy hour specials (in bar area only). Ordered several plates and shared. Its been a bit as I can't remember exactly what we got but, I liked every single  dish! Great menu selection anything from seafood Mexican style to your traditional Mexican dishes. Portions are huge couldn't put a dent in it! Loved the selection of margaritas especially the jalapeno margaritas! Our server was absolutely amazing and very fast. It is pricey but I think it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry jalapeno margarita

y59B6w_x4En5m_ND4K_ICw.text: Awesome restaurant. Cool enviornment. Seated immediately. Food came super fast. A little expensive so consider sharing a dish

2O5Fx-B_LrggMZu4oUNPuQ.text: So I happened to be at downtown Summerlin, and I stopped in to try this place on a Sunday, and discovered a gem. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, and the bar is awe inspiring. It is probably the best designed Mexican restaurant I have seen.  The fruit and champagne was a great way to start. I ordered the puffy shrimp tacos, and could barely finish them. All of that plus the cinnamon  bunuelos made the price of $20.99 worth it.  I did think that some of the items were overpriced, like the guacamole and huevos ranchero, but enjoyed my meal.  I stopped in again on Monday which is ladies' night and had an even better experience. 1/2 prices apps, and $5 margaritas, plus live music, by a guy named Edgar, whose mix of classic Latin sound crossed with some modern songs made my night.  The service I received from Jason who was behind the bar was amazing. Not only was he attentive, making sure I never had to ask for anything, but the guy makes a mean margarita! He talked me into trying one of his bloody Mary's.  The best one I have ever had was at a bar in Los Angeles back in 1989. His blew that one away! As I watched him make it, his ratio of ingredients should not have worked, but was I wrong.  It will be even longer before I find someone to top him!  Jason talked me into trying the chile verde, which was a great call. I would not have been able to finish it even if I had not ordered an app before hand.  Portion size was ridiculous.  This has no become my favorite Monday night hang out because of the amazing cantina area, great bartender, and entertainment.  Well done, guys!

z_8TmmN2UharL9yLebV-pQ.text: Really over priced for very average Mexican food. I had a burrito and it was like $19 .. Crazy.   The decor is nice so I gave them 2 stars.   I probably wouldn't come back.

rZHrhh-g6VKlJeiLc12BGA.text: Pancho's is a great option for Mexican fare in the Downtown Summerlin area near Nordstrom Rack and Trader Joe's. After receiving a coupon in the mail for a BOGO entree, we decided to try it out and are happy we did.  First, the restaurant looks like a house and the main dining room has a courtyard feel. It is open and full of fake plants and trees (it's a bit much). Our server was polite and the server assistant also quickly came with their chips and salsa. Pancho's salsa was excellent with a nice kick and their chips were good as well. I ordered the wahoo fish tacos and my partner got a very large burrito of some kind. My tacos were also excellent and he said the burrito was great too! I did order a house margarita on the rocks and it was just ok. It was quite strong, not really that good, and was over $10! This was for their house margarita! To me, this is a bit overpriced, especially if the house margarita doesn't consist of premium ingredients.  All in all, we will definitely be back to Pancho's. My fish tacos were really quite good and I love a good salsa. I will definitely not order the house margarita and wish they would clean up all the clutter in the dining room as far as the fake plants and such. Again, the service was quite friendly and that will always being us back again and again.

TiNXVlVl6V4VD9Cf4ADjDQ.text: Went for lunch, feeling sick tonight.  Ordered a burrito from the vegetarian menu.  Waiter looked really confused, he did not know they had a vegetarian menu.  Had the worst burrito in my entire life.  Really, it had broccoli in the burrito ! Total  gringo food.  Really expensive too !

Xp_ZFTKAarXakBicvtLETg.text: Pancho's overall they do a great job here. Jimmy and a few others always make myself and friends feel like we are at home. Visited twenty times plus for different occasions and most of them are in the front lounge area. Enjoy the lounge because I can eat a decent meal have a few drinks and watch the game or work via wi-if. Try the Philly Burrito it's fantastic.

tOrQrWgp1wUcPQ9gL-FUiQ.text: Worst Mexican food ever!  We went here when it first opened, with high hopes. Was very disappointed. Tried it again about a month ago. Very disappointed again. The food is awful: it always comes out cold, very overpriced, and taste like all they use is chunks of cold cheese and flavors are not good. I've lived in San Diego over 10 years, where they truly have great Mexican, and I also have in-laws who are Mexican, and we make better food at home. Do not eat here!

6_Ue_3WazIquCppdOGVUCw.text: Other than Happy hour, I would go elsewhere.  The food is quite expensive for what you get.  The bar area is very brightly lit and the ambiance is not very good.  The redeeming thing is their Happy Hour and well made Margaritas.  They also have live music which is quite nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Ju5fWmecgglWAa3ccF4QA.text: We live in Summerlin and love having Downtown Summerlin so close to be able to go to so many great spots to eat, shop and see movies.    4 of my girlfriends met at Pancho's to celebrate my birthday at 7p.m. and had one of the BEST EXPERIENCES AND FOOD EVER!    Everything was TOP NOTCH.  The waiters and staff were all super friendly, funny, attentive.....just great.  And I use to be a waitress at Tony Roma's back in the day for 2 years....so I appreciate good service.  I'm very picky.    The food was delicious!  We all ordered a variety of different dishes and we all loved what we got!  Finished everything on our plates.  The prices were not bad at all.  Same as any other place in town, but the atmosphere, service and food were better than anywhere else I've been in town!  And I've been here for over 40 years!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND PANCHO'S!  I've already told all my friends about it....you'll love it!

hDSZgs3Vfa71qpBhjZgvnA.text: This was the grossest Mexican food I've ever had. I was so embarassed for my life being at this establishment. It was so so so expensive (20$ for 2 tacos?!) LOL  Me and bf got the trios enchiladas (chicken beef and cheese) and some birreria de something it was basically shredded beef chunks with pinto beans and rice. The enchiladas were so good except for the chicken one! I received a side plate and opened it up it was literally chicken mush?! It looked and tasted like baby food so I sent it back but nice enough the manager comped my meal. The other entree was good except for the bland sauce and the weird microwaved looking oily bland tortilla soup.  The drinks were okay, 13$ for a margarita and 8$ for my michelada. My michelada was delicious. The server was pretty good, attentive and responded well whenever I flagged him down!  I will come back to try other dishes hoping the food is better

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greasy microwaved looking tortilla soup was inedible
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qewfNpTycdbOCx95ImqVyQ.text: Really great atmosphere and location. Service was fun and attentive. The chips are salsa are  but the actual was just ok and overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The atmosphere is fun

42kdihGXljHHgv6aQKuU_g.text: I'm not sure why people are hating so hard on this place, especially considering the lack of margarita-making establishments in the area.   Yes, it's pricey, but it's Downtown Summerlin - also the portions are legit. I came during lunch and have to say - I'm down with the authentic ambience. Plus, the high ceilings are decor are awesome.   I ordered the Birria and it was delicious! The two people I ate with were also very happy with the food. It was definitely a more expensive lunch than normal...BUT they also have a good happy hour. I didn't get a chance to experience it but it looked like a great deal.  Bottom line - don't trust the bad reviews, go try Pancho's for yourself. The food was much better than I expected and if you don't love it, at least it's nice to look at!

6X1D4-Don7rYHnwLD2C4Qg.text: This is a hard review for me!  So we break it down into sections. Arrival:  numerous empty tables but we wait for 15 minutes and others are seated.  We opt to go to the bar. The bar:  fast service & friendly.  The bar itself is awkward due to the build to eat from.  The whole evening was frustrating...I am willing to try it again and update the review should things be better on the second round.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_FChD9Xoofht9cLn8y7aNw.text: Tres Leches cake was an absolute dumpster fire for $10.95!   I have had moister cake, three days old at a baptist potluck. This was a disgrace. If the cake was $6.00 dollars I would have just moved on and never said a word.........an $11.00 piece of cake should be really good to great every single time.   Also service in the cantina is very very slow. Servers are good just never enough of them.  The cake was trash, really still ticked off about that.

vJnNysJYR-rNQdNDwj2m3A.text: Stopped in about 30 minutes before they closed for dinner. Service was great and the food was yummy. We will definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stopped in about 30 minutes before they closed for dinner. Food was yummy and the service was great! We will definitely be back!!

K5Knd5MJkszAYUJLP6A0OQ.text: Excellent food. So much better than Mex type restaurants in my home NY. I'm going back regularly to try other menu items.

hlKPPdf0F1cXm5CZIMSkJw.text: If you read my reviews, you know I am aware of prices and quality. Unfortunately, this place misses the mark on both. I was a guest for a business lunch recently. Thumbing through the menu, looking for the lunch menu, there is not one. Looking at the prices at the cheapest entree is $14.95 and it goes way up from there.   Strip pricing meets Downtown Summerlin.  Someone sure spent a lot of money on the building and its very nice on the inside. I ordered the two beef tacos with double rice, Tasted bland was not anything extraordinary at all.  My clients bill was $65 which was for 3 entrees and 3 iced teas- too much especially at lunch.  I am going to keep my business at Viva Mercado.

fcMNj0u6R4C8OnJbq5C3SA.text: My boyfriend took me to downtown summerlin for our first tome & we decided to eat here! It was beautiful to walk in the waitress was very accommodating! We ordered and got it so fast which was awesome I got beer battered fish tacos my boyfriend got a crab shrimp burrito! It was amazing and I used my yelp check in offer and got free fried ice cream it was amazing we will be back!!!!
