6svID6zv_UKuNZRREfudUw.text: First visit here. Great atmosphere. Pretty busy but we were seated way before the estimated time the host gave us.  The food was delicious. I had the Panchos Chimichanga Especial. The portions were above standard.  Service was very good. We used the Yelp Check in offer.  Overall, this place is a keeper...and I believe I hear a live band in the background.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

adoAdTuRfc6KoplrUTn4UA.text: Surprised about the reviews on here.  Went for happy hour in the bar on a Saturday afternoon, plenty of room to pick a seat and quickly taken care of.  The food on the happy hour menu is good on the weekends even though the menu says drinks only Saturday and Sunday. The waitress made sure we were aware. Started with chips and salsa and they were really good.   Ordered the appetizer platter which was amazing. So good and highly recommend. My friend got the tortilla soup and said it was delish. We also ordered the Queso- this tasted like a dish of sour cream, and was huge. The waitress noticed we weren't eating it and asked about it, we told her it wasn't our favorite or what we expected and she said she would take it off the bill no problem. (She also mentioned they are taking it off the menu).   We also each got two drinks  Bill split in half was $28. Could be cheaper especially for happy hour, but was good.

l8_lZLrXKGnG5nMQmcMcBQ.text: This was our first time here. I wasn't really impressed. I will say their Tortilla soup was delicious and the food wasn't all that bad. However, the service we had SUCKED. The waitress took nearly 15 minutes to come and take our drink order. It wasn't until another server told our waitress something and then she came over and asked what we wanted. After placing our order it took another 10 minutes before we got our drinks. It was just in time because my wife and I were getting ready to walk out as the waitress approached our table. The food was good a bit overpriced. The ambiance was nice. Not sure if I will go back. Just my input.

SDITtG6yGdD5cwM36QsqnQ.text: After reading some of the reviews on Yelp, I wonder if those people had actually eaten at Pancho's.  First, I thought the service was excellent.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  As soon as we sat down, we were served chips and salsa.  There is a lot of food on the menu, but I don't see that as a bad thing.  There's a lot to choose from which means you don't have to get the same thing over and over when you come back.  I had the Trio Los Pancho's and they were amazing.  My girlfriend had the artichoke quesadilla and devoured it.  Some of the reviews say this place is a bit pricey, but I guess they've never eaten in Las Vegas before.  I felt the price was right on par for downtown Summerlin.  Before we left, we were greeted by the manager, Mallory, and asked about our dining experience.  Mallory was extremely receptive to our feedback and was genuinely interested in what she and the restaurant could do better.  I would highly recommend Pancho's to anyone whose looking for something other than the same ole dining experience.

MFsyx6zsseO9u-P47I9JCQ.text: This place should not be in business!!! I rarely write reviews but when I get cold enchiladas, rice and beans for $22 there is a problem. Then they sit a woman pushing a perambulator with a Bichon Frise dog in it next to us only to have the management tell me its a service dog is insulting to my intelligence and a health code violation. And I am a huge dog lover by the way. I will never step foot in that over priced poor quality place again.

TC6OH_TOr16WIBEgeL9r8A.text: Keep putting off going here cuz kinda pricey, but dang was it awesome! I had what is called Tinga Poblano (marinated pork in deliciousness red sauce) ... YUM! . Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

17SpTQvZXw0FJzOmJPWctQ.text: I went with a group of (6) family members and it was a 50/50 split on the food. I was personally pretty disappointed. The service was great considering how busy they were and the food was totally not their fault but I probably won't go back. There is a lot of good Mexican food in Las Vegas so I feel like I'd get more good food for less $$$ at other places around town.   Even my totally non picky husband was underwhelmed by their soup or all things. He ate the meatballs in the abondigas  soup and left everything else.   The masa for my tamale was so grainy it overtook the flavor. Another person got the Chile Colorado and said the beef had no flavor and felt like it had sat a while.  The tres leches cake was so dry we actually sent it back who has ever heard of a dry tres leches cake?  The beers ($6.75) and margaritas ($13.50) were good but not enough to go for just drinks. Just because they are in downtown Summerlin doesn't justify their over priced plates and inconsistent flavors. Good luck Pancho's - Vegas is a place foodies will not put up with this.

Smdh1f2PscWYCFOh_vlMWA.text: Great service, fun atmosphere and tasty food. The salsa has a good fresh flavor and just enough heat to not be boring. I had the chile very burrito which was very tasty and is actually the most traditional style I've had here in Vegas.  I am a fan of ridiculously giant burritos, and while the quality and service of this meal was worth every penny, this wasn't a very big burrito for the fairly steep price of $16.

qhGFpe6M8UtBRxMNwGd0DQ.text: First, off the prices should be $$$$. $14.95 for an appetizer of 5 taquitos? Come on! The service was slow, food was slow and just okay. Appetizers were $14 +, tacos were $20.95. For real? No lunch menu! They really need to rethink their menu and seriously the prices! I would prefer Lindo Michoacan in Henderson, Casa Don Juan or my ultimate favorite, COYOTES on Sunset and Green Valley. Much better food, much better prices!

pkukRKqfLJNbPrQBIP1usw.text: As far as Mexican goes, the Ambiance is quite Mexican. But as far as food quality goes it left a lot to be desired. We went with the waiters recommendation because things were kinda pricey and I looked around the restaurant and didn't see anything necessarily worth the price. We ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp and were treated to five pieces of shrimp on some rice with grilled vegetables. A $27 that seems like a lot especially when one of those pieces of shrimp did not get eaten because it was not deveined. We also paid another $20 for a steak quesadilla and the meat inside tasted like what happens to steak if you cook it, put it in the refrigerator, and try to warm it up the next day. The drinks were hitting mess because mine was quite strong whereas my dining partner's was not. Overall I will not come back here there are other places here in Vegas that are so much better for Mexican food.

xyvGSMN9oRY6BVZCFcvTgA.text: This place was terrible! My husband ordered the scallops and they literally cut them in half to make them look like 6 pieces. When we called the manager over to complain he was wearing sneakers with a suit and said "we measure all our food" what!!!! Is this guy serious... we are paying $30 for this dish. He ended up taking it off our bill but it's still not right. We will never come back.

bWkIU_SibjiQ4C5UntpQ7A.text: I've been doing customer service in restaurants since I was 16 and I've given my share of outstanding customer service! An employee named Martha gave me and my friends outstanding customer service. Very cute very nice and very sincere about making sure everything at our table and our meal was perfect. She gave us ideas, told us what things were and how big and small they were and she even put out for in the to go container for us neatly!! :) She also had several other tables and was killing it! Very good employee! The place here is very clean and very beautiful! Thankyou for everything! We will be back very soon!

tHGOU0GpsPxYRCDRLsfYmA.text: I very much enjoyed this restaurant. Visited during happy hour. Our server was bubbly and pleasant. We had margaritas (my friend had their kiwi flavoring that was fantastic), and a appetizer sampler. There was way more food then two people could eat, and it was delicious.

78E_rf7-1YBuj6Um4Cmk4A.text: Love this place and their margaritas! This is my new taco Tuesday spot for sure. :)

tcLct-3yH6J7iGgdmdyFKw.text: Went back for a second time, today was the worst. 1 1/2 hours later food came out. There were six of us 2 meals were right the other 4 were all wrong. I think the price is to high and the food isn't worth it. $3.95 for a Coke and they give you a small glass. I will not be going back to this place :(

yoyjn0_mWadDjROvxO5S4Q.text: Pancho's had delicious food and excellent service.  The manager, Doug, is great with kids and checked in often to be sure our experience was a great one.  I would definitely recommend Pancho's

vZDt7tjv27xmNysT97V4Xg.text: We came here for a late lunch on 3/12/2017. There were 6 of us in our group. We didn't have to wait long to be seated. The waiter who took our orders was efficient, patient and personable.  We really enjoyed him. Wished I had gotten his name. The food was delicious, drinks awesome and ambiance relaxing and very nice. Service fast! We all enjoyed Panchos! We look forward on coming back.

7WsRUFCpHRTQNlwoIOcNCg.text: Pancho's is a beautiful place, and the service wasn't bad, however, the food was just OK, but pricey, so probably wouldn't go back anytime soon.  Waitress did say that some bigwigs from CA were there working on the menu, and some positive changes should be made in the next few months.  I'll watch Yelp to determine when and if I'll be back.

hZ_CdV2Jy_O4hVvj4c2Cng.text: Food was excellent and service was better. My wife, 2 kids and myself were all impressed with her service. Lovely ambiance of authentic Mexico. Martha definitely made our night with her great attitude.

5QynhPW03cV3iW9mNvHR1w.text: Such a great first experience!  Not only was the food really good but my 4 year old got such a nice surprise from the awesome team who sang to him and even gave us a picture of his reaction to take home with us.  The atmosphere is fun, service is wonderful and the experience will bring us back again and again.

AZB0jcze7NUL6KTPdQkEXA.text: Had a great dinner at Panchos tonight. The wait was long, expected that because it's brand new, but time went by quick while I had a drink in the bar and watched MNF(Monday night football)... Awesome bar area with good HD TV's.. The scenery in this place is great. Definitely the best Mexican food I've had since I moved here a year ago.

ewiMuZP20x4zcK16eRe4FQ.text: The ambiance of this restaurant is very nice. The interior is stunning. The server was attentive and made us feel at home. However, the food is slightly overpriced. The taste and quality does not amount to the absurd prices. I understand it's a nice building and location, but I will not be going back because of the prices. Giving it a 4-star review because everything BUT the prices was great.

GumJgSI9aSMT-R3yBKWGCw.text: Guacamole was tasteless ($14). Enchilada sauce was flavorless. Service was great. Will not be returning.

zuSp4WIwbrlLaUMO5zZSHg.text: Atmosphere is great, but food is most definitely overpriced! Even the appetizer pricing was ridiculous. Would be happy to spend $$$$ if the food was actually worth it.

MJrSyDTqw6WPUfNz_S2bHQ.text: Atmosphere was really cool and nicely decorated.  Chips and salsa were great. A few items on the menu are a tad pricey for a restaurant not being located on the Las Vegas strip. Guac is 14.95 and a side of beans is 5.95. I work on the strip over looking the strip itself and our guac is 8.95 and a side of beans is 1.50. So I was a bit blown away by some of the prices here. Our server Brian was great and very friendly.

5GKYuersaRxAjtNs1UpZyw.text: First time here, came for lunch.  I  ordered the scallop ceviche but was told it wasn't ready to be served so I settled for plain ceviche,  it was good,not great.  Their chips are NOT made in house, from a bag. My shrimp puffy tacos were incredible and my husband had the philly burrito, he says it was good but again not great.   The restaurant is a beautiful work of art.

CDqfC4gwSH5HmkwIMVb4Mw.text: 1st visit wasn't good. Well over an hour wait and they didn't look busy at all. Was told to call a day ahead. Really? On a Thursday night? We decided to give it another chance and the same thing. The girls at the entrance have no personality, smile, or have a welcoming presence. The servers were nice though. Here at lunch time and the lunch menu is the same as the dinner menu. Food is no different than any other Mexican joint.  We get the check and we are being charged more than what the prices on the menu showed. Really??? Yeah, I'm straight!!!

JvN0JAnPfm9RKLK67P5BHg.text: Food and atmosphere is excellent more than enough to eat just a little pricey a little pricey but well worth it servers and waiter do a great job they know their product

NAsJgly_3kTAzlHF4ijaWw.text: Great atmosphere in the bar,  but I am not going to pay $15 for guacamole or a couple tacos.   Too many good Mexican restaurants in town to pay that much,  especially if you have kids.   El Paso!

PtghAgVmwfTX3cgU17rSqA.text: Overpriced for the food. It was decent. The decor was fine. Service was good. However, not mind blown on the food considering the prices. And the one disappointment for the night....no horchata at this Mexican Restaurant. Say what?!?!?! Bummer.

6t4LwP3IDcYFH2j9uq9KCg.text: Very very good food, I was very satisfied with service and the food. Old fashioned environment. .

ez7YtAQZHGC0X8s8aWVcZw.text: We ate here last night for the first time. It was a great experience!  The food was great, the atmosphere was fun and the staff were excellent!  The manager walked around and engaged the customers and genuinely cared that you had a good experience. Definitely my new favorite Mexican food restaurant!!

kqea-9-eMlSpCOaeYMqf1g.text: What a bummer! This place is so cute! The ambiance and service were great. The food was not.   The restaurant is very cool. It's like a big open atrium inside with lots of trees, hanging birds, a fountain and so on. A huge negative - we were seated right next to the fountain and it smelled like mold/sewer. Every time some passed by it wafted towards our table. Very unappealing. They have a big menu with loads of options; the prices definitely run a little high.   Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with our food. They serve complimentary chips and salsa And the salsa is tasty. We ordered the artichoke queso fundido. It was like no other queso fundido I've ever had. It was essentially a skillet of warm sour cream/cream cheese. The consistency was like a dip, not like ooey gooey cheese. No caramelization. No bueno. We also ordered the beef taquitos described as spicy. They were bland. No flavor. I had the sopa de albondigas (meatball soup); this did have nice flavor!! Others at the table were disappointed with enchiladas, chile rellano and a seafood entree. Everything lacked flavor and pizazz and seemed overpriced.   I didn't have a cocktail or I might say to come for the surroundings and a drink.    I likely won't return. Too many other tasty Mexican choices

OT2Jn_QSFqp-RWkM2kKuoA.text: This place is so nicely decorated. If you're going for old Mexican style decor and not for taste in food you're in the right place.  Chips and salsa were okay. Not the greatest! And so goes for the rest of their food. I found it to be bland and the only other taste was overly salty meat.  It's a shame, cute atmosphere terribly expensive food!  They need to hire people that can cook. Hopefully they will get it together.  Won't be returning for now until I hear more reviews on food improvement.  Sorry Panchos, you gave us nothing but a punch in the stomach.

VmVjBlpuzw0dnTUctbsaTA.text: Honest review about the place. First problem, seated next to the door of the kitchen. The people had to walk in between 2 customers chairs to get in and out. They shouldn't have table at that spot. Overall they need to remove some tables from the place period!! Not comfy seating environment. The manager dropped a dirty fork on my friend's shoulder and didn't even apologize. We asked for a move, which took another 20 minutes because the host forgot about us. Finally they moved us to another table. The manager came smoozed with us after but he never acknowledged the fork incident.   The food is mediocre, I ordered a $25 menu item which should've of been $11.99 at most places. It's very overpriced, these prices work for Manhattan Beach , CA for their original location, not Vegas. The food is bland and uninspiring, especially when we have amazing Mexican food here like Lindo, La Mojarra Loca...etc etc. To diners who love food, this is a skip!

gOeBmcdgQElO-tfpOjW8lg.text: This place gets two stars because the interior decor is gorgeous (for the most part) and the chips are nommy.  The waitstaff is good about filling beverages and chips. That's it.  You are paying for the decor and construction costs, and not getting quality or tasty food in return.   I ate here last week for lunch, after being told there was a two hour wait on opening day (despite the restaurant not being full).  I was seated immediately this time, after the hostess rudely remarking that she remembered me from the previous week.  I was brought to a table near the base of the stairs... So far so good.  Although the water in the fountain was green and cloudy.  I ordered a chicken chimi and iced tea. This was around 2:30 pm and it still took about 45 minutes for my food to come out.  By that time I'd eaten way too many chips (yeah they're good although the salsa is just meh) and wasn't very hungry.  Which is good because my chimi was the smallest burrito I've ever seen.  It was dry and lacking in flavor and I left half of it and the beans and rice (also meh) on my plate.  Definitely not impressed.  I've had better food for a fifth of the price at Roberto's Taco Shop, and that's saying something, since I think Roberto's is also crap!

tCLMrbhPfjUXlADSX8l-JQ.text: Went when first open - was totally a mess.  Hear from others it may have gotten better.

nLqe4aTqjrFc-6TfBIpUnQ.text: Save time and your money and don't eat here. As many other reviews state, the atmosphere and decor is very good. They definitely hit the mark there but that is where it ends.  We came on a Sunday around 1:00. They had a brunch menu in addition to a dinner menu. Huge selection of entrees on the dinner menu, all ranging from 17.95 and up. The four adults in our party all agreed that there wasn't anything special about the food. I had a chimichunga and the chicken was super dry and the shell was over fried. Rice, no Bueno. The menu also stars at the bottom 10.95 minimum per person. Seriously!  Not sure if they would have enforced it.   They brought some of our drinks in plastic cups. For $18/person you ought to be able to put the drink in a glass.   Kids meals were $10 each as well. Fine if you don't want to cater to kids but seriously. My son had a pizza and before you say it... yes, don't order pizza at a Mexican restaurant.  It's all about the taste and quality of the food. I will pay $30 for a $30 steak. I will pay more if I am in a casino or high tourist area. I expect quality if I am going to pay this much and this place failed miserably.

iG8hl0KiUQtOMdAuu05rOQ.text: Waited for dinner on Saturday night 45 min wait, we where offered a drink for waiting..never recieved  the  drink!!! Finally we where seated upstairs on a cat walk, no room for waiters or people to walk by, felt like I was in everyone's way. Ordered our drinks from the bus boy Louis the only bright spot of this dinning experience. Louis was very attentive. As for our waitress krisa,she was the worst!! My meal was wrong had to wait another 15/20 minuets. she did apologize for screwing up, but made no offer to discount the meal or bring a manager!  The food was not great, very over priced!!  This resturant has been open for 2 weeks, sadly I will not return! I also witnessed one of the owners drinking..taking a shot at the service bar.  If I could, I wouldn't give this resturant  1 star.

O8OPjeVyhmg1YfZPoMGJJQ.text: The service was good and the restaurant is gorgeous but the food was not what I expected from an "authentic" Mexican restaurant. Lovely as this place is, I will not be going back.

F8v87s890MhUTMsD5lpdkA.text: I was very excited to try this restaurant as there aren't any good Mexican restaurants in the Summerlin area...   We started with chips and salsa and queso. The chips were decent and salsa was good but nothing particularly delicious.  The queso had mixed reviews at our table some members of our party loved it. Other hated it. If you are a fan of artichoke cream cheese dip you might be interested in this.  The steak salads were decent. Meat seemed overly salted but overall not bad.  The chicken tacos were the flop of the evening. Extremely greasy and tasteless.  The beans and rice were fair.   The carnitas enchiladas were the favorite at the table. I recommend those out of all the dishes we tried.   The fried ice cream was so - so. The only downfall was it was greasy...   Mediocre food but the real kicker was the price of the food! $20 for two tacos with a small side of beans and rice is outrageous.  That's the reason for the two stars. Average to below average Mexican cuisine at sky high prices.   I won't be returning.

rIwwv3lz0if-1EfNir37Ag.text: My wife and I were visiting Summerlin for family from Phoenix  Arizona. We we in absolutely shock when walking into this establishment, whoever designed this place deserves a bonus. Tiles, pictures, bricks, and plants were so authentic to Mexican culture (I say this from experience in different Mexican cities). The food was amazing and portion sizes were large. Still not quite sure why people are complaining about prices, they seem more then fair given the quality of food in such an amazing establishment.   But anyways, We went two nights in a row, the first night in the garden for a romantic evening. And our second night in town we wanted a little more upbeat tempo, so we tried a couple  local bars nearby (lazy dogs and one other) and ultimately ended up back at Pancho's in the bar area. I wouldn't suggest going into the bar unless you want a lively and active environment like we did on this night, the garden and dining will give you the relaxing experiencing you are looking for. We didn't make it in for happy hour at the bar but were told t's from 2:30-6:30- half off appetizers and margaritas. Not sure if that is all days or not.  Also the mentions comedy nights and karaoke nights but not sure which nights those are either.  In conclusion this place is spectacular and will definitely be our go to spot for future visits.

oPT5MHqwpkJx1_mB5m4gCQ.text: Love the food, love the service, and if you have Jason you'll have amazing service from start to finish

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Jason! We wanted to take a picture with him so we can put it on Yelp and he offered us sombreros! So much fun!

Y6aZJq_DiS5QlGonCPeDoQ.text: Great enchiladas. Waiters are attentive and polite. The food is really good and the decor is beautiful, just beautiful. The food portions are huge and they give you free chips and salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El trio

znNezK4VQxo1WA9zqkCv0w.text: First off, if you are looking for the same michoacan garbage that is all over this city don't bother. This is Cali Mex, through and through. Fresh ingredients, clean flavors. Also, it's not cheap so if you're offended by a $19 plate of solid mexican food, go elsewhere. For some reason people will pay that for just about any other type of food here without thinking about it but when it comes to mexican food, they think it should be cheaper. I completely disagree but if that's your take, go hit Roberto's & eat half warm food out of a Styrofoam carton.  Salsa here is slightly chunky with great fresh flavor. You are not going to find runny "hot sauce" here. We both ordered the combination plates and there was not a single item that we didn't absolutely love. I especially enjoyed the cheese enchilada which almost had a creamy cheesy consistency & husband especially liked the beef tacos with shredded beef which were encased in a perfectly cooked corn shell, not too hard & not too soft. We also had a half-order of the guacamole which again was incredibly fresh tasting & didn't included a bunch of shredded lettuce at the bottom that many restaurants use as filler.   The service was incredible (shout out to Jason & his manager) and the interior was beautiful with lots of plant life. It gave the impression you were sitting in one of San Diego's great mexican restaurants.  It's completely refreshing to have an alternative to most of the other nuevo mex & michoacan you'll find in this city. We'll definitely be back!!!

XaxtbNy6QhlBRFByMovBzA.text: Went here recently.  I was not blown away.  Mixed review I guess.  Dinner was good, but nothing spectacular.  Salad was great !!.  In the meal, the chicken was a bit off and the onions other veggies overcooked.  Rice and beans were rice and beans.  Great service by very nice server, but the inside was a bit underwhelming from what I was expecting and the way it was talked up.  Staff were sprinting (pounding) up and down stairs so not that relaxing and bar music was blaring.  Stairs took up most of the floor space.   Large portions but the price is high.  I think for the price and all the talk about the inside I was expecting more.  We may go back sometime.  Not bad, but not really great either.  Glad we tired it.

8GHmoNFbG7xOAkq450_5Uw.text: Wow!!! I like other reviewers wrote I wish I would have read the reviews before dining at this place. I will start out by saying that this is not to intend harm on Pancho's but there is a point to where a restaurant should offer soe sort of value to its patrons. This place doesn't. My actual rating would be about 1.5 star so I'm rounding it up.  The atmosphere: I've seen this place many times before and watched the construction. We decided to dine there on a Sunday for lunch. It's decor reminds me of something you would find near San Diego and the atmosphere is decent. But to me atmosphere doesn't make the place.  The food: My step-daughter and I ordered the chicken chimichanga which was about $18-19. Definitely pricey for lunch. At first glance I noticed it wasn't in the large side nor was it extremely small. The flavor was ok but the chicken was very dry. The rice and beans that came with the meal could be replaced with any other average rice and beans from another restaurant and I would not have noticed. My wife had the chili relleno. I asked her how hers was and she said she's had better. My daughter had a chicken quesadilla which was, get this, $17. Now, she said that it was really good. But this is coming from a 10 year old girl who thinks microwave popcorn is the bomb.   The service: Our waitress did definitely make herself seen. The bus person always filled our waters. But no was was overly friendly.  The Overall: I base a restaurant on whether I would visit it again. This one I would not. All-in-all the meal was under $80 and that is with all of us only ordering water. Really? $80 for lunch? Add in a tip and my bill total was over $92. I've definitely had better food and larger portions at local taco shops and spent less than a 1/3 of that for my entire family.  Sorry Pancho's but listen to your customers reviews. A lot of them are saying the exact same thing as I am. Even though most of those reviewers may not be back, you can protect future patrons. And only very few people decide to leave reviews. You have no idea how many people, who decide not to write their opinion that decide they will not come back because of the value.

v6G8x5PkxYeLZknCclYlAQ.text: Very nice atmosphere and cozy. The waiter was attentive and kept our ice tea filled. The chip basket was kept full but when the food came I was expecting better taste. I had heard so much about this place with the wishing pond and picture area all was good but the food needs some work. I had the rolled tacos with sour cream (taquitios) and the meat was mixed with onion and meat sauce. I would have liked it simple no added sauce to the meat. It was nice to try something different but won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ai00elUQb-iaE_jnvmTmlA.text: Well - I can see why this brand new restaurant only has 3 stars.  Ambiance - 5 stars Service - 2 stars Food Quality - 3 stars Price - 1 star  Unfortunately, ambiance doesn't a good meal make.  We walk in w/ a party of 8 on Sunday at 6pm.  The hostesses look at us, one rolls her eyes, then they ask if we have a reservation.  We didn't, but asked if they could accommodate us and they said it would  be a few minutes.  We walked into the bar area to get a drink while we waited.  The bartender was fantastic, I wanted a skinny margarita w/ no triple sec.  He made a delicious concoction with a grand marnier float and it was fabulous.  They call us up and ask my husband if we want the 18% auto-grat added.  He declined as if the service is good, we generally tip 20% or more.    They seat us up on the second level, which again, was beautiful.  We are greeted promptly by the server and bussers and we order additional non alcoholic drinks.  Not long after, we had some chips & salsa delivered to the table that were rather good.  We start looking through the menu and realize everything (and i mean EVERYTHING) is over priced.  $20 for Ceviche?  $15 for Guacamole?!? Are you kidding me???  Anyway, we were there w/ family so we decided to just deal.  My husband and I are vegan and noticed very few vegan options on the menu.  No big deal, we'll just modify.  They have a Vegetarian Salad (THIS IS WHAT THEY CALL IT) that includes the Mexican style rice.  Thing is - the Mexican style rice ISN'T vegetarian!! It's made w/ chicken stock!!!  Why would you put a non-vegetarian item in a vegetarian dish??  I am SO GLAD my gut told me to ask.  That being said, I ordered that salad, no rice, no cheese, no sour cream and it was actually rather good.  The dressing they put on it was great too and it was loaded w/ squash and carrots.  I did ask for beans since I wasn't getting the rice, cheese, and cream and they happily obliged.  However, this was a $17 salad.  My brother in law is pretty picky and ordered the philly burritto w/ o the onions or peppers - basically just meat and cheese.  My sister-in-law ordered the beef & beans burrito.  My bro in law's burrito came out w/ just meat.  My sister in law's came out chicken & beans, instead of beef & beans.  Neither came with ANY sides.  For $15 (it might have even been more), it should come with SOMETHING on the side.  My brother in law sent his burrito back and decided he would just wait to eat until he go thome instead of overpaying for the dish.  My sister in law ate hers, but said it was just "meh" - she could get better for a fraction of the price at Roberto's.  We had to ask for ketchup for my nephew's dish 3 times, and had to ask for the check twice (the second time almost 20 minutes after the first).  The manager came over and told my brother in law he wouldn't need to pay for the burrito (said it multiple times like it was some big favor he was doing us).  It was nice he stopped by, but that was a given - I sure hope we aren't paying for food that we sent back because it was deemed sub-par.  I ordered a second margarita, and started to explain to the server what I wanted but then stopped and said, you know what - the bartender will remember, he just made my first one.  The server smiled, shook his head, then walked away.  After I get my second margarita and it tastes NOTHING like the first, I see there's another bar upstairs.  He knew I came up w/ my first margarita...why didn't he ask me to continue because he would be ordering from a different bartender??  I'm just thoroughly disappointed, I really wanted to like this place and was excited about a late night bar (the bar is open until 2) that isn't a pub opening up in the area, however everything is way over priced (just because you're in Summerlin doesn't mean you can overcharge), the food was average and the service was subpar.  I will only likely return if invited for another group event.  It's a shame, because we could have been regulars.

7pVYBuEaJQ4nK6oWGvin6A.text: Beautifully themed restaurant but the prices are very expensive. I had a burrito, it was $18 and didn't include any rice and beans. The burrito was very small for the price. The drinks are very small and the salsa they give is too spicy. Food was great but not worth the price. For a special occasion, maybe. Loved that there were two stories. Staff constantly refilled our chips and drinks so that was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly burrito
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully decorated.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very small drinks. Good thing they were good about refills

cj6uL3v8raCk9fSoPvS-HQ.text: Was there for a quick lunch Saturday after noon, the place was packed since the had just open a few days prior. Sat at the bar and ordered a steak burrito that looked more like a quesadilla (flat) due to the lack of meat in it. As I was eating my rice I saw what appeared to be a piece of chicken, bone included in my rice!! How do you not see a whole piece of chicken going in the rice?? The GM came and had s full operations discussion with the owner sitting next to me  Right over my shoulder, literally inches from ear. Long story short the good was bad and expensive  One burrito and one Arnold Palmer $25.00 Not dinner, lunch

gX0BBrT6UtlnAOaUklUSwA.text: Had dinner there last night. Food was good but service was spotty. We waited a while for the appetizers to come out. After they finally did, the main courses came out 3 minutes later. We asked them to bring them back to the kitchen and to bring them out when we had finished the appetizers. Duh! When they brought them out (for the second time), they weren't very warm. They probably just reheated them. Prices are a bit on the expensive side but we had a BOGO coupon so that made it affordable.

y7-WZDzYhJgNJ4hXAeGMxg.text: Too expensive for what it is! Beautiful decor and giant bar with stage but just not cool to have dinner prices at lunch! Plus not a good place for families 9.95 a kid meal and when you have 5 kids with you o geeeeeezzzeee!

2pogN1bhT6AGKDu57JbhPg.text: Bad experience. The food is over priced, the portions are small and my lunch tasted like a Mexican TV dinner.  My husband and I were disappointed and we will not return. You can find better food at the local Taco Shops for 1/3 the price.

skVicdObHkQAqfI3tzOzgg.text: Nice decor and service was okay, but one of the worst meals my husband and I have had in a long time. You can taste the preservatives.  It took us four hours to not feel nauseous from the meal. Like a belly boom. We will not be going back.  Anyone giving this more than 3 stars has very poor taste!

Jv5XiNWX7p9mrjHcTBtrWQ.text: Lets start out by saying the decor is very pleasing (except in the bar), really nice. From there it just falls off the cliff. This was our second visit.  As we sat in the bar (mid-day) we noticed only 2 others in the bar, that's it. We did notice 3 servers chatting away at the other end. The bartender was well, not interested in the customers. Very little "chat-up". If you are slow, customers pay tips. The staff on the other hand was chatting up a storm, enjoying themselves.....but please don't bother us we're busy......with each other. WE BECAME BORED. One and done. Chips and salsa were served, didn't like them. Bottom line if you want me to come back, give me a reason....With staff that understands the customer is what pays there salary and tips are the gravy.... and friendly goes a long way. Decor isn't enough. If you are tending bar, talk to your customers, make them feel welcome and WANT to come back.

jpcyEcgfiamzsIYXZpYVLA.text: First time here & let's just say amazing! Great authentic Mexican food for a decent price. Definitely reminded me of Mexico love this place!

p0QO72dsqpMFUq6z1Aiu1A.text: I am unsure what negatives are saying. Great place. GORGEOUS... Unbelievably nice people work here. Management is amazing and very involved. Really worth trying...

86LOEfJs-hdLCUIZ8GDfIw.text: Super cute atmosphere and the food was really good. Great service. Not sure why there are mediocre reviews about this place. Maybe they stepped up their game? Will be back. It's my new favorite!

G6MlMqqQ0tj-tbhexuasSQ.text: Amazing "Rajitas" (fajitas) ! Salad was very tasty! Fried ice cream was delicious ! Highly recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QBDJ-P63ILGV-a1sOxPZIQ.text: We went tonight for dinner, had a great time! I believe that life is what you put into it. If you go with a positive attitude you have a positive experience. I agree the food wasn't the super best I've ever had. But it was good. Probably not worth the prices they charge. We're talking $18 and up for an entree. But the service was great and the place is very beautiful inside as others have noted. I will post a couple of pictures, our waiter was great. And since my daughter is hearing impaired and uses sign language they even brought over another waiter who knows sign language which I thought was really nice. The manager, or at least I think it was the manager, he didn't introduce himself, came over to our table a couple of times and thanked us for coming which I thought was very nice.

Y1zgD-D5ibrzvCXAqFahSw.text: The family and I went to Ponchos for dinner. I had heard that this place was good from co-workers. We walked in and were seated right away. The atmosphere seemed ok. Chips and salsa came out quickly. However, the salsa tasted like it came out of a jar, but the chips were good and the staff were constantly refilling it. The wife order the "Wahoo tacos" and I order the Enchilada de carnitas. The tacos tasted like frozen, over cooked fish, that they tried to cover up with bagged cabbage. So much so, that my wife sent it back, which never happens. The staff was understanding, apologetic and was willing to replace the meal. The enchilada de carnitas tasted ok, at best. The meat was tough, not tender or savory. My daughter order a kids meal quesadilla which was cold. Every meal on the menu was at least $20. This is place was disappointing. Two stars was pushing it in this review.

FB88RexV3HZbEePm4FAoiA.text: Delicious!! Been living in the southeast where they don't do green chili. Was VERY glad to see our new home state had green chili and Pancho's was a great welcome back to the good stuff! And omg the ambience here? Stunning!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not a single detail was overlooked! This place is absolutely beautiful in every nook and cranny.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ljuITjnI-GvATRj6n6UQA.text: $16 for one burrito with no beans or rice included.  Meal was room temperature not hot.  Wondered why there were no drink prices on menu...............$3.75 for lemonade or soda! Burrito flavor was okay but needed a magnifying glass to find the meat. Won't be returning.

JM2crRVbDOxa9HXoz6c71Q.text: This place was very average. Service was an almost fail and the food was ooooooook not excellent. Prices were a little steep for the quality of food. Sorry guys don't think I'll be back.

ErQGJT605bPzrEgaBQupYg.text: Terrible mexican food. No flavor, dry pork, watery soup, below standard drinks and all at high steak house prices. True, the attmosphere is nice, service good and the guacamole and salsa fresh but not enough to fix the bad food and high prices. Don't bother going in, you would do far better at numerous other mexican places.

_HfqxJRC2FrKlnmZDHEsQA.text: Dropped in today with my wife and Mom after voting. I had the Chicken Fajaitas, my wife had the Cheese Enchiladas and Mom had Fish Tacos. Warning, the portions are very large but the food and service are both top notch. This is possibly the best Mexican restaurant in town. Our server Agustin provide entertainment as well as service at its very best. The place is knock down beautiful and very well lit during the day thanks to the skylights. A little pricey but we will come again.

TfGmLJAOZTkweas9jXXxNA.text: Tacos De Camarones was bland & lacked flavor, not exaggerating!  Really disappointed, as there was no authentic flavors to taste. Took to long to receive our order.  The sitting is awkward as we sat in the corner, our view from the courtyard was blocked by oversized plants ..  Won't be returning ..

pT_TAyyiJkeKO5BJqaFkOA.text: We had great service (thanks Fernando) and great food, in a nice environment.  No complaints at all with our experience. We will definitely be frequent customers.

ouSsVyvAd2NzP1qM8KfjpQ.text: Went to Pancho's on Saturday December 12th for the first time and sat in the bar area with my five girlfriends to celebrate a birthday. The first thing you should know is there is nothing on the menu that is less than $20.00 except for the taco salad that was $16.99 and a few appetizers that were $18.99. Now, I am not cheap and I don't mind paying for a good meal so I was expecting with these prices to have great food and great service to celebrate my friend's birthday. We were sadly disappointed.   The taco salad was pretty much just lettuce and sour cream with a few beans (not exaggerating - maybe 7 beans throughout) and a very small amount of ground beef at the bottom with a couple chips (again not exaggerating - probably 2 chips total). The Queso Fundido was tasteless. Oh and I could smell the Ceviche my friend ordered from 5 feet away- I was convinced she was going to get food poisoning from rotten fish. As it stands, I cannot guarantee she didn't - food poisoning and too much alcohol cause similar symptoms...   The food was not even the worst of it though...the service was horrible!  Our waitress Adriana/Ariana was terrible! She was so slow. Took 20 minutes just to get our first drinks and another 20 minutes to get some chips. Then the worst part of the entire night - THE BILL...(cue the horror music). The bill took 2 hours (again not exaggerating - we finished eating at 9pm and we were there until 11pm figuring out the damn bill). Why? Because Adriana/Ariana had apparently never rung up a bill in her life. From the 5 of us, she split the bill for 3 on one and 2 on another. I was on the bill with the 3. One of my friends on that bill payed in cash and the other two of us said to split the rest of the check. I'm sure you could see how this could go wrong - She could only charge one of us...she could not split it evenly...she could charge us for the completely separate bill for the other two girls at our table..wait! Yes! You read that right...she charged us EACH for the other bill at the table. So round and round we go for 2 damn hours. In the end,  I still show a pending charge on my bank account for $53.00 for my taco salad and a coke...when it should have been $26.00.   I know what you're thinking, you would have asked to speak with a manager and cleared the whole thing up - no need for this drama mama's review. But you would be wrong because I asked to see the manager TWICE and no manager ever came. In fact, no other waiter PRETENDING to be the manager even came (yes, I used to work in food service and this happened all the time). After two hours, I couldn't wait anymore and I wasn't going to make a scene and embarrass my girlfriend on her birthday so I left...  Please don't waste your money here, folks. It's too bad because the band was actually pretty good and the place is really beautiful (decor and such). Worst dining experience ever.

42FONHBu-gHbsRjqzMKrQg.text: The absolute worst service I've ever experienced!  A group of about 20 people (farewell dinner) decided to eat here last minute. We figured we would just eat in the bar area, which wouldn't require a reservation. Everyone was extremely shocked by the price of all of the food. Heck, even the appetizers averaged at about $15. The margaritas were average with an above average price. The blended had large chunks of ice, on the rocks margaritas you could taste the triple sec (quite a few others in the party and myself are bartenders/servers) The server in the bar area, Ericka, wasn't TOO terrible until the end. Towards the end of the end of the night, someone asked for their check so they could leave. At that point Ericka said she wasn't splitting the check, but that she would bring out the entire group's check at that time. Someone mentioned that to me so I asked for Ericka to come and explain to me what was going on. She told me what she told the other person, that she was not splitting the check. Upon my constant asking of why this was, she then tried to say that she had talked to the first table there (the parents of the bride and groom) and that I was not there for the conversation, so I had no idea.   So after Ericka walked away, I went to ask the parents what she had asked or said at the beginning of the night. They told me that Ericka had asked how we were doing everything, and they told her a couple different times that it was all going to be split. So when Ericka came back out, and I asked her what exactly the first table had said. That's when her story changed and she said that they told her we were going to split the checks. So I asked her why we were not splitting them, and she responded with asking how I expected her to do such a thing. (I feel even someone with no food and beverage experience would know what to do to split checks among any size group) So when I said she could have written everything down according to check numbers in accordance to the guests eating/drinking each item, she tried ignoring me. After a few seconds go by of my looking at her with no response, she asked how to do that, and with my best efforts not to sound pampas or rude, I told her she could have written it all down. At that moment she laughed in my face and walked away. I requested a manager and was approached by one several minutes later. She apologized for the situation we were in, but then started questioning why we were there without a reservation, or without calling her ahead of time. (She claimed to be the events manager for the restaurant). I told her it was last minute and did not think a call or reservation was needed to sit in the bar area. She apologized one more time and said if we ever wanted to do a party or large dinner again to be sure to call and set it up with her. When she started walking away I said I wanted to talk to her about her server, Ericka. After explaining what happened, she said she would talk to her later on about it. In my opinion, she seemed to be brushing it off.   So after the manager leaves, I see Ericka just standing near the bar, not really doing much of anything. So I walk up to her asking what the plan was. She looked at me blankly and then asked if she was going to come figure out the checks so we could all leave. This is the point in the night that I was completely dumbfounded. She told me no, and then said that I could do it. After waiting a little bit for the shock to wear off of what she just said, I asked for some paper, and proceeded to go around the entire table, asking each person/couple what they got to eat and drink. I even wrote check numbers along with their names. So I go give her the paper, offer for any more assistance and she says no, and I go sit down. Several minutes go by and she walks up to me, hands me all of the split checks, says, "Here you go.", and walks away. Not only did I split the checks for her, she then expected me to pass them all out. to speed up the process I did so, just so we could pay and get out of there.   I have never in my life been treated so horribly by any sort of restaurant, not even fast food, and that says something. I will encourage everyone to NOT visit this place, unless you was mediocre food and beverages, and a ridiculous price.

KEm4WzBvjv0PIMlo3_VPXw.text: Why only 3.5 stars?   the yelp community seems overly critical or maybe it has to do with the pricing.  In my view a bit undeserved though.  Yes, every dish is a few dollars more than most places off strip.    But The whole experience was great with the Mexican villa theme.  Coming here on cinqo de Mayo with a lovely date was a solid winner.  The ambiance was rich, bustling with butterfly chatter.  The dining crowd was really alive and had some good vibe and energy.  The servers were super attentive and came by multiple times to check on our drinks, food etc.  the food?  The beef fajitas were tender.  I'm feeling they used at least a ny steak cut or better.  The lobster enchiladas were good too, lots of lobster.  First time seeing lobster served in an enchilada and it was a pleasant surprise.   The atmosphere and food definitely makes up for the price.  Having just been to Wolfgang pucks last night, this was 3 times better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SJhS6si67JKOwrVjn_B-3w.text: Not bad. Definitely not authentic Mexican food. I've been here twice for happy hour in the cantina, the margaritas are ok, strong but taste just like your typical premix-made margarita, the appetizers are good, a little overpriced for a HH special but oh well. The bartender was nice and attentive. I haven't had any problems with my food or drinks so far.  I like that they have live music, except I wish it was mariachi or Spanish music at least, which you'd think they would play, instead its an "Ed Sheeran" playing covers of Alanis Morresette. But they're trying to support local artists so ok. Still not a bad spot to wind down for an hour or two.

PW61bt3M9PJMFL31TkdMFA.text: I really like this place!  We go here several times a month. Their staff is super friendly. The food is delicious and served super quickly. Love the ambiance...and the prices are great.  They even have live music on a regular basis.

edy3IDZ0AOq0D70ntAixYA.text: Pretty Mex food place, looks nice, but is not quality in the food or drinks. For that I'm Out !

G-ny51kQLqdnbKDzvEgOlA.text: Look out Casa Don Juan.... you may have just been replaced! First time at @panchosvegas and not only is the food incredible..... I've never had service quite this good.  (And we eat out 3 or 4 nights a week). The exterior is quaint. The interior is beautiful. I repeat... the best service! Thank you for a great first experience Pancho's Las Vegas.... if our next visit is half as good as the first you've found yourself new regulars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ToYWLUEggEFdKzV00380pg.text: This restaurant was terrible for so many reasons.  Price: Every item on the menu is overpriced. $18 for a chicken quesadilla is ridiculous. $9 for a side of guacamole? Outrageous. They need to lower the price of all menu items by no less than $5.   Service: We sat at the table for at least 10 minutes before our waiter even came over to introduce himself and he didn't even do that. The first words were "are you ready to order?" When it was time to leave, it took another 10 minutes just for him to bring the check, after the table was cleared.   Food: Not only is it bad enough the food was overpriced, my father and I got sick the next day as well. We shared the chicken and shrimp fajitas and had explosive experiences in the bathroom the following morning. Speaking of the fajitas, it was 75% veggies and a little bit of meat. They even left the shells on the shrimp! So they had to be eaten individually instead of as part of the fajitas.   Myself and my family will never return to this establishment. There are MANY other Mexican restaurants with better food, better service, and better prices all across Vegas. Huge disappointment.

glBEvfNRduXgKixtdQvYLw.text: This restaraunt is def pricey, and it isnt the best Mexican food I've ever had so it's just not as justifiable with the prices. On average expect to pay $18 a plate. The restaurant is so cute and festive inside. I enjoy that the music was kept to the bar area and it was tasteful and not super loud in the main restaraunt. Service us alright, I expect a little more when you are paying these prices for food, but it wasnt bad. The second time we came here, we had the worst table, all the way in the back corner, it was hot and loud, we asked if we could move and they were very accommodating. This low review is mainly for the price. Enchilada sauce is alright, not the best. Panchos nachos were delish, quesadillas were nothing special. And the fried ice cream was a big disappointment. The outer exterior was hard and chewy and not at all like fried ice creams I've had before. Totally a bummer. I'm ok with paying these type of prices at a place like javiers because their food is amazing, panchos was just alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panchos nachos, free chips and salsa
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla (meh) and chicken enchilada/hard taco entree

8-ih3bTCUCye6BhXzuGn4Q.text: Consistent quality and service. Always a lot of food. Great for lunch. Staff always friendly and accommodating.

d_iYONF4-eVyphE9CzpDFg.text: Always Great Food. Love that they built the building themselves. Not in a plaza means a lot to me. They got it Right from the start

S19Kv7Q4SHZQkNCkpBoFBQ.text: Decided on a whim to try out Pancho's after driving by it for months. Walked in and were quickly seated in what looked like a foyer of a house (I'm sure part of the decor). Service was decent, food was not very flavorful and very over priced for the quality of food. $25 for Rajitas (their version of fajitas), $20 for a carne asada burrito and $10 for a kids meal of a quesadilla, rice and beans. All in all we spent $100 for four of us. I was too nice to not get up and walk out when I saw the prices but know I don't anticipate going back for food. On a positive note, if you choose to eat there, they offer free fried ice cream when you check in on yelp.

U7S610Ns0dT876t4eTLilg.text: We saw this place the other day when we were going to Red Robin and couldn't wait to try it . The service was decent ! Unfortunately, the food is pretty terrible !  When we sat down I was thinking 9.95 for kids meals sounded a bit crazy but when we opened our menus I realized the whole place is crazy !  $20 for chicken nachos ?  $18 for a taco salad with chicken ?  $19 for cheese enchiladas ?  Ok , well they must have AMAZING FOOD ! Unfortunately, it's all very far from . I had never Heard my husband complain about too much cheese on his nachos before but there was a ridiculous amount ! My taco salad could not have been anymore tasteless ! It's bad when you can't decipher between sour cream , guacamole, chicken , and balsamic dressing ! I mean the flavor was 100% missing ! You could clearly tell we weren't happy with our food . All I did was mix mine around , take a couple tasteless bites , and push it away . We weren't asked if our food was ok .. they acted like it was normal to pick up a table full of plates with 90% of the food untouched . This was not in any kind of way a $110 meal for 2 adults , a teenager , and 2 toddlers . My husband asked me who has a better Taco salad and my response was TACO BELL ! That's pretty sad :(

5hwNTv4aG1nyY5JjW10Lrw.text: The only reason we came here is because we had a coupon.  This place is overpriced, horrible service & the food is subpar. However, the atmosphere is very nice. The music wasnt too loud & the decorations were beautiful.  Our waiter was AWFUL! thank goodness he gave us a pitcher of our drink, becaus we barely saw him. In fact, after our food was dropped, we didn't see him until we had to ask the buser where our waiter was. That's ridiculous! You're supposed to ask how the food is? Or if we need anything else for our meal. (Some more salsa would have been nice) The food itself was blah. The carne asada was tough & had no flavor.

xlPbNz9LfEVsKASff2UD6g.text: This place is awesome! I got a coupon in the mail for a buy 1 get 1 entree, so I figured I'd take my sisters out to lunch! The ambiance creates the whole environment! I got the enchiladas espinaca and it was deee-lishhh-usss!!! Stuffed with spinach and mushroom with a side of rice and beans made the perfect lunch!! My sisters got the pork burrito and oven burrito, and they enjoyed theirs as well!! The staff is wonderful, we never had an empty glass or empty chip bowl. Wonderful experience for our first time! :)   *p.s. - if you check in on yelp you get a free fried ice cream!!! And that was amazingly tasty!!

7cpJFRLQuZ-pdQYP9UvXvw.text: Great atmosphere, the service was excellent the food was just ok. My 4 star is for how good the service was. I had the carne asada and it was just ok i wished it had more seasoning, the drinks were delicious meaning thier margaritas. They do have happy house if you seat at the bar and plenty of parking since is inside a shopping mall area.

JDe_82sInWeB8gVkNu5h-w.text: Ugh.  For about $18.95 per entree you can get the same food you'd get at Sharkys. Poor service.   Though it is cute inside the food is nothing special and overpriced.    If you are tempted they constantly have 2 for 1 specials every day.    Please put a great restaurant in this place!!!

WOYnbEqYFYCZkpAgOnIHZQ.text: So after many past debates on coming into Panchos, we decided to visit today on National Margarita Day during happy hour. Since their opening, we've heard the same reviews (and Yelp reviews confirm the rumors) that the food is yummy but very overpriced. We heard the best time to go is during Happy Hour so we finally decided to check them out during their Happy Hour. Quickly into our visit, we immediately agreed the prices were very high, including happy hour. The ambiance is awesome and makes you feel like you're not in Vegas but the prices remind you that you haven't left the city, even with the happy hour prices.  We sat at the bar and the service was great from bartender, manager and food runner but ugh that doesn't compensate the high menu prices. Mexican food is affordably reasonable but $15 for guacamole??? I couldn't convince myself to pay that price. My bf ordered the Wahoos tacos ($19, 2 tacos with rice & beans) but that was his only meal for the day so he splurged. He said they were yummy but expensive.    Also their menu is very long. You feel like you're reading a book when browsing through the options which immediately turned me off. Honestly it took me a bit to find the guacamole b/c I was scamming the menu looking for it and it blended right into the other menu items.  Great ambiance but high prices to pay for it

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry margarita made from real strawberries if on the rocks but mostly tasted like a traditional lime margarita

p6BQ2ckhlTvsvCjDu3Gqvw.text: No one at the front to say hello and sit us, waited for a while until we saw a waiter and asked what's going on.  The happy hour is only at the bar area, not for the rest of the patrons, weird rule.    Prices are ridiculous for what you get. Food was okay, but not great, and at that price point you expect great.  Other places in town have better food, better service, and better prices.  I will not come back.

sMhlmi5spJjD0T4-WCyn7Q.text: I love Poncho's!   Poncho's is located in Downtown Summerlin (near Trader Joe's) and is a great place to enjoy a cocktail and meal. My boyfriend and I are at Poncho's quite often..... maybe more offers that we should be. ;) We love sitting at the bar, the bartender's are great! We always start with a house margarita- one with salt for my boyfriend and one with tajin for me, the chips are always warm and the salsa is great! Depending on our appetite and mood we will either share the steak fajitas which we always request medium rare and comes with tortillas and all the sides or a three item combo with a chicken taco, and two cheese enchiladas. The entrees are good sized, so depending on your appetite may be worth sharing.  They also have a happy hour daily and taco Tuesdays! I highly recommend Poncho's!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Uq7T4Jjf07VZd_m04Oq1g.text: Took my staff there for dinner and had a great time. Leo was our server and was pleasant despite us getting wilder with every shot taken Food was good, atmosphere was authentic and very pretty.

78C_XB5FKybVPDjz_ikb9g.text: We came here due to the location of the restaurant right in downtown Summerlin. We were impressed. The restaurant is very pretty. There are observed scenes of vegetation all around with beautiful lights and it feels like you are outside in a beautiful courtyard. The food is delicious! We ordered the chicken enchiladas which were fantastic. The nachos they start you off with were fresh and it is obvious that they are housemaid with delicious salsa.  The margaritas are outstanding and we did order frozen ones which were really good! The service is very friendly and also fast. They are efficient and we really like that. The prices are more than reasonable and it was very affordable. The menu is vast with many different choices of delicious Mexican food. I will say that my friend who was there with me is from Mexico and she was thoroughly impressed. Highly recommended and we will definitely be coming back.

Uj9vh-XWp7XMh1JjY1aStw.text: We went for brunch. We had great service. The restaurant was very nice. Skylights everywhere with a ton of plants. Loved the atmosphere. I had huevos rancheros it was great.  They have a pretty cool drink menu that we'll have to come back to check out.

QHQS6H8tNwXLuTcWoUvbPg.text: Poncho's was amazing. The atmosphere it's awesome, food was hot flavored and filling. I'd recommend this place to anyone. Hard to be disappointed.

8E_XJ6zIYSmsheasp1_VOA.text: Great and friendly service.  We were quickly sat down and received chips & salsa.  Fresh and delicious Chips & Salsa! The food is absolutely delicious!  I had a Tostada with shredded beef, my husband had Sopas, and our son had Carne Asada Tacos.  We absolutely recommend!  Magnificent Ambience!

2YzRSvsddyRW3H8mgYK01w.text: Usually eat the fajitas which are always excellent and enough for 2-3 servings.  Never had a bad meal and the service has always been 5 STARS.

8EDc43xT107WESM3VS3ylQ.text: Nope. Nothing under $16 except soup. Margarita's ok. Did the job. Chips ok but salsa too heavy on pepper. Nice building.

zZaDPJDFNF1cM6E1isdENQ.text: Celebrating my mothers 79th birthday was a real treat here.  The food and service was great.  And so were the drinks.  Prices very good.  Ambiance was great.  Would definitely return again.  Even had a coupon for buy one get one free.  A great bargain and deal all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining room.

NQxMzmXs42fH1OuG0wUYNQ.text: Great atmosphere, food, and service! Spot on flavors! Free chips and salsa. Free fruit and champagne for Sunday brunch... And free fried ice cream with yelp check in. Even without the freebies, we will be regulars. We are fans of Old Town SD and local Lindo Michoacan. Super happy family of four!

T4NLnp_Z3XLHfR-5rfCwmw.text: Beyond friendly service. Claudia, our server, was so helpful and attentive. Better than jar salsa and fresh chips beforehand (which they will gladly replenish while you wait). Portions are ENORMOUS (which is probably why they are on the pricey side). The Burrito Ranchero came fully loaded with rice and beans inside with an amazing cheese- blend topping and shredded beef. The Chimichanga Especial is crispy and delicious. The pork melts in your mouth. It comes with enough rice and beans to feed at least another person (did I mention the enormous portions?).  A large but not crowded-feeling space. The tables, while plentiful, and not on top of each other.  Can't wait to come back.

4epk7X4Ch1w9zCcIot3iSg.text: This was a tough one to review.    I'd give five stars for the live music...which is why we actually go to Ponchos.  STEF N ROCK  are amazing and are there three nights a week. We make a point of being there  on Saturday nights...just to see them. They are worth paying the high price on the drinks...just to enjoy the performance.  Best live music on the West side of Vegas.  Go...you'll be impressed by the warmth of their voices.  Truly amazing.   I do love the decor of the restaurant...it's has so much character.    The food however lacks flavor.  How can Mexican food lack flavor!!?? Plus it's overpriced.  Big disappointment.    We do continue to patronize the cantina to enjoy the performances. The drinks are pricy but good.    So three stars seems fair.

FJqB0E3szh93ZyUdGB3jaw.text: Decided to give this place a shot today (instead of the hamburger place next door) and I'm glad we did!! We came on a Sunday and was asked if we would like fruit and a glass of champagne (no charge) which is a special for Sunday brunch  & the chips and salsa were very fresh and salsa was flavorful too.  My friend had the lobster enchiladas that she said were absolutely delicious!! I had the steak fajitas and the meat was very tender and fajita veggies seasoned perfectly (I got mine minus mushrooms and the cooked tomato on top) it was so much food that we had to take 1/2 of each of our meal home but, that's ok because that's dinner for later & not to mention the delicious fried ice cream that I received at no charge for checking in on Yelp  thank you!!

jrzPqNdf_E06t3ljdNn_dg.text: The ambiance of this place is lively. I love the garden style decoration. It really feels like you're inside the house patio. The energy is uplifting. The only downside is the price. It's quite pricey but the taste is excellent. Everything is delicious. I'm rating it 4 star just because of the price but other than that, food is delicious and service is quite alright.

buyLVUF2y6lzqFZ_GkPc0Q.text: Beautiful atmosphere, but subpar overpriced food. Not much flavor and the salsa tasted 'off'. This was our second time going. The first time was just only a bit better. I wish the food was as good as the decor. Unfortunately, we won't be back.

EMtsndOfHI9_DzsSLbPTww.text: We were told there was a 30 minute wait. 45 minutes later, our pager buzzed and when we turned it in, the hostess returned it. She said our table was not quite ready. So we proceeded to wait another 10 minutes. When we were led to our seats, our party walked past numerous empty tables to the back room, which was completely empty except for a party of 2. Service from there on was sloooooow. Our food arrived and it was mediocre at best. I love Mexican food....but the only thing I can say I enjoyed was the salsa and the bite of kids quesadilla I had of my daughters plate. It took so long most of our party had to leave with the kids before the check made its way to us. Who knows, grandma and grandpa may still be there attempting to pay.

zIQ0siuAREvZv_B0j37KjQ.text: Received a coupon in the mail so decided to try this place out again. Glad we did! Food was awesome, service was excellent! Our server, Miguel, was very knowledgeable, helpful, & gave us lots of options! We will be back soon.

aC4aPs38wGofP3xLQHAKfQ.text: We decided to try this place have seen it on Instagram . I ordered the chimichanga del Mar it was very good. My friend ordered taco and enchilada it was good too. The chips and salsa was good. It had a bit of a kick. The severs were very polite . I would recommend this place. It is a bit pricey compared to other Mexican restaurants I have eaten in. But its the location that makes it the price it is.

dxdoWXGF1tgwvGHT26s32g.text: This has got to be the cutest Mexican restaurant with a real Spanish hacienda house feel!! The decor is beautiful and festive :)   However, the food is PRICEY.  It's almost like paying Strip prices!! All entrees are approx $15+.  Now, I get it....Mexican food is often marginalized and placed in the "cheap food" category, like most Chinese restaurants outside of the Strip and Chinatown.  If you're looking for a really great/fancy Mexican meal, you should probably be charged for it. But I argue that the price here does not match the food that is provided.  I ordered a chicken & mango salad and it was $18.  The salad was good, but not $18 good.  The salad portion was like the boxed greens from costco, and the mango was not very ripe. Chicken was juicy and had some great umami flavoring, but not overly impressed with the salad as a whole.  My friend ordered the fish tacos, which came in a cook fish-shaped plate! Also $18, and likewise not worth the price.   Ultimately, Pancho's is a fun and festive restaurant but it's catering to the wrong crowd. If you have a cartoon character wearing a sombrero as your sign, you prob shouldn't be charging up to $20 for a meal.  Just sayin'.   Would def recommend for a fun date night or bday.  Service was friendly, but not the most efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango &amp; chicken salad
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos

v_8KlauJQOSXnTvvsDH3cg.text: Great atmosphere, great food, great service.   Walking into this restaurant you feel like you are in Mexico.  The building is authentic and welcoming. Walking inside the venue is bright with windows on the ceiling. There are large plants and a water fountain as a center piece. You feel as if you are sitting outside on a patio without any bugs or bad weather to ruin your dining experience.  We ordered a chicken chimmichamga and ranchero enchiladas and added chicken. Hands down the best enchiladas I've ever tasted. Prices are a little higher but the portion sizes make up for it. You are paying for quality and quantity. All the flavors were extraordinary. Their salsa had great flavor with a hint of heat, their coffee and iced tea tasted fresh and I couldn't stop myself from finishing my lunch even after I was full. Servers and hosts were nice and welcoming. We never needed anything and the service team works together to make sure the guest is satisfied.  This was my first visit here and will not be my last. I'm so happy we came in and tried a new Mexican restaurant from the norm. They offer different events on different days including taco Tuesday, live music, ect.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful entrance
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside patio waiting area
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chimmichamga

FiUDO5Tf-8UDy6cseUgPOw.text: First of all ask for Miguel!! The service from him & his side kick was 5 star! Second of all, the food is awesome. Salsa- great! I am vegetarian and they have amazing vegetarian options. I had the artichoke avocado enchiladas - superb. Black beans are wow! Don't order the rice as it has chicken stock in it (if you are vegetarian). We got treated like we are in a five-star restaurant. Margaritas excellent- we got the Cadillac margarita. Beer on tap - top notch! For "checking in" we are getting free fried ice cream and are following it with a Bailey's and coffee. We have about five restaurants that we cycle & we have just added this one to our list. I consider us very picky and all three of us loved this dinner! We are foodies in our DNA!

0XYZ0hk7hXC-Siqp09SbPg.text: Seriously????? How they get five stars review?? Extremely overpriced,food is ok & sad part is even the waiter doesn't know anything about their food, we ask for a suggestion he says he has no clue,now they're sending me two for one,lol I'll never ever go to this restaurant good luck to them!!

KaG9RlXsCUGHThbQ5ilrAA.text: I was disappointed because we were welcome into the bar area and ate and drank. They were having disco night and we were enjoying the music and Jason asked us if we weren't going to order anymore. If not could we leave. We had a party of seven and I have never been asked to leave. How rude.

z4LNY_qeu8ISGuxggSfJHg.text: Service is awesome.  Food is pretty good. We felt it was just an upscale  expensive version of an everyday Mexican restaurant. The guac was yummy, so were the Enchiladas Suizas. The Tacos de Tinga were a let down. Overall we would come again.
