47A2vif7MTYgFC1eWyMbVQ.text: I like the food. It wasn't half bad and it was a huge portion. We sat in the bar because it was a 20 min wait on a table. Chips were good and so was the salsa. They had great food. Too many tables in bar area, and I wonder if they cut corners with this place. I saw a guy fall out of the bar stool because the top broke off. Kinda scared me because the stools make you sit high. And because of all the tables and stools it looked like he landed into some of the stuff. Over crowded. They had many tvs playing all kinds of sports. Kinda quiet. Wish I had sat inside, it looked much more beautiful, and then maybe up stairs would be great.

QLdxt3tFX3PwQTanFhbK0g.text: Overrated restaurant. Went with my 16 year old son. Inside is nicely decorated. Very relaxing......until you crack open the menu! No entrees under $17.95. Had the burrito. No flavor for "authentic." They could have taken the time to add some flavor to the dish. very bland. Didn't want to use any more sodium that was more than already in the dish. Very large portion. Surrounded with some sort of a white sauce. Took $40 and could only get the dinner, with no drinks...soda or beer. Way overpriced, won't go back.

JXLTlOB-MG1KbyRa3GpUuA.text: I was craving fajitas and decided to check this place out versus going to Juan's Flaming Fajitas (a favorite spot for Mexican Food). Their fajitas are ok, the meat is very tender and has a different flavor, however there wasn't much of it. Tried the cake for dessert and it was a very large portion that tasted OK. I've never had Tres Leches cake before so I can't compare it to anything, but I probably wouldn't order it again.   There was no drink menu on the table which I thought was kind of odd. Two managers (I think they were Managers) came to the table more than once and interrupted us. I appreciate their concern, but more than 3 times of checking on us is a bit excessive - let the servers do their job!   I agree with other reviews regarding their price point, it is a bit high and I'm not sure why -- Nothing about the food was special and IMO being in Summerlin is not a good reason. Although we didn't explore the menu at all and stuck with a boring dish such as fajitas, we probably won't go back.

tURYnmOezHWF0yef_DoTpg.text: Pretty good Mexican food.  On my combination plate, the cheese enchilada, rice and beans were all prepared and presented as they should be, and I enjoyed them.  The chicken tamale, however, was not as good; it had large chunks of chicken breast which were dry and not especially flavorful.  I normally steer clear of chicken dishes in a Mexican restaurant, but that was the only kind of tamale they served and I had a hankering for a tamale.  My mistake.  The guacamole was plentiful and tasty, but with just a bit too much lime juice.  The salsa had way too much cilantro for my taste.  But the prices were reasonable, and the decor was pleasant.  The service was okay.  Our waiter was sometimes a little difficult to find, and there is more to friendly service than simply addressing the table as "mi amigos," but I really wasn't expecting the level of service at Le Cirque, so it was fine.  If I lived in Summerlin, I would go back to Pancho's.  But since it is a bit of a schlep from Spring Valley, I'll probably stick to places closer to home.  A truly good Mexican restaurant is tasty, cheap, and right around the corner.

av1t0b7iEkV6gH7HI-Hxrg.text: Absolutely fantastic customer service. The best I've experienced in a long time. The ambiance was light bright and spacious. The food is definitely expensive but I will be returning because it was delicious, the service was impeccable and the general feel of the place is relaxing and chill.

LemAxxYun2AeT9d0tfNXvg.text: Food was pretty bland. Service was very nice though and the atmosphere is good too. Don't know if I would return for anything specific, but this place is close to my house so that's convenient.

5iMwKC1lCdd8lnDEOzVRJA.text: Sadly the only thing I enjoyed was the ambiance and the chips and salsa. Lack of service since I waited almost 10 min for my meal while my boyfriend already had his. And mine was just soup. The waiter came to ask how everything was and didn't notice I was missing my food until we mentioned it . The food didn't really have much flavor and i guess I just expected more from my experience as this place was over priced to begin with.  Sad to be disappointed the look of this place really intrigued me.

YVwLD6KCXuEebTMjzd2aEQ.text: Had an amazing time at this perfect place with ambiance. Perfect shrimp salad and tried the skirt steak. Super yummy beans both pinto and refried. Got to sit next to the fountain and had really amazing and attentive service.  Food was super flavorful and staff beyond attentive. Check it out for something special.

q-EfabO1c93wnCjrzAw36g.text: Went here for my husbands birthday with the family. We were seated without 5 minutes. The waiter was nice. The menu prices were pricey and so we had high expectations for the flavoring of the food. My husband ordered the shrimp puffy tacos and I had the pollo de quesadilla. I have had better chicken quesadillas and my husband was disappointed that his food was bland tasting. I appreciated the manager checking in on us after we received our food. I love how most of the restaurants do that, like at Olive Garden and even at Cane's chicken. I checked in on Yelp and received a free fried ice cream which they only allow one per table. after waiting quite sometime for the check I had to get up and ask the lady at the front to get our waiter. If you don't mind the high prices and average Mexican food then this is your place.

mAUhe8tpCTBniLjFx9Teag.text: I was anxious for an evening away from home! Ok so the restaurant itself is beautiful with a lovely ambiance. The service is fair to good but the food and value is poor. Shrimp fajitas around $26 and if you want a combination of shrimp and chicken then shuck out $31. And that doesn't include a drink, tax  and tip. Around $40 for fajitas that were awful. I'm not a huge fan of Baja Fresh but even their fajitas taste better. This is a huge problem. I'll go to Lindo Michoacan any day over Pancho's. Save your tastebuds and your wallet and choose another restaurant.

ti7-0Cwhty33ymzNwmBRpQ.text: I wanted to love Panchos because of its proximity to my home. So after not loving my first visit, I went back a second time in an effort to convince myself that I did. The ambiance is top notch, but the buck- I'd say it stopped there, but when you scan the menu... you'll see they've passed the buck onto you. For example a taco plate is $22.- for tacos! Not Kobe beef tacos- just regular tacos.  I ordered a Titos Cosmo, it was served in a tiny martini glass with a teaspoon of Titos in it. It was more like receiving a communal sip of juice. Hardly enough to flush away this girls sins. The mahi ceviche was a 6.5 out of 10, and my a la carte  cheese enchilada was a disastrous, wet mess. My girlfriend ordered a simple cheese quesadilla which she found most palatable- at the tune of $17 (or more), I tried to verify this by looking the price up on their Internet menu, but... they don't show the prices on the Internet, curiously supportive of my claim that you're about to be gouged for food that you're likely to be disappointed with.  The live band that was playing in the bar area was remarkable. The foliage and finely detailed surroundings are unlike any local restaurant. Due to the uniquely executed ambiance their rent must be extraordinary, unfortunately their food is not.

25mr7c4zMRibw4hboPn5mg.text: This is my new favorite mexican restaurant!  Food was amazing, staff was incredible!  Love the ambiance, and cant wait to come back!

cQTmP3mIsLxQ5OSTEY0uZw.text: The one star is for the salsa which is mediocre at best. Our waiter was very nice and did a fine job but the food, alcohol, the desert all incredibly overpriced!!! I'd rather eat great food on a plastic milk crate sitting on cinderblocks than go back to this hole. Ordered a pork dish that was bland and flavorless. Ordered the chili Rellano and The poblano was still crunchy and cheese was not melted in the middle. Two people $70... Should've went to Tavoli!!!!! Avoid this place at all costs if you enjoy good Mexican food because you will not find it here. This place needs to GTFO of Summerlin. You don't believe me read the reviews! Horrible.

0gS3eZpbZk9FUi98173FIw.text: Beautiful restaurant with fresh plants and excellent lighting. The restaurant is open and has authentic paintings, fixtures and furniture. Most importantly the food is phenomenal! I am a regular at the Manhattan Beach Panchos and the new Panchos in Las Vegas is beyond belief! Excellent food and service in an authentic, beautiful atmosphere! The bar offers top quality cocktails and wine and the bartenders are professional and experienced. Just what Vegas needed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand staircase - stunning!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gourmet Crab Enchiladas

2tPpHKrhdC5ubhntTZaaFg.text: Great Mexican food, good service and very nice workers. Prices are a little high but they have so many coupons and specials it's worth it!  The music in the bar was a nice surprise and we have been back to listen to more!

X0H_5v0ajBXqEwJOJ6tE5w.text: Decent food. Way over priced for what it is.  Chicken fajitas were just ok. For $23 I'd expect a bit more flavor. Steak burrito was tasty. The cocktail servers uniform is a bit too revealing and their hair wasn't tied back which is really disgusting. It was good, but because of the prices, we won't be back.

R1A7ZrgVHsjsNw3Rsa1uQQ.text: This is the closest to real mexican food I've find in Las Vegas. I am mexican and I can vouch for it. Please disregard other comments, please don't make it more tex-mex. Thank you!

NutaWZqm9ukJPBzZEr9_9A.text: I usually don't come to high end Mexican restaurants because they are highly overrated. I ordered a burrito and it was absolutely bland, it did NOT taste authentic. This is why I stick to hole in the wall Mexican restaurants.. and the price was insane for the quality of their food.

BfTvqnJGVNPy_78hBYfYEw.text: This place is by far my most favorite Mexican restaurant.  Everything from the chips and salsa to the enchiladas to the tacos tastes delicious and authentic!!!!  I used to go to Lindo because Ricardo's is gone and Macayos is too far from my house but I was thrilled to find this place!!!  Yes the prices are slightly higher than a Macayos or Ricardo's, but it's in Downtown Summerlin.  The real estate there has a significant premium attached to it.  They do have an excellent happy hour if you're on a budget!

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3NwyhNEfmmUeWrCHT06WOw.text: Great restaurant. The food was great and the service was too. It was a little noisy only because they had live music. Will definitely be back

GG6hQm-loXUl-wVITISS_g.text: Great atmosphere, food was good but did have a major problem. We ordered nachos with shredded chicken. As my child took a bite there were sharp bones left in the chicken. It hurt my child but he ended up being ok. Management came over and addressed the situation professionally. I was happy with how they handle it but hindered our experience there. I will give second shot as everything else was good.

kBPfbtzHtUs_u1dfHrb4zg.text: Terrible and overpriced.  Lunch plate avg $15 a dish for a taco, enchilada and rice n beans...you have been warned

w0mZ2r2hvwsOYL6mQMt4Lw.text: Wayyyyy too expensive for mediocre food. Didn't realize how pricey it was. Won't ever dine here again. For the crazy prices they charge, I'd much rather go to Javier's!!

B3cViKlrGsehQRfFie8q5w.text: I have gotten to love this place. When they first opened, the wait was too long and I didn't find the quality of food and drinks to be worth the prices that are considered by some on the high-end for Mexican. When you consider what you're getting, it's not really overpriced. It's authentic style Mexican. So if you're looking for Chiles style cheaper meals, you won't like it here. The atmosphere is great, the service is spectacular and the margaritas are divine. We get the "special" margaritas with the extra Grand Marnier on top. The guacamole is delicious. I usually get fajitas, but this last visit, I ordered the steak quesadilla and split it with my daughter. It was also delicious. My husband usually orders something the waiter recommends and is always pleased. To our surprise, our waiter remembered what my husband had ordered a month prior and asked if he'd like the same or to try something else. This is what sealed the deal for us. When the wait staff is this attentive, management is as well and the entire restaurant reflects these attitudes. Towards the end of the meal, the manager stopped by and was super friendly and just like our waiter, seemed to enjoy his job. He asked for some feedback, and I shared with him how the word around town (or at least amongst our friends) is that they are overpriced. He asked what I thought, and I explained how after this visit, I have come to realize you pay for what you get. I further explained about the atmosphere, food and drink quality and staff are what we are also paying for. He appreciated our comments and bought us a round of shots. Now that is how I like to be treated! And I do love their Margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying rajitas, quac and margaritas!

P7i3QpIad0nzhUEnNgIZEQ.text: Really expensive for frozen food quality.  Also the lack of customer service is baffling.  I told the waiter that we were celebrating a birthday.  He didn't even ask if we wanted to order dessert.  Our dishes took forever too.  We were seated upstairs where it was dark as a cave...Probably so that we wouldn't be able to see our food.  My enchiladas were flavorless and my rice was hard.  I gave the one star for the cute decor.  I don't recommend this place.  Taco Bell is higher quality.  I bet the rent is expensive in DT Summerlin, but that doesn't justify $70 for 2 TV dinners:(

RTQ8s6IwHGaTteLLnrq8aQ.text: The prices here are comical. The waitress literally began her introduction by telling us that the food is too expensive, however she assured us that it was worth it, which it was not. The guacamole alone here is $14.95. Insane! The salsa was not good either, it was too spicy (and I love heat!) and bland. That being said, my friend ordered a kiwi margarita (which is mysteriously priced at a reasonable $10.95) and it was one of the best I have ever tasted. There was also live music in the bar area and the band playing was fantastic. There were fliers up saying that have comedy and karaoke as well. All in all I say come for the drinks and entertainment but skip the food.

3ofDvREIbMPAZRWZIuazRw.text: Came in for dinner with my family on a Wednesday evening. The food was delicious and very generous quantities. And our server Miguel was one of the best servers I've ever had. So polite and attentive without being a hoverer. Will definitely come back

jcQF6Sscrudfk0XfHaqjiQ.text: Ambiance is great but food falls short of being authentic. Food is very bland. Price is high for sub par food. Service is okay. Disappointing reunion dinner with friends. Won't be going back.

aGwd6otMNS1H7Aqmx8EcCw.text: Went there to meet some friends last week during happy hour.  Sat in the bar, which had a good atmosphere.  The menu was expensive.  The Happy Hour Menu was "1/2 off" except for the fish dishes, ie. ceviche and fish tacos, which I thought was lame.  The bartenders were very personable.  There were two large televisions behind the bar and a few more which were good for watching sports.  There was live music starting at 10pm which I did not stay for.  I did not get a chance to eat in the restaurant.

lAEz7ARe1_IAYL9wS3ViHw.text: We couldn't wait for this place to open..huge huge disappointed..ordered enchiladas and chx taco..the red enchilada sauce had no flavor..tasted like a can of tomato sauce..it was americanized mexican food..I know good mexican food..and this place is far from it..the place is beautiful inside..was crowded and we ate upstairs on 2nd flr..no bathroom upstairs..will never go back again..going to give El Dorado Cantina a try..heard great things about that place..

u96PIKxz_bb35IxTpGk6zw.text: Really nice decor. Good California style Mexican food. Large portions and good quality.  The pork chile Verde burrito is large. Very spicy with great flavor and tender meat. The Carne Asada tacos are larger than street tacos and very filling. Make sure to try the original Margarita.

99lcC5xkuAsOCO1CarF3sg.text: I just don't see how this place is going to last.  The prices are just too high for the quality of food provided. The only reason I went was because of the happy hour half off appetizers and discounted drinks.     The chips were cold and seemed like the type of cheap chips you'd get at a grocery store.   And the salsa was completely uninspiring -- typical boring, tasteless, spiceless garden salsa that could've easily come from a grocery store bottle.  I asked if they had a hotter, habanero type salsa -- and was provided with habanero Tabasco sauce (I like Tabasco sauce, but not exactly what I was looking for)  Tried the naughty maggie Margarita.   Found it to be no more interesting than a standard Margarita.   My main dish was the queso fundido appetizer (it was just me, so the large appetizer was a full meal).  Well, it looked nothing like what I'm used to seeing with queso fundido at other Mexican restaurants.... looked more like a plate of sour cream. Flavor was okay but not something I would order again. .. and had I paid the usual full $16 price for this appetizer, I would've been very disappointed...instead of just moderately disappointed.    When the check arrived,  the happy hour discount amount for what I ordered was incorrect so that had to be fixed.  But it actually couldn't be fixed and instead I had to be given an additional dollar off (so double check the pricing for those going for the happy hours deals).  And I was charged the full price on the Margarita because apparently that was not part of the happy hour special discounted drinks (something that was not clearly explained by my waitress when I ordered.... even though I had expressly asked her about the drink specials just before I ordered it -- so she clearly knew where my head was at and allowed me to order the non-discounted drink instead ..... a little bit deceptive if you ask me).    I'm sorry to say but there is just nothing good to report about this place. I hope the restaurant that takes over this place after they inevitably close does a complete overhaul.   I had high hopes for this place,  but having gotten a small bad taste, there is simply no reason for me to ever come back and try anything else.  If Yelp allowed for zero stars, that would've been my rating.  Would someone please message me and tell me where I can get some decent very spicy, but smooth salsa in this city!!  Is that too much to ask for?

r3gKWibrbdDvxGgd00j4DQ.text: Really cozy place to eat with live music, good food, large servings and free fried ice cream when you check in with yelp and you can use a $16 off entire bill coupon that you get from the mail!

kkYv777lqF92qkgW126sPg.text: Awesome Mexican food!  Fabulous service and really cool atmosphere!!  Best margaritas in Las Vegas!

ct4CCmBlLEplk1R09BxYqQ.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere, excellent service and LIVE entertainment!! What more could you ask for? This place just opened and will be THE spot before you know it.

Pj-72fLKLFHCIQl_zqMEHw.text: Stopped in on a Friday night. Was busy but there was no wait for two. Got seated right away. Walking in I was very impressed. True Spanish style decorative art and more. Got drinks pretty quickly and service was excellent. On to the food. Chips and salsa were typical. Salsa was soupy with small chunks of tomato. Had a little spicy flavor to it but it was not unbearable. Had wahoo fish tacos and cheese enchiladas for entrees. Fish was flavorful and came with  a creamy sauce to garnish the tacos. Cheese enchiladas were very good and better than most Mexican restaurants. Beans and rice were good but when food was delivered the beans and rice were warm and not hot. A little disappointed the hot meal ordered was not hot. The worst part of the night was when the bill came. The prices here are extremely high and not worth it.

UrmctrwWgYgKwnxR148kMw.text: Second time in this restaurant. Food very good but service was not as great. Waiter was barely checking on us and looked confused. He messed up in my drink once but I let it pass. Not too bad to get s bad tip though. The guy tried.

bCOG3RLED1VU_ReYMwkFWA.text: My family and I have been to Pancho's 5 or 6 times and every time we've had amazing service. Let me say, the food is always great and the prices are fair. The manager, Doug is always pleasant and welcoming. He's so personable with everyone that visits. Thank you for the great service.

3twR3msx5KHmQqElcsBhQw.text: Wow. Just wow. Tinga Poblano is on the must have list!  The manager was great - thanks for the bean dip!  Will definitely be back. I'm sure there's a Naughty Maggie with my name on it. Maybe 2

jah5r8N8NsBtrSXgWSh-PQ.text: John and I went for the first time after a movie this Friday night... Huge restaurant.. Two floors... About 6:30 PM.... Told we would have to wait for a table for 15 To 30 minutes.... Had our table in 10 minutes...Had to take our margaritas from the bar.... John had the Wahoo Fish Tacos.. I had the Seafood Quesidillas... And they were both very good and the service was excellent.. Very prompt! They team serve so it was very efficient! I look forward to visiting again.

qimyjpj4rCOoC403CgZ1Vw.text: I went there for lunch on a Tuesday and it wasn't crowded as it was taco Tuesday. Surprised! We had a coupon and glad I did. The combination plates are large in portions  but the food was tasteless. The chips were the best part. My chicken tamale was dry and tasteless and the rice wasn't good. Will not go back. Pretty restaurant- 5 stars for atmosphere.

PfewbZf3xuzy8W5Mp3mpNg.text: The architect and decor is beautiful but is definitely way overpriced. The food is bland nothing special. Based on the pricing I would rather head to the strip, then eat there again.. nothing special. Reviews were right

o5dyvaCJpcB7kVbQ3bJisQ.text: The service was good but their food is not impressive. I have had a lot better and the prices are kinda high. Don't order the queso... It was cream cheese... And it was $15.

SCWyVgfvoqWFeHuJUh4hCQ.text: Had lunch here. I really liked it. I had a cheese enchilada and a chili relleno. It was so yummy! Service was good too! I will be returning!

oMM2hc4MW-Z_4OnryY1Jpg.text: Okay let me start by saying the interior of this place is adorable I love it. Second! The food is amazing we FINALLY found our Mexican place! Thank god three years in Vegas and we found It! Third and absolutely most important is the service.. Holy hell the manager greeted us instantly jokes with us and made us feel at home the waiters are incredible on top of refills recommending meals just coming by to check on us to make sure everything is okay. We had Alfredo as our waiter and Miguel helped us as well and I don't think I've laughed so hard. The manager is the sweetest guy and really attentive to every table! I can't say enough amazing things about this place no review could describe the experience we had here. We will be back!

0ZfgCpcUbIG1u3gbmxIzUg.text: Food is really good. Strawberry margarita with strawberry puree is good. Salsa is good. Price is a few dollars more than Lindo Michoacan. 4 stars because they don't have homemade tortillas. :( it's a must.

mVykLV5CIngx3hRp1N3VXw.text: I tried Pancho's yesterday and it was not great. Like all the other reviews below, the space is beautiful but the food was too pricey for what it was. We were offered guacamole as we sat down and it came out to $15 for cold, stored guacamole. I know it's generally an extra cost, but I'd appreciate it if I was told that before I even had a chance to look at the menu. Besides that, the service was good and the manager even came to check in.

l58JAV0eO0o55B2j9KyZIA.text: This place has really nice decor, lots of plants and a solid Chili Verde. But there is nothing else that really stands out to me to make this place a "Solid" Mexican Restaurant. First lets start with pricing. Geez. They make Lindo Michoacan look cheap. Micheladas.....Seriously! How do you NOT carry Clamato....SMH...Only specialty cocktail on the "Non-Existent" cocktail menu is called a, Naughty Maggie which combines regular Cuervo Gold with a float of Grand Marnier. Never have I heard or seen a mariachi band at this place other than a 2 person 80's band that played for 5 ppl at the bar. I hope this place get is together and realizes they are not in CA and they are in Summerlin, NEVADA. Way different clientele. If not they won't be open for long.

b2emWY8Gzgr-irg5HU4Hzw.text: Beautiful place but horrible drinks, food and service. You pay for what you see not for what you eat. Is like TacoBell but upgrated. Very expensive and not welcoming at all. How did they survive for 40 years with this type of food and service. Our America has lost the good taste for food and they settle for looks. I rather it frozen Mexican burritos and save my money.

maa6JvZFdDsUWOW0ehduWA.text: Service was fine, food was OK, prices are insane.  This is a great looking restaurant, and I was so excited to visit that I went on the second day it was open. I won't judge the service too much since it's always crazy during the opening, although I'm not sure why waiters always feel comfortable complaining about their day and other customers to me (this happens at many restaurants, not just this one).  Pancho's is basically a '90s throwback Mexican restaurant with Americanized Mexican food, which isn't a bad thing. The obsession with authenticity has made me miss this stuff, but I can't imagine the reviewers who are calling this authentic have ever been outside their all-inclusive in Cancun.  We ordered an appetizer platter, which was about $18, and while it was big, it would've been cheaper at any other Mexican restaurant. The quesadillas were great, and the rest was standard. My husband got the steak fajitas, and this was the tiniest serving of fajitas I've ever seen, but he said the steak was excellent. I got the Pancho's trio of enchiladas, and they were your usual enchiladas, both in size and flavor.  We thought about ordering the $16 guacamole, but the waiter said we can try the side portion that comes with our appetizer platter. It's pretty much just mashed up avocado. No flavor whatsoever, and they charge more than any place I've ever been to, including those on the Strip.  All the food was good but in no way justifies the fact that they charge twice as much as every other Mexican restaurant. This is probably the most expensive Mexican place I've seen, and there was absolutely nothing special about the food. They'll need to cut the prices by nearly half to keep a regular clientele. We spent $67 on those three items, and went to Casa Don Juan the next week and got the same stuff for $28, and it tasted much better.  Another problem was that there were little kids running around all over the place. None of them were with the same party, but for whatever reason, everyone felt comfortable letting their kids run around in circles in a packed restaurant full of rushing waiters. It's common to see someone who doesn't care what their kid is doing, but it's just weird when it's a room full of careless parents.  The waiter said seafood is their specialty, so I'll go back to try it and see if it's any better than the rest. Unlike what the last reviewer said, we are not cheap. We regularly eat at restaurants that are more expensive than this, but the quality matches the price at those places. Pancho's just doesn't do it. I figure this restaurant will attract the same flavorless Summerlin soccer mom crowd as Crave.

b0wJwkVvy70bcnzTXGcK3g.text: Our family has been excited to try Panchos. We were not disappointed with the ambiance. It is obvious they have invested a lot of money, which they are trying to recover with their ridiculous menu prices. I had the Camerones diablo, which was 25.00 for four shrimp floating in a bed of oil. I did not enjoy it at all. The views from the others dining with me were mixed on their food, but all agreed, too pricy. The service was excellent-very attentive, but does not make up for extremely expensive mediocre food.

IYguVKCaWtQXA2ihmfW2Jg.text: Great Mexican Food!! Huge menu, friendly staff, great server Cynthia, the manager went up to every table to check on them. Great margaritas as well. We'll definitely be back.

yW0J8KEpoaCvoFX-VKotiQ.text: We've been waiting for a decent Mexican restaurant in Vegas forever. The wait continues. The 2 $ rating is ridiculous! This place was WAY over priced. $10 for a kids meal? The mini pizza was the size of a bagel bite. Not great for a 9 year old. The food was so bland you could barely taste it. Took 15 minutes to get soda and another 10 minutes to get a glass of water. The staff was nice but that's where the "good" ended. The menu showed that kids meals included drinks but when the check came we were charged $3.25 for 3 kids drinks. When I asked about it, 6 people told me they weren't sure if we were supposed to be charged. Really? We definitely won't be going back there. SO NOT WORTH IT!

e2ICfPk-AZ7f0nFWedToCQ.text: Restaurant is beautiful, all our family had great hopes the foods was gonna be as nice as its looks, chips and salsa is OK but when the food came wow 25 dollar carne asada steak really bad quality it tasted like liver very dry and leathery, my wife had chicken and was undercooked and the flavor was horrible all of us left the food almost untouched, prices are high, service is not good and the food is terrible, if u are in a diet come to panchos because u end up eating nothing

1NcvvELt2n0PDWbEj2HFpg.text: Very cool interior; felt like you were in someone's home. Service was solid and food was good, but prices are WAY too high for being a neighborhood restaurant. Wouldn't be a place I'd frequent because of that. There are other local Mexican restaurants that are just as good and much more reasonably priced.

gYcz69liAYVvY5zEf7NX0g.text: Went there last night. My girlfriend was on a knee scooter with a cast on her foot.  We also had an elderly couple with us. The hostess takes us upstairs to our table. They aren't very observant. Maybe she should have asked if everyone in the party can get up the stairs...it would be a novel idea to offer the elevator. Waitresses and hostesses are plenty nice.   Manager came by and asked how the queso fundido was. We said it could use a little more spice. Then suggested maybe a spicy one and a not spicy one for the menu. Manager cracked a stupid sarcastic joke that maybe the restaurant could be half Chinese and half Mexican. He acted and looked like a clown. He was a jerk off.  I ordered the Carne Asada, the GF ordered the seafood chimichanga. The old folks ordered a combo dinner and a beef chimichanga. The Carne Asada they serve is a hunk of sirloin. It is tough and chewy. Authentic Carne Asada dishes are usually made with skirt steak.   Girlfriend loved her seafood chimi. Heard no complaints from the olds regarding their food.  Bartender in the Bar was pleasant and helpful while we waited and the three waitresses were fun to talk to.  We ordered no alcohol with our dinner and the bill was well over $100.00   The girlfriend said she prefers Robertos Taco Shop for tastiness of food and price. I agree with her.  Funny thing is that I have been to Panchos on Rosecrans 100s of times for over 30 years. I remember the food being better and the price not as expensive there.  I was disappointed over all.

OmnOrRw2QuvBgKc0CeXbAg.text: Very over priced for what it is!! Pretty much $20 a plate, that's NOT including rice n beans with most of the meals. Definitely don't need to go back, nothing special and would not pay that kind of money for food like that!

N1srWWWEEuO_YcL8h0C3Dg.text: oh wow, their chicken chimichanga is delicious!  Everyone is friendly, yummy chips but salsa is too spicy for us.

Mah-iSTc8x3Or_qqMeWOKA.text: Went for Sunday brunch with a group and had a great time. From the chips and salsa to the bloody mary and fried ice cream we enjoyed everything Ponchos has. Great location and atmosphere as well

5Hk959XO8kQzq42WGeFkww.text: My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night.  Great Mexican food. This place has been open in Manhattan Beach for over 40 years and their first expansion is in Vegas by Downtown Summerlin. They're doing something right. We love the So Cal decor and lively vibe inside the restaurant.   What I'm going to rave about are the margaritas. I love the use of fresh fruit! The flavor is so much better than the sugary product other establishments use for their blended cocktails.   Jose and Ivan did a great job making sure our table was not left wanting. Very friendly staff overall. We will be back.

Hd9yMtHWvtvHUS2imYabDA.text: I really enjoy Mexican food but this spot had me focusing myself to stop eating it was so good. The service was on point as well. I would and will be coming back. They also have entertainment in the evenings.  The have comedy and music and a bar area to watch sport events.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks were awesome.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb beef tostada!!!

Ndu0OAvdr8Z5YQ2brRJnHg.text: Convenient Downtown Summerlin location, stunning decor, extensive and interesting menu, perfect service from Augustin, more than generous portions, and very good value.  Definitely recommend the artichoke and mushroom quesadillas and the chili relleno (oh yeah, and the margaritas, too)

1yhJnygFMNpwrJYRLl-tMw.text: What a beautiful restaurant that must have cost millions to build .  We were looking forward to a upscale Mexican restaurant to compete with Javier's at Aria.  What we got was no better than an average at best Mexican restaurant . Food quality was fair , drinks were fine but expensive and finally desert was poor . I expect this restaurant to last as long as the investor figures out that money needs to go into the kitchen and not just the entertainment .  Hope it improves and they figure it out .

qY5bOJGITaQ_5PPpGdTyxw.text: Last Friday, the 16th, we dined for the first time at Pancho's and due to high prices, instead chose happy hour in the bar.   But alas!  The prices were so much more than all the other happy hours in town that we decided to split an order of $17 FAJITAS on regular menu.  I wanted a margarita but my only choice was $7.50 so I opted for a $5.00 Negro Modelo.   The chips and salsa were very good and so were the nicely charred chicken fajitas, an ample portion.  The best part of our experience was our very competent & personable server Claudia who belongs in a 5 star restaurant.  We also appreciated the ambiance and the fact that their TV screens are terrific & well situated for watching a game.  With the huge population of Mexican restaurants in our city, as well as happy hours at almost any restaurant, Pancho's has much competition.  They could begin by dropping the prices and changing the music.  We're waiting (way too long) for this town to come out of the clouds & take advantage of fine music for ALL generations.  Let's begin to EDUCATE, think outside the box, & not do "business as usual."

Ef4uji_e3YW8T6BpkgTysA.text: DELICIOUS food! EXCELLENT service...I highly recommend this restaurant ... My new favorite Mexican restaurant :)

koMX8IVyLDFJhOshkETqjw.text: Pancho's is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. They have great service, a beautiful atmosphere, and incredible food! I've tried several dishes but always go back to the Chimichanga Especial.   The fried ice cream is a must have!

nmm_ILHsS2xE0-HIClZ8BA.text: Great service, brought all 4 kids and 2 adults and they were nothing but happy and helpful to us. The manager even brought my kids coins to throw in the water fountain to make a wish and kids got free ice cream!! Fun atmosphere and good as Mexican played food gets

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got this for free for checking in with Yelp!!! Yum

uM0aEU-9Im6UYfoDHCgPoA.text: Same story as others have written.. Beautiful interior, below average food and extremely expensive. 'Nuff said...

ka-EVSTJyohGh82utOVtFg.text: Great Service Beautiful Atmosphere. Meal was very good... How does this place justify a 2 Beef Tacos with Rice n Beans for $17.50 ???

cxmBKmZjl1KJutVRgCNYew.text: The decor is nice and our server was attentive. I had a margarita and it was not good for $9.75 I'd expect better. The food was not very good. It lacked seasoning and was luke warm.  It seems like they try to cover up bland food with sauces and or salsa. For the flavor and portion size this place is over priced. We came here because I wanted to try it for my birthday. My husband low key told them it was and they did nothing. Too bad! Nice place but not worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas suizas and a margarita. Both lack luster.

IVqQx0DUPHkSgilLg3KNdA.text: Looked so good, but a big let down.  The nachos are a big mushy pile of melted cheese...and carrots?  Skip Panchos, much better places to get Mexican in Las Vegas.

DjlY1yfUyZAo52F9gA7ksg.text: I feel very happy with our visit to Pancho's today! The place is stunning inside and out! I was incredibly impressed with the service we received considering the place was incredibly busy!! I was very happy with quick service, our drinks were out in a flash! ( I had the strawberry margarita on the rocks and a Cadillac margarita on the rocks as well! Both were absolutely amazing)  I was very happy that the kids food was brought out first since they kids are always fidgety and impatient. Kids ordered a quesadilla came with beans and our choice of fries and macaroni and cheese- the boys devoured their meal and they're usually quite picky when it comes to restaurants! I ordered the burrito ranchero de carnitas and it was worth every penny! Our waiter was very attentive to all our needs, definitely felt the place is family oriented as our kids greatly approved of this restaurant! Definitely making this a regular for Mexican!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac Margarita is a must! My new favorite!!

hiHW20KqeVaqs2nAZ1Ydgw.text: Awesome service. I stumbled upon this randomly looking for a happy hour spot and everything from the food and drink to the service was great. We sat in the cantina and our waitress was able to balance all the tables without sacrificing the quality of service.  Also: The mole is top notch here!

gHMtZ2K0VczCd0OG6046Pw.text: The atmosphere: 5 stars.We had a party of 7 plus a child and made reservations for 630. Reservations highly recommended as this place is rightfully busy! The service was amazing from the hostesses seating us immediately, to the very understanding, accommodating and efficient server,  even the manager, Doug, was friendly and entertaining.  The Food: 5 stars. We have a very pocky, highly needy (allergies, likes and dislikes) group of friends. This place was spot on! Extremely accommodating, fast, delicious, hot and fresh. Gluten allergies, dairy allergies, vegetarians, you name we have it. The menu offers a very large array of choices. Food was seasoned succulently, prepared quickly and correctly. It was purely amazing! Pancho's is an instant favorite for sure.

Soy733EQaCngpvUKs_jArA.text: Restaurant open till 930 tonight bar is separate with live music scene and karaoke some nights. Service is great from bartenders Ariana is awesome cocktail server! I had the fajitas they were awesome with a great portion size

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x4ixj--GPYFfSH2qGx6aBA.text: Panchos has outdone themselves with Christmas decorations! Beautiful decorations will get you in the spirit of Christmas. I was there last week and returning this week with friends. The food is outstanding, always fresh and delicious. Definitely the top Mexican restaurant in Vegas/Summerlin. The service is friendly and attentive.

Q53OSq2doxcO9OL_khS4gg.text: 2nd time here... food is either THE best or a very close 2nd for Mexican in Las Vegas. Chips and salsa are really good. The shredded beef they use in tacos and the burrito ranchero is really good. It's priced a little higher than most but you're in Summerlin, not the "historic district".

pl2zLDEIlIAr_87QzIAyTw.text: So this my deal with Panchos.  Our food was delicious. Everyone enjoyed the meal. Salsa was quite delicious. But, and it's a big deal, it's just too pricey. Everything was priced like a restaurant in one of the top Strip hotels. $7.50 for a Mexican draft beer. About $20 for a carne asada chimichanga. $23 for a marinated pork dish. Everything tastes great and the service was on point. But $130 for four entrees, two sodas and four beers is just way too expensive for a standalone Mexican restaurant, even in Summerlin. They need to rethink their pricing in my opinion, if they want to be around as long as Lindo Michiocan or Frank & Finas.  Just too expensive to rate higher than 3 stars.

82cI61hTgJVNLVUgZ0rMqA.text: This is the 3rd time I have been at Pancho's and will be my last. Each time there has been some issue and it's never resolved completely. Today I ordered the Pancho's combo. Not only was the plate obviously left sitting under the warmer too long as the food all had a crust on top and the cheese from the enchilada was oozing out with barely any left inside, the rellano was burnt on the outside and the inside was hard like play doh, the rice was crispy not soft and moist. In addition to that the only solution they offered was for me to get a new plate (no time for that) or order something else. At least the taco was good. I find it's too expensive and service is not great. After today we will go elsewhere.

jVcxYuG8TcpLAkJqcpCXjg.text: Food was very bland and very boring it came out in less than 5 min????  So it's not made to order?

MsunljSCFnmiOdBot0ghIg.text: We went to this restaurant by asking SIRI for a Mexican restaurant on our way to Red Rock Casino at 7:45pm. It is a little pricey but the food is great. The pork chile verde is unbelievably delicious. Different seasoning than I have had before, margarita was great. Highly recommend. I will go again.

B2i1WaRnYY6tlC0LydF3qw.text: Food was just ok (they seem to have a fear of salt). Service was friendly but god awfully slow for a restaurant that was nearly empty at 8pm on a Sunday. The prices reflect the venue but definitely not the food or service.   Chips needed salt. Took forever to get more salsa.  Had to have the manager go ask someone to get it.   Had the mole enchilada...no good rich mole flavor. More like a bland and somewhat gritty sauce.   Used the yelp offer for free fried ice cream. This was not fresh, probably one of a batch from early in the day or say before. Ice cream was hard frozen and icy in the middle and the cornflakes were chewy.   Overall, for as well known as this place is in SoCal, this Vegas location needs help. The lack of crowds is showing it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday 7/17/16
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday 7/18/16

FgfqNlHYL5jDHPnM_c7UvA.text: I thought the food was good, yet the prices were very high for Mexican food.  The location is great (downtown Summerlin).  For me to bring my family back they would have to lower their prices.

pHoxVWBqbn4hvZm25lTpSw.text: Larger inside than it appears outside. Staff friendly. Prepare yourself for large servings. I had the crab and shrimp quesadilla and one mahi mahi crispy taco (made crispy on my request). The quesadilla was tasty. Couldn't eat all of it. The fish taco was extremely fishy. I didn't eat it. I had a skinny margarita with the organic house made tequila which was also tasty.

AlWWcBmsQZ8fVDKOhukMmg.text: Amazing staff and service! The staff makes you feel like you're family. The food was fresh and delicious and came out right away. The margaritas were great and the atmosphere is wonderful. Definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6laaPcLTXI7usImpygxrJA.text: We had a wonderful meal today at Pancho's . We originally intended to have lunch at Red Robin but we couldn't resist the aroma coming from here ! We came in and were greeted and seated immediately . The chips and salsa were amazing ! I ordered the #6 combination and it's sooo much food ! Really good service , food and the ambiance is so cool . We will return .

NzhcXVv1q0uOI_ZkbGpM6g.text: So, I've heard from my family that the food at this place was not very good. Me being who I am I'd rather make that decision for myself and not listen to hearsay. I finally went to lunch here the other day to find out what it was all about. Walking in the place was amazingly beautiful. Spanish mission style with a little tropical flair. It is huge with an upstairs area for parties. We sat down immediately and the people were friendly. We ordered pretty much right away and the food came out very quickly. I took my first bite and immediately knew I could not finish this dish. The waitress came by to check on us and I asked her I had to send it back and order something else. I NEVER do this. Ever. That's how awful it was. My second dish was much more palatable but far from the best I've ever had. If this restaurant could fix their food, it would be such an amazing place to eat and drink. My advice would be to add more flavor and not over cook the meat beyond recognition. Also, maybe a avoid letting the sides make the main dish soggy. We were also served chips and salsa without dishes to eat it over.

hD9mTVFXZ_ZGzVdV6p7hoQ.text: Okay - I have to admit, it is a little pricey. But you also don't have drive all over town searching for anything more.   Great Food, Bar (and Happy Hour), LIVE Music and Atmosphere.  If you're on a strict budget, probably not your first choice. But if you want a well rounded, Summerlin experience. Give it a try. All of the musicians we have seen, are well worth it.

4ZAQiFfxjoMb8FwUTWRZ2g.text: Last minute decision, to have dinner here. Yelp rating on this spot could be misleading. It clearly is way out - 3 stars really -- Panchos is closer to 4.5 - 5 stars.  Our experience was 100% five stars  As you enter this restaurant, you are transported to wealthy Mexican house - wow what a foyer - decorated with classic Mexican art  We were quickly seated, table for two, the restaurant was packed, we got the last two seater. Within seconds we were attended by, one of best server experiences we have had in Las Vegas, Lee. We are new to Mexican cuisine, a fact, we shared with Lee to - right away we were give a full introduction to the highlights of the cuisine and based on our taste preferences what we should try. A prudent way to introduce you to cuisine you know little about.   So for appetizers, we were served a guacamole and hop spicy dip along with Corn chips. That went really well with us, and we waited probably 5-7 mins for our entree. My wife and me shared a entree - it was Grilled Chicken, salad, rice and beans. It is a big meal   The Chicken was really delicious, very well grilled with back ended BBQ flavor. Done just right.My wife enjoyed the bean and rice, I was not a huge fan. But overall the meal was very good, full marks to the chef.   After the Entree, we were offered Fried Ice Cream, to me that was good - not amazing like the  Entree and Appetizer. You can get this free with your Yelp Check-in   What really deserves 5 stars was the Service, Lee the server was amazing, the Manager dropped in - was polite and genuinely wants to look after his guests, there is warm feeling at Panchos - they want you to enjoy your meal - like being in their house.   Highly recommend this location for party or date night.  One word of caution, book ahead - it was busy when we were there, last Friday.

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior view
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken n Salad

x93GDvHorzcwgZjVtmYHPg.text: Great food and great service by Patricio!  Service was on point. Food was fast and good. Happy with our first experience here.

S_ovo42iCQrkOrzrpMRKjg.text: Six of us decided to check out this place. If I could give a 1/2 of a star I would. We went for happy hour and I must say we deemed this place a "Big Thumbs Down". The margaritas were watered down, food and salsa was bland and the guy that brought all of our food slammed all of our plates down on the table and had a piss poor attitude. The waitress didn't even check back on our table. Terrible experience. Highly recommend Viva Mercado's at Sahara & Ft Apache. They do Mexican food right.

32yrnKZfUsYnDZz_xVoZWA.text: Had a wonderful time at Pancho's with girlfriends.  The chicken tamales were delicious and the mango margaritas hit the spot.  Customer service was excellent with our friendly server.  And, of course, I love the atmosphere inside Pancho's.  I always enjoy my experience here.

sHlGv423Lh0_e58nTehQWw.text: Great food.  Very good service. We are picky about food and I am especially picky about Mexican food in Nevada.  I am from southern California and the mex there is far superior for the moat part. Pancho's is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas in the 14 years I have lived here. Nice ambiance and decor.  An over all fine dining experience.   Prices are right on for a upscale mex resturaunt.

qsEQ7a2hU0KRhZBcyNY8gA.text: So Pancho's... I thought it was ok. I really liked the inside. Layout is cool, decorations are interesting and I love Downtown Summerlin right now. That is my list of impressive though. The menu looks good but nothing stood out. I get the vibe of just another tired Mexican spot. Trouble is pricing makes you think it's fancy (hint, it's not). The food was good but not on par with the cost. I'm a guy who doesn't mind paying more if there is value but I left feeling shorted.   Add to that, service was pretty bad. Not like the waiter groped my date bad but still. We were sat and promptly forgotten. The busser came by after our waiter was a ghost for 10 minutes and grabbed our drinks. Took a while to get them and had to ask for chips and salsa. Yet another delay. Our waiter finally showed up with no personality and we never saw him again.   I'd say bring the price in line with what you get or step up the cuisine. Only time I would recommend the spot is just to check it out. After that, there are better options.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon is always a good call

ZZPK6MjLW_yo3doR6hYakQ.text: I went here on a whim last night for a date and couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! From the minute we walked in, it felt as though we had been transported to some beautiful California coastal spot.  The food was amazing and the service was awesome! We got to meet one of the managers named Doug and he was such a blast to talk to!   Pros:   - the ambiance was incredible, felt like you were in a coastal home enjoying a home cooked meal.  - the food was delicious. I come from a family that cooks Mexican food almost every meal and it was fresh, tasty, and beautifully plated.  - the servers were quick on refills of drinks, chips, and salsas. Super friendly and accommodating.   - Doug was so friendly and really made us feel at home. We are coming back specifically because of him!  - the live music was just loud enough to hear, but never overwhelming.   - all in all, such a great experience. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this place! I have already recommended it to everyone I work with.   Cons:   - my only con is that they close pretty early. I felt guilty still eating almost half an hour after they closed.  I hope nothing but the best for this place, and I will be back again VERY soon!!

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kFecD0tFIoDCUkHouJ6r7A.text: This restaurant was amazing! Everything from the atmosphere to the staff and food was refreshing! The salsa is made fresh ever day and is so tasty. You might think the prices are a little high but the food is large in quantity and great quality. Our server Cynthia was a breath of fresh air. Marcos our bus person was on top of his game and very pleasant as well. Definitely will be back!

cviQuY-2Gu0H1b0cvy7VYA.text: Great food and customer service. We had a great time for our friends birthday. Reasonably priced and great portion size. Thanks again

nssGH1tLT8KDqJWEbPv0jA.text: What can I say about Pancho's? It's a beautiful restaurant which 100% takes me back to Mexico.  Food wise the chicken chimichanga was absolutely delicious. It was enormous so I couldn't eat it all. However it made a great leftover meal the next day.  Definitely give this place a chance and I'll be updating my review after I stop in for drinks soon.

oAg3Rqk-ThjIp3CQRlOFdw.text: Been coming to Pancho's for a couple of months, love hitting happy hour for cocktails chips and salsa and appetizers. Food is pretty darn good, the wait staff and bartenders are awesome. Love that they have live music. I recommend checking this place out, I think you will like.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0-Q5QLOsfmWqaUOPW-NktA.text: My original review was 2 years ago. This place has not changed at all! It is simply amazing! The food here is awesome! Our waiter, Miguel, was amazing! One of the best waiters I have ever had. He made suggestions on what we like to eat, offered drink suggestions and kept our drinks and chips flowing!  Listen we can all run out and grab Mexican food. We all do it. But if you want a great dining experience, come here!!

LvvmaMu_3DH_Qwi-FDckuw.text: Not always consistent but the queso appetizer is amazing!!  I wish they would bring back their summer cocktail menu they had last year!!

4FZbO_xSXmumFkaq3dgNOg.text: The food was okay! A tad bit pricier than other mexican places we have tried. Servings can be good for 2 people.  The servers were very friendly and accommodating but not a big fan of the receptionist. She sat us in a very isolated area. We asked if we can sit in one of the free tables in the main dining area but she said there's no more available table. There were clearly at least 3 tables that are free. We asked a waitress if we could move and she gladly said yes!   Btw, they had a band entertaining the guests which is pretty cool. It's a decent mexican place but not coming back anytime soon.

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and shrimp quesadilla
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips

qMbU8OSJn-ERwzjvwoU2zA.text: Honestly this was not the restaurant that I thought I wanted to dine at. I knew I was gonna be in the area for shopping, and I knew that part of the name was Pancho's, and when I looked on yelp I thought I was going to the place that I had bookmarked. I don't know how I made such a mistake but what brought me to the supposed restaurant were the pictures, the vegan menu options and such. Nope this was not it! and I didn't realize my mistake until after we placed our order, and was wondering why there was only a breakfast menu and a dinner menu. I thought, 'oh, it must be the weekend so there is no lunch menu'. So I looked on yelp again, and saw the actual menus which didn't look nowhere near the ones I just looked at. oh well..  Anyway, it was too late to leave even though while looking at the menu I realized it was a little pricey for Mexican food. I felt like maybe it was because the area we were in? I'm not totally sure but what we ordered was one taco and cheese enchilada combo, which comes with rice and refried beans,  and the divorced eggs, which is a beef enchilada sandwiched between two over medium eggs, and rice and black beans. I never heard of divorced eggs entrees and I thought if we gonna spend a little more try something new. I liked how the refried beans came out with cheese on top and looks like it was broiled.   It was ok, nothing special. I was a little disappointed in myself for making such a mistake. I don't like to pay for expensive mexican food that's just standard. There are too many other places around, such as Roberto's taco shop that I am quite fine with.   The restaurant itself had nice decor, with a bar area and an upstairs. The hostesses, bussers and waiters are nicely dressed. The service is definitely good.   the bill diet coke  $3.75 Huevos Divorciados $17.95 #1 combo $18.95  Lesson learned...Yelp more carefully!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and beef taco Mexican style
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Divorced eggs

x-EEnkAQfFWapjgsa1mxOQ.text: Pancho's in Vegas is great!  Reminds me of the 80s in Manhattan beach  We would go to the bar and see Lyle Alzado and other Raider players...  maybe we will see them there again soon   The bands and the margaritas!! Good stuff

XsuT5rEdieq7BH84xacnjg.text: 9/20/19: My husband and I go out to eat Mexican food quite a bit. Because we both have restaurant experience, we usually get "satisfactory" service wherever we go. UNTIL, we came to Pancho's. We could not stop raving about the quality and food and the service. Every few mins, we had different servers coming by our table offering to refill our waters, salsas, and asking if everything was okay. One waiter even saw my husband scanning the room for the bathroom, stopped whatever he was doing, and came up to ask if there was something he needed. We are beyond blown away by the service of this place and will definitely be returning.

CvKL0uKf-zrQgyDNnJUmMA.text: Good and nice looking Mexican restaurant. The chips and salsa are good and so is the Margaritas. A little pricey enchiladas but huge portion. Shareable. Will come back

zq8nWWAgmrtAS07gqMLbmg.text: Just moved to Vegas and on the hunt for my new go to Mexican place. It's a large restaurant w/ample seating and separate bar/happy hour etc. the salsa is decent but also kind of spicy wish they had some options. We got fajitas, meat had a unique flavor wasn't a big fan but I got steak quesadillas and it had a better taste. Got an extra side of pico, so I'd go back. Liked how they give you glass of soda/pink lemonade and leave u with a mini pitcher so you can refill your own. Nothing like dying of thirst waiting for a waiter to refill your drinks! *Today I Got quesadilla con carne asada and so many of the steak pieces were so inedible bc it was full of gristle  I couldn't eat 1/2 of it. Disappointing. Salsa is decent sort of runny but chips were good.

MCs3y9NMTkQLz55GGEEvSw.text: Pancho's is a solid Mexican spot for lunch or dinner. I love the feel inside and it has a homey atmosphere. The food was yummy and the margaritas were delicious. The cheese dip was creamy and really different from any other cheese dip I have ever tried. Everything tasted fresh and we will be back.
