_PNNnusVjYH9X1y5V7rMzw.text: Nice casual spot for good food and good atmosphere. Great menu. Excellent service. Great selection of foods...that always come in great time...and fresh and hot. Skinny Margarita is great! Low on the sugar but has great flavour.

46DMAVHGmAaEZoqiYyQ5wA.text: First time at this restaurant. Food was delicious (not authentic but still good). The portion sizes are quite the same as other places I've been too. But I will say that it's way over priced for what you're getting. They didn't have horchata or pozole. My kids were disappointed. With the amazing set up and how cool the staff was dressed I thought they would serve the popular dishes and drinks. Overall it was good. I won't say I'm never coming here again. I'm just saying maybe not for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UJoqpGMsi9CAoBof3RQ4_A.text: The food was very fresh but I think they lacked a lot of seasoning, The food did not have any taste, very bland.

QzKiCun5jZ3E4ZcweelKOg.text: We decided to stop by after Sunday shopping in Downtown Summerlin and so glad we did it. When we walked in we were greeted with one of the friendliest servers ever, Melly. Food is authentic, as it is delicious. Pleasing ambient and definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish Chicken Fajita

TXEVdbSVS5zfhXAoCy1lcg.text: It's football season!! Pancho's is a "NFL bar" for the LA Rams (at least according to the LV Review Journal). This means that they will air Rams games whenever they're playing. This is a review solely for the Cantina/bar area of Pancho's.  My boyfriend and I arrived about 15 minutes before the game started. You just help yourself to a seat and the staff will come around eventually. We were given waters and chips and salsa while we mused over the menu. I know the happy hour menu pictures on Yelp say that food is not included for weekends, but the waitress told us that food was included.   We ordered the queso fundido and chicken quesadilla. The queso fundido was way too heavy for me -- even with the occasional artichoke in the dip, I felt like it was just cheesy monotony. It was not very exciting and I ended up having to alternate dips between the salsa and the queso. The quesadilla was tasty, and we gobbled that up pretty quickly. But you can't really mess up a quesadilla. We also ordered the house margarita. Boyyyy, it is strong. It was tasty but definitely strong.  Waitress had the perfect balance of attentiveness. She knew that we were watching the game, so she would come during commercial breaks or time outs to check up on us.   2 dishes, 3 beers, 1 house margarita added up to be about $50 included tax and tip. That's pretty steep for happy hour.... I'm definitely coming back because it's a Rams bar, but I think next time I will just order drinks and eat their chips/salsa. The HH food is not special at all.  3 stars. +1 star for airing Rams games when the rest of Vegas is so focused on the Raiders.

v0zJv8qM6WoBlahCnDhSjg.text: What a cute Mexican spot! The atmosphere is nice and welcoming, the music could be a little louder. The food was delicious! Probably some of the best fajitas I have had in town. The meat was tender and had good flavor, and the sides such as the rice and beans & guacamole were all great! The portions are huge! So plan on splitting!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas!

4KZ-hTgNH2hY7TpZIZYoKg.text: It's really nice and clean. And the service is friendly. Yet the food wasn't that great.   Its the kind of Mexican food you'd find in the Midwest. Not very authentic tasting. Everything smothered in cheese. But I know a lot of people that like it that way. Maybe they started out authentic but they've veered off somewhere.

9otiDpuELAtp5z34Lv_gBQ.text: Most beautiful Mexican restaurant in the city, too bad the food is barely mediocre. I had the chicken fajitas,the chicken was rubbery,The seasoning or spices they used were awful. Nothing authentic about the taste at all And were some of the worst I've had in town. My friend had the fish tacos and she hated them, she said the taste was strange,They were soaking wet in liquid, and she was afraid to finish them. The service wasn't the best either but it was passable.The one bright spot was the fresh chips and salsa, they were pretty good.

ETan1bfZ-fBKotb0Rt6iHQ.text: Visited Pancho's for Mother's Day and we are glad we did! Our waiter Agustin took the absolute best care of us! Service was on point and even went above and beyond this special day for us!   There was a little mix up on my left overs. Which was a little miscommunication on my part but Agustin went above and beyond for me and replaced it when he didnt need to! I was absolutely amazed!   Thats 110% service! Always smiling and checking on us to ensure we are doing great!   The food is outstanding here! I highly recommend Pancho's and if you can request for a waiter make sure you get Agustin! He took the absolute care of us and for that reason why we will be coming back!  Thank you Agustin and Pancho's for a remarkable meal and experience!

0AVyMZXGJ3rkebYOV4mKkw.text: The Food was delicious, a bit pricey but worth it, the Margarita was strong but good. Our waiter was just awesome and just friendly. Inside the restaurant was lovely, and decorated beautifully, We definitely will return. Will absolutely recommend this place to everyone.

Ys3f84S1v71HxPLC5qNtHg.text: Atmosphere was fun.  I had combo plate which was ok but over smothered with cheese.  Hard to get the taste of the food due to all the cheese.  Kid's quesadilla was good came with drink and ice cream.

RpWsWHLXa69734gXiJl4Gg.text: Fantastic lunch! Beautiful traditional decor with real paintings, colorful tile everywhere, and stained glass windows. Staff in nice matching 'uniforms' provided very good service. The (justifiably proud) owner came to our table to check on how it was going.  Food was all deliciously flavorful without being  overpowering or smothered in cheese like so many. My new favorite Mexican restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QyatdV-d_EFXLNYY_V6brQ.text: The worst Mexican food in Las Vegas.  The Wahoo Fish Tacos was not fresh.  The uses of flour tortillas was a disappointment instead of the corn tortillas.  The Sopes was also not great.  I am not a fan of beans and lettuces on Sopes.  Just made the whole dish soggy.  It also look like three mini Taco salads.  Just really did not stand out for me.  The prices did not fit the quality of the food.  The waiter and bus person were very attentive.  The restaurant was very beautiful.

_S6bA4iKPKaR0aXkkzwk3w.text: Looks goods from the outside. They advertise a happy hour in the bar, $5.50 for a Bud Light draft, I knew I was in trouble, just another over priced Mexican joint. 2 tacos, rice and beans $14.95, WOW.

MLrblWH7u5O1fS3yKJgGww.text: Second time we've been here in the last month! The food is delicious (highly recommend the Salmon,  it's perfectly cooked with great seasoning), the staff is patient and attentive as well as quick. Food came out quickly as well. Our server was Jose (both  times!) and he's great at what he does. Would consistently check on us for drink refills and to see if we liked our meals. Management  also checked in on us several times throughout our meal. Young man assisting our waiter also checked on us several times and asked if we needed take out containers before we even had to request them. Overall, outstanding food, service, and experience!!!  Highly recommend this place! Fun environment for kids as well.

1AksbK-NEo1cl9GulIJbkw.text: Very happy with our visit here. We ordered a carne asana burrito and quesadilla with a margarita. The food was tasty and got the free fried ice cream with check in. Service was exceptionally good- Cynthia was our server she was exceptional. We will be coming back

MZhPAAnrGf66voeH89mx-Q.text: Can I give less than 1 star? This place is the WORST $25 for a disgusting burrito. Then I receive my margarita..... It was pure water. This place lacks everything! Taste, authenticity, everything!!! Please don't waste your time. Oh and venue sucks too!

-5Wlwhp5rIiahA7_KJiZIA.text: Food was ok. Nothing extraordinary. I'm a vegetarian so I enjoyed some of the different options they had. Honestly, the biggest deterrent is the prices. Nothing we had justified the entree prices of $20.

5mE3lWDwCS0rno3tbA47Ww.text: We tried out Pancho's because we received a BOGO coupon. Overall the food was good but we were disappointed that they did not serve beans with the chips and salsa, no soup with the entrees and no horchata or any of the traditional Mexican drinks (they had margaritas and beer). It came short compared to our long time favorite Mexican restaurant but I would eat here again if the BOGO coupons keep coming, plus the free dessert for checking in thru Yelp :)

6a51Z5K8_bBBo9iD5KgvuA.text: Just had a delicious lunch at Pancho's! I've been wanting to check this place out - especially after hearing great things about the chips and salsa, which were perfect. I then had the artichoke avocado enchiladas - and my only complaint is the size. I could have easily shared them. I enjoyed the lighter ingredients in enchiladas, as it is rare to come away from a big plate of Mexican Food  without feeling like I overdid it!

5nxPhYnGXQk8AHQAUyVvJg.text: I really wanted to like this place. We had not heard great things just by word of mouth but my mom had a coupon so we tried it out. We normally eat at frijoles or frank and Fina's for Mexican. I had the wahoo fish tacos and the fish was dry and not flavorful.  There was a sauce to put on it but it had a skin on top of it because it had been sitting so long and the beans were almost cold. The best thing we ate everyone agreed was the fries with the chicken strips my daughter got. The chicken pipian received a frown from my husband the shrimp tacos were again just OK. The cheese appetizer had cream cheese in it? The taquitos were OK. The service was good it was loud and my husband says the beer was good. I could imagine going to try happy hour maybe that would be a better experience but with the coupon the bill was 130 before tip. I don't mind paying but not when I leave hungry because the food was almost inedible.

SRm5zo6Jc2Qg4M9qwb4A_g.text: Food -  OK (your basic unexciting standard restaurant Mexican  food) Service - pretty good Atmosphere  - pretty interior, well decorated  Price - WAY OVERPRICED   Value - poor (find another restaurant)

daOV7QXZWF8Gk7sIaP2j3w.text: This place is too expensive. California prices and in a Las Vegas strip mall.  I like my burritos for under $15. Service is not great either.  I would recommend going up the street to matadors.

TR7k-GcQcFvUJPrB-QETQw.text: Had lunch with my mom and a friend yesterday,  absolutely love the atmosphere.  Our server Claudia was awesome and answered all our questions about the menu.  I had the ground beef enchiladas,  omg they were amazing,  hands down the best I've had in vegas in over 24 years. Definitely going back and highly recommend.

aDDZmznU44u0xXeedw9_lg.text: Excited about eating here after our experience at Manhattan Beach location. But, alas... a huge disappointment.     Service was excellent. Tortilla chicken soup was great! But, that's it. If you want to pay lots for average dinner, then this is the place.

e9t_HxElwsqkJ2h_XIghEQ.text: Not just your usual enchilada taco combo place!  They have that but do yourself a favor and order somethings from the specials of the house menu. You won't be disappointed. Great ambiance. Their first restaurant outside of California. Original in Manhattan Beach.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jh_qBmiLJauIIZa9jDbH1g.text: Excellent food. The service is fantastic. Greeted by every person we came in contact with. Brian was our server and was Brian and he was very attentive.  Our meal arrived within 15 minutes. If you are in the area definitely give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

fPzG8dtpGG4vnUO2q9hYkg.text: So today I experienced Pancho's for the first time. I walked in with our party and was treated to live guitar music from the bar area stage. Nice way to set the mood. Short wait then our party of 16 was seated. Chips were average, while warm, still tasted commercial grade not fresh. Salsa was meh, no heat at all. Once again, commercial grade. But the wait staff did replenish them in a timely fashion. I ordered a Blue Ribbon Margarita. It came out in a basic margarita glass you find in any Mexican restaurant, salt on the rim etc, plenty of ice. Took a sip and it was room temp.. If a margarita is on the rocks, shouldn't it be shaken? I decided to let it chill, so it could chill. The margarita was like the glass, basic. As I looked at the menu the Enchiladas de Langosta (Lobster) stuck out to me. Seemed like a winner so I ordered it. Salad came first with the Pancho's vinaigrette, nothing special, red and green leaf lettuce, tomatoes, and chickpeas (I believe). Nothing spectacular, middle of the road as far as salads go. We didn't have to wait terribly long for our food to come out even at peak time (6 p.m.). My entree came out a fish shaped plate... different but I guess it distinguishes seafood entrees. Took a bite of the "special" green rice first, undercooked and bland. Then took a bite of my enchilada, tasted ok as did the black beans. Took another bite with the sour cream, and guac. Took a third bite with the sour cream and guac where I could really distinguish the lobster. After this bite I took a long pause, I could feel a slight wave of nausea wash over me. I was puzzled as to why this was happening. I sat for a second to see if the feeling would pass, it didn't. I asked a waiter for the restroom and proceeded there. Handicap stall, in use, regular stall FILTHY, and added to my nausea. Waited a few min for the feeling to pass, went back to my table. I sat back down after a few minutes and engaged in casual conversation. I decided to try my meal again. This time I scraped off the sour cream and guac and dug through the enchilada to just get a piece of lobster by itself. 1-2 minutes after I ingested it, I got felt that familiar uneasiness from my stomach. Im convinced the lobster or the sour cream was the culprit. I gave up on my meal and ordered a Sprite. The Sprite helped somewhat but I still felt uneasy and ventured again to the restroom. Light was off when I entered, regular stall, still FILTHY. The handicap stall was still locked and I then realized that it was not in use the first time, but locked from the inside. I assume this was for a reason and cringed at the potential horrors it could have contained. I sweated it out for a few minutes at the sink, and was able to keep my composure. At this point I gave up on Pancho's, and decided for my gastro intestinal well being to cut my losses. I texted a coworker to let my boss know I was leaving as I wasn't feeling well. I drove home swiftly, immediately grabbed a ginger ale to settle my stomach and aid me in completing this review while the memory was still fresh, which is more than I can say for my meal. Pancho's.. First time, last time, no time. There are better options out there.

pVgGWcGgZz10o38x0I18qw.text: Omg! What a rip off! Better off going to Robertos Taco Shop! $80 for steak tacos, enchilada and a side of guac & chips and a margarita. We should have walked out when we saw the menu.

Jo3CKM4kPSy7Q6lKAKZEnQ.text: The food I got was delicious. My husband's was too. I had the quesadilla..husband got the carnitas enchiladas. I do admit the prices were high, but what do you expect? You're in summerlin. Restaurant managers checked up on us which was awesome because that's what they should be doing! Pablo was our server and he was absolutely amazing and efficient. The bus person in his station (I'm sorry, I didn't catch his name) was attentive as well. Seriously, ask for Pablo!

5OoXSw1DgoGENaWCcJ-03Q.text: Beautiful  restaurant in Summerlin,  but I think  you  pay for ambiance not the food. Food is alright but way overpriced.  I prefer Casa Don Juan to Pancho's, I  don't think I'll try it again. Wait staff is very friendly but kind of slow.

b72A7ymY5i4V8ib8EmNOig.text: I love coming here when I'm craving New Mexico style Mexican food. All of the food I've ordered is definitely very flavorful with a hint of spice unless you let the waiter know you want it extra spicy lol they definitely accommodate to what you want. The enchiladas are definitely a must have with a margarita of course!

xlTJRoKWTu82uQTV7HqwwQ.text: Sub par at best. Chips salsa. Jarred salsa is better. Couldn't keep a drink. Fajitas fair. Leticia's off farm is way better for Mexican food. The tortilla soup wasn't horrible but not worth coming back. I got combo plate with beef taco which was worn down the whole shell so couldn't eat as a taco. And a chicken tamale. This was pure awful. Bland no taste. I'm telling ya , hit Leticia's !!!!

2ulk_x75vx4qElo6joeweg.text: Wow, another great find in Downtown Summerlin. The restaurant itself was beautiful and festive. Now the food is delicious. This was not our first or even second visit, we have become regulars. The salads, especially the crab and shrimp salad are awesome. The tacos, burritos, etc are all tastey. We try at least one new item each time we go, but always love the chips, salsa and guac. The salsa is the best in Las Vegas, fresh with just the right amount of citrus and heat.   The prices are very reasonable. And the staff are always friendly and attentative to all your glasses being refilled, to chip refills etc.   Another amazing item we can't get over watching, and is a must see... there is a long staircase to the upper level on which wait staff run up and down with fully loaded trays of food. The first time there we thought for sure someone was going to face plant down the stairs but these guys have confidence and move up and down without fear of falling. I would have face planted if I tried running the stairs,  so I know my place is at a table with a bar drink and yummy salsa and chips.

yNYRpqUBbEve7q73-noCcw.text: This is traditional Mexico style food and I prefer the more healthy CA style with veggies.  The Pablano stuffed pepper tasted awful and could not eat it...they did not care.  It tasted like a bad combination of chocolate and very bad something else.  They said there was no chocolate in it, so who knows what that was.  I may try their happy hour to see if I like it..,it's hard to mess up a taco...I really wanted to like this place..

kWRQS2EwQJR3bWkVbN6exQ.text: Went on a Thursday afternoon, bar was busy, dining room had 4-5 table occupied.  I liked the ambiance and decorating.  The cops were warm and the salsa tasty. I order huevos rancheros and they were good. My guest ordered a combo of the taco and chili relleno. The paper was very good, the taco was a taco. Nothing special.   The biggest downside is the price of the entrees.   We had a BOGO for entrees which made the cost manageable.  But the $14.95 plus per entree seemed to be priced higher than we would prefer.  Lots of choices in the area - probably won't return without another coupon

gPhEijsU6KMTst-U-GZ6Sw.text: Looking to be a favorite. The location is great as out kids daddy tho get to with plenty of parking. Walking inside is a treat. Huge! Brightly decorated, sincere, highly attentive wait staff. Friendly atmosphere, fun to sit and watch the waiters come down a step enough set of stairs, masterfully, navigating and maintaining balance of lots of food to deliver yup patrons. Notably, many greet and do something for us. Love everything about this place. The menu has lots off options. Each entree is enough for two people. Americanized menu, excellent Flan - a must have. Order flan for dessert and your tastebuds will live it. Check it out, not for the timid.

6m6NSSg4-KzSRVVCJhlRBQ.text: First,  you can't beat the building and decorations. It's pretty cool to step into Mexico for dinner.  The small guacamole was more than enough for my wife and I. The fish tacos had a lot of fish in them and tasted great but the crab and shrimp quesadilla was fantastic! Get it!

rLFmWftDJho3af7cdxoZ9w.text: If you looking for REAL Mexican food don't come here we should have turned around when we saw the American flags outside. lol then all the white folk in there eating. This place is way over price $20 for everything on the Menu and $10 for kids. Guess the owner likes to count his money per head walking In those doors. I paid 17.98 for a "appetizer" of shrimp ceviche, which I regret. My GF had the mole enchiladas which were pretty good from what she's saying. Don't let the name fool you.

prD-F_wavgFc5jzaC6pTNg.text: Last night 3 couples went to Pancho's for dinner.  My husband and I had eaten there several times and highly recommended it.  The other 2 couples had never been there.   We had 3 separate checks and each of us had a coupon.   The waiter came back and informed us that the manager had told him that only 2 of the couples could use their coupons but not all 3 of us.  We asked to see the manager and he came out with a very flip attitude.   He said no we could only use 2 coupons and when we told him we would not be back  he shrugged his shoulders and walked away.  This was the worst customer service we have experienced since moving to Las Vegas 1 1/2 years ago.  Unfortunately I did not get his name but this happened on Saturday February 9, 2019.

FNM9Cce9SO7jyeHiJvP6cg.text: We have refrained from Pancho's based on reviews that emphasized the high price of food. Our visit was prompted by a 2 for 1 coupon.   The restaurant is beautifully decorated with lots of plants, water features and colorful tiles. Our server Claudia was very friendly and helpful. She was busy with several tables but checked on  our satisfaction and drink refills several times. She definitely was interested in providing great service. The Cadillac Margaritas were excellent and comparably priced.  The complementary chips and salsa were very good. Tasty salsa with large pieces of tomato.  Shrimp Diabla Puffy Tacos consist of two flour tortillas filled with shrimp sauteed in a mild Diabla Sauce topped with shredded cabbage and chipotle.  On the side were re-fried beans, rice, salsa and guacamole. This was a very tasty taco with plenty of shrimp.  The bean burrito was large enough for two people.   More competition in Mexican food has arrived in Summerlin and now provides several choices. Pancho's appears to have the edge on decor but not price.

tZ1xLIIxIVyreHK1OXRSUw.text: Came in for happy hour which is from 2-7pm during the week. Ordered chicken quesadilla ($7) and strawberry margaritas per the recommendation of the bartender. The margaritas on the rocks are on point!!! Definitely worth the $7.75 per pour. Chicken quesadilla had pulled chicken and was very tasty. Chips and salsa are complimentary- salsa a little spicy but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry margarita
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla

vqTOCRnr2LlcQOmqohO3HA.text: Mediocre food and service and completely overpriced.    My husband, daughter and myself were in the DTS area and decided to have dinner.  Wanting Mexican, we decided to try it out.    We were given a lackluster greeting by a young girl who clearly was bored and taken through the dining room to our seat. We were promptly given chips and salsa and then shortly after asked for our drink order.  We looked through the menu and were totally floored at the cost of what appeared to be pretty basic food choices.  We were going to order guacamole until we realized it was $15 and  NOT even table side. Decided against it and ordered just entrees.  We nibbled on chips and boring salsa with too much heat while we waited for our food.  Our meals were delivered by someone other than our server and we were not asked if we needed anything else. Our server came by shortly thereafter though and asked.  We requested sour cream which he quickly brought.  But that was the last we saw him.  He never returned to ask how the food was. If he had, I would have told him the chicken tamale was dry with a disgusting flavor.  When he did return it was to clear our plates. But he never inquired why I hadn't finished my plate or if I wanted it boxed. Maybe he knew it was gross.  And I couldn't even wash it down because my glass was empty. ALL of ours were. No offer to refill just a question about dessert.  We decided to cut our losses, pay the $65 tab and leave.  When we walked by the hostess, there was no thank you, goodbye, how was it.  They were too busy chatting amongst themselves.   EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.

WxPqh8Hxuhh451cRoQ8-2w.text: Dinner with the wife and kids last night was great. Had the Carnitas Ramon and will definitely have that again next time.

2apv13plHmpocPUw1VoJMQ.text: Atmosphere was great!  Food on the other hand was not so great.  I didn't think it was possible to mess up fajitas but it is and  my rice was under cooked.

_VNYz2ky2dRHgmMPwFXJ1A.text: Love! The classic margarita is the best.  Food is authentic and delicious.  One of my favorite restaurants.

b5q_d04QrzE0kME71vugaQ.text: The place looks great and the service was excellent. Everything looks clean and the staff were really friendly. However, the food is not exactly outstanding for the steep price. $16 for a chicken suissa, $3.50 for coffee and $10 kid meal. The price wouldn't have mattered if the food tasted great but it almost comparable to any regular fast food that would cost between $3-9 .   I would recommend it for those who wants to have good ambiance. But I'm no longer coming back until someone tells me they're food tastes better.

81eFr_UGczQtUCDZrLXDxA.text: Chile relleno was undercooked and chicken tortilla soup tasted like it has unseasoned boiled chicken in it. Not great.

hpL__mcquRKWE2UU5VnzcQ.text: So first, it's in downtown summerlin so it's way more pricey than it should be.  Decent food but not exceptional.  You can get better Mexican for cheaper.  Not bad at all though.  Don't think I'd go back without a coupon but I'll keep going when I get them.  There was a long wait so we sat in the cantina. It's pretty and the live music was good. Good ambiance. Good service as well.  They have a lot of happy hours, even on the weekend. Only real downside is the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour in the cantina.

GN-JYLw_bx0R72QfnfD-dA.text: Pancho's es fabuloso! The hostess greeted our group of four with cheer. My son was mesmerized with the suspended shark which decorates the 21 and older bar area, but were able to capture a photo of the two of them together. Our Sunday afternoon in Las Vegas, shopping in Downtown Summerlin, was thoroughly enjoyed with Mexican sumptuousness.  Miguel our server managed a magnificent job with us.  He split our order of an Ensalada de Camarones con Miel. The greens and jicama were fresh, cool and crispy.  The mango slices were sweet and abundant.  He recommended an accommodation to the Children's Menu for us when I requested a side order of one grilled chicken breast (similar to the chicken breast available for the salad).  He replaced the Chicken Tenders entree with a marinated, grilled and cut chicken breast, with a side of pinto beans de la holla and rice (with a cilantro pesto). Children's Plates served with rice, beans, or fries children 12 years and under.   The bean choice are the whole pinto bean cooked in a pot, black beans, or traditional refried beans.  Also, there are two types of rice of choice. Each of our meals were accompanied with a fresh, fruit bowl appetizer including watermelon, apple, pineapple and cantaloupe chunks. Crisp chips were paired with a red, zesty tomato salsa.    There are several reasons for Pancho's to be a kid-friendly restaurant. The women's bathroom has a changing table. The decor is festive and fun. Music plays lightly in the background and on designated evenings there is live music.  I am looking forward to mariachi music perhaps the middle of September!  A child's dinner includes a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Chocolate milk is a drink option.    For Pancho's to gain one more star from me, I would like to see organic and free-range options on the menu.  Also, the emphasis on local produce would be a nice addition to community support.  And since I am always reaching for the stars, I would like to find a restaurant where patrons can watch tortilleros hard at work while enjoying an authentic Mexican meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Buñuelos with Spiced Brown Sugar Syrup at Pancho&#39;s in Downtown Summerlin, 7) #Yelp100LasVegas

bHDaDkZqO9SQp3ICwYfepQ.text: Was ok. Sub par mediocre food, nothing to go crazy over. We tried it and we won't be back. Better Mexican restaurants to go to in Las Vegas

J4mcXsWjgfasODigO_byWg.text: This restaurant caught my eye because of the name, Panchos, and the nostalgia it brought.  In Texas Panchos is a Mexican buffet with flag your raise for more food. As a child it was so good and fun to go to (key phrase as a child).  Also being from Texas. I am kind of biased to 'Tex Mex' so it is hard for me to have a fair opinion of Mexican food anywhere else.  The meal here was pleasing and they had ground beef tacos. Which have been a challenge for me to find outside of Texas.  Lastly, the service was very efficient and respectful.  Had a nice lunch and enjoyed the festive environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese enchilada, ground beef taco, Mexican rice and beans. Chips &amp; salsa.  Exterior. Interior. Menu.

8oOELdopmSHh9DlNxw4p1A.text: This place used to be so good. Idk if its under new ownership or what but the food is disgusting.  Its like gauc from a bag and stinky carne asada.   Used to be very fresh and great quality.  Subway which is nothing but preservatives is more fresh.   Dont eat here. If you go to Roberto's it will be the same nasty food but 3x cheaper

UB1EUPmD8h8ZQDDXiMwBVQ.text: so we decided to come here bc I wanted an chimichanga.  Restaurant was kinda dead around 3:30 the day before the 4th of July. We were seated immediately and offered drinks and salsa and chips.  The salsa was a tad bland.  Chips were fresh and yummy. I ordered the Chimichanga de Carne Asada and E ordered Chimichanga del Mar which was a Flour tortilla filled with sauteed shrimp and genuine crab, onions, tomatoes, bell pepeprs and rice then deep fried. Complemented with sour cream and gucamole.  The food came out and it wasnt horrible but not that great.  The chimichangas were kind of soggy and not piping hot as if they had just come out of the oil.  Our waitress was extremely sweet and efficient. I checked in on yelp and we got a fried ice cream  OMG I havent had one of those since Chi-Chi's years and years ago (probably showing my age here).  So gross.  I remember the outside being warm.  Well this tasted like stale cornflakes on top.  NO crunch whatsoever like they fried it and threw it back in the freezer.  We scraped it all off and just ate the ice cream. Will we go back?  Eh probably not because for the price of almost $50 the warm food just wasnt worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. stale cornflake topping, no crunch
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Chimichanga
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b0FMAoMpSK_T8Wja_2B_Gw.text: A busy and airy 2 level restaurant. Quite filled this Sat night. We sat in the bar area on the left. There was a guitar and lady playing a myriad of songs on the little stage.  Had a special margarita made especially for this restaurant. This patron is soaked in oak barrels. The mix was excellent, not the sweet syrupy stuff.  Bonus was the complimentary  chips and salsa. Crispy with a liquidy salsa light on ingredients, but good in flavor. Light heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their own aged tequila

BkQRQCZQ1r0ZpQXE5ALK1w.text: The fried ice cream was horrible.. it was stale and old cornflakes on it... The waitress was nice and sweet. The food was okay.

UnjGInNq6hYn3MB8_tWA_A.text: It took a long time for us to try Pancho's, mainly due the fact that they close at 9:00, which doesn't suit my Night Owl schedule. But a recommendation by a new-to-Vegas friend, plus a coupon in the mail finally spurred action.    I was impressed by the beautiful decor, both in the cantina and the dining area. We sat in the dining room, and service was friendly and efficient, probably amped up because it was close to closing, and the staff wanted to get out of there!  I found the drinks to be way overpriced. Skipped my usual margarita and had a glass of wine, but not because of the price, since the wine was up there, too.  We shared an Ensalada Verde, and it was gorgeous, with the additional beets and garbanzos adding to the flavor. My husband ordered Enchiladas Suizas, and I had Mole en Pipian. I forgot to specify black beans instead of refritos, and was gratified to find that my dish came that way; his, however, did not.  I tried his enchiladas, and they were up there with the best I've ever had. But while the mole sauce from my dish was very tasty, the chicken was another story: dried out and tough. It was obvious that it was not freshly made. Because of the late hour, I was just going to slog through it. But a manager passed by, and when he asked how our dinner was, I told him. Instantly, he wanted to give me something else, so I figured that I'd get those terrific enchiladas. Having filled up on the chips and the very good salsa, though, I'd eaten enough, and had a fabulous meal the next night.  Even with a $16 coupon, the bill was high. We like to stick to local restaurants because we eat out a lot, and it can make a big dent in the wallet. While I look forward to going back, I'll try to go earlier next time. But I may temper my sense of adventure and order those enchiladas again. They were sooooo good. But with black beans next time.  Ambience - 5/5 Service - 5/5 Food - 4/5 Value - 4/5

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mole en Pipián
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad

uwi2u4W_bi0OYutd_QzkQg.text: It's good don't get me wrong but if I went back it would be more for the atmosphere and probably just a drink with friends. It was a beautiful Mexican restaurant with a courtyard setting, two floors, and a bar at the front that you almost don't know exists. It's in downtown summerlin with convenient parking. It reminded me of restaurants I'd been to in a couple Mexican Mercados or even some in NM where I lived for a while. Service was good and like I mentioned food was good but it wasn't Amazing for the cost at the slightest. They do offer free check ins so don't forget to get that. I was able to get a fried ice cream so who can complain! I still thought it was super over priced and with Juan's only a couple miles away I assume just go there.

DaahwulidP8-5T1PGpD50A.text: First, let me start by saying I LOVE that they have happy hour on Saturday. That's hard to find in my experience. The main downfall for this place in my opinion is the lack of veggie-friendly food. Granted, if I wanted a full-blown veggie menu there are other options but this day and age it seems like at least most restaurants have at least a handful of veggie plates/pickings to choose from. This is not the case here... I found two or three options on the main menu but none on the happy hour menu.  I stuck with chips and salsa but my friends did order some food. They ate a bit but took the rest to go so it must have been at least good. I wish there was more food that I could try! The service was great, though, so that's a plus. Our bartender greeted us within a minute and we had chips and salsa at the table a minute later. Drinks came out quickly and we were given feedback as to what drinks were best and which drinks to order to get the most alcoholic mixed in. Shout out bartender!

fH6OuEqT6Vp8F548SwUEOQ.text: For the 3 years or so Pancho's has been there I had been avoiding it because of my perception that it was over-priced compared to other Tex/Mex restaurants.  I decided to give it a go today for a late lunch/early dinner because I was in the area.  I was seated at a two top immediately and I began to look over the menu.  When I checked in on Yelp, I noticed there was a free fried ice cream offer for the check in.  Not bad.  I ordered the pollo a la diabla which the menu describes as:  Tender pieces of boneless chicken sauteed with caramelized onions, roasted garlic and artichoke hearts. Simmered in a special Diabla sauce with roasted Guajillo chiles and Chef Ramon's special herbs. Served with green rice and black beans.  The diabla sauce had some kick to it--not enough to be a bother to most diners.  I enjoyed it enough that I didn't ask for Cholula or some kind of sauce to add to it.  There was a serving or rice and some place beans with cotija cheese.  The dish was very enjoyable.  When it came time, I told my server, Gustavo, that I had the Yelp check in offer and he watched as I marked the offer as used.  A little later, out came this large bowl with what would be two scoops of fried ice cream instead of the normal single scoop.  The menu describes the dish this way: Vanilla ice cream covered with crispy Corn Flakes and cinnamon. Served with a caramel sauce and whipped cream.  It was excellent and a good ending to a good meal.  The restaurant is nicely appointed and has several living plants and trees.  The stairs go to the main kitchen upstairs and it's amazing to watch the servers run up the stairs and walk down quickly with their full trays.  Service was very good.  Gustavo brought me fresh iced tea 3 times and he stopped by to check in with me after I had the main course for a small amount of time to see if everything was OK.  I won't be skipping Pancho's anymore.  The prices are comparable to others in the general neighborhood.  The only thing that drove me crazy was the table that moved back and forth depending on whether I put weight on my end.  That's irritating anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream—free with Yelp check in.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pollo a la diabla.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area.

ho5pUmvtpaTdpAV0rWWMzg.text: Horrible horrible horrible!!!!! Not everyone can eat cilantro it's a genetic disorder. But don't  expect them to accommodate you.  Eat what they serve or don't eat. Plus the food tasted like cream of chicken soup. Pretty sad when you have to send a quesadilla back. Live and learn !!! Never again !!!!

BE_aikpCp_hEILY0geqtLw.text: I really like Panchos for brunch. Sometimes all you need for a pick me up is some tacos and margaritas. I like getting there Tacos El Pastor Tijuana.  It comes with 3 street style pork tacos , beans and rice. Sipping a flavored margarita (strawberry) makes for a perfect meal. We also get a side of guacamole that comes with the free salsa and chips. The guacamole is nice and chunky. The left over guac we use with our entree like I'll put it on my tacos. If you love a not so soggy Tres Leche Cake I highly suggest it. The atmosphere is relaxing especially is you sit by the fountain.  This is a great place for a date or if you want to go with a group of friends!

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres Leche Cake
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nqkWnPUKSjpscDnssr7HuA.text: Lunch with my love .. wasn't that great food was bland and the margaritas was watered down . Just horrible. No flavor taste like ice and sweet n sour. I added strawberry puree and it still didn't help. I order crab n shrimp quesadilla it's was ok not the best. I love guacamole and this guac wasn't that good. Didn't taste fresh it taste plain and again NO FLAVOR.  I usually like this place for happy hour at the bar. I'm guessing I should only do just that IF SO ... I don't recommend this place. I love Mexican food I will have to continue my search here in vegas

2WKTKE7zxf7zrVZ3wSC9Cg.text: We went here on a whim while shopping in Downtown Summerlin and were pleasantly surprised. When we walked into the door we were not expecting the decor we saw. It had a nice vibe. We joked that maybe we had picked an expensive place, but the prices were reasonable considering the environment/location. I had the tacos al pastor and my boyfriend had the burrito ranchero. My tacos were great and I was super happy that I made that choice. My boyfriends burrito was huge and delicious, but he mentioned he wished it had rice. This isn't our favorite Mexican restaurant but it is definitely a very good one and we will be back for date nights. The service was great, too. Our server Claudia was very attentive and nice. Thanks for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito Ranchero
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor

KQ9j7BmqiDWk4lAXvf_Wkw.text: Loved the ambiance. Service was perfect. Felt very welcomed from everyone. The food was great. I had the lobster tacos and my husband had the seafood burritos. The only thing I didnt care for was the free fried ice cream that you get for checking in with Yelp. The ice cream is so good but its coated in damp frosted flakes or something. It's free so...

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful decor.

6GFZkqllMeaI4TON8f5seA.text: Customer service at the bar is amazing. I always have a good time. The beer is nice and cold and the tacos dorados are amazing. You can't beat the happy hour pricing and the selection is extensive for the regular menu. They have TVs all over the bar and live music when the Golden Knights aren't playing. The bathrooms are clean and always stocked which is nice because I can't stand those restaurants that think it's ok to sit on a bare toilet or expect to pee standing. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oCHwfV6YINrhgwxKfAVncQ.text: I'm only giving this place 2 stars because I loved the interior decor, it's very clean and the service was good.  We decided to try this restaurant last night but we will not be coming back. I ordered the charcoal steak tacos and it came with rice and beans. Honestly it was nothing special but definitely the most overpriced tacos I've ever had. My boyfriend ordered the mole pepian and we ended up sending it back. The taste was so bland the complete opposite of what you'd expect when ordering mole. The only good thing was the tortilla soup that came with it. The portions are big but still overpriced. Not a place I plan to go back to. I've had much better mexican food (lindo michoacan) for a lot less money. My waitress was very nice and super apologetic.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasteless mole pepian
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The charcoal tacos

ArxJ2AyiTD8cnqUza4u-AA.text: Jay is an amazing host at the bar and he makes his guests feel at home! We like this place more each time we come in. Their salsa is the best!!

EbtCs5HS5ed1l2SolIWFfA.text: I love restaurants that take pride in their authenticity.  This place is very colourful and True, and the food reminds me of a place we dine at in Cancun.     We walked in without a reservation, and were seated within a few seconds.  The waiter greeted us within a minute.    We were offered some courtesy chips and salsa, and water.  The only problem was our waiter was in a rush.  There was no real recommendations, nor  a good breakdown of the menu.   This is a definite issue for us.    We did push the waiter for some assistance, and were able to make a few menu decisions.   We ordered chicken fajitas, tortilla soup, and some steak.  The waiter offered extra chicken for $5 more.  Do not do this.  The portions are HUGE.   The soup was delicious, lots of chicken, tomatoes, seasoning.   The steak was extremely salty.  All the fixings for the fajitas were average, small table spoons of sour cream, guacamole, some rice,  lots of beans, and 3 small tortilla shells.    For drinks we had a pina colada, and ginger ale.

X_58cxf3PjdlCBWddvOPpQ.text: Pam his was good we had the burritos and chips salsa is amazing !! Great Mexican food atmosphere is awesome 'n highly recommend

MEY0jL3GABY7JzokcZaJyg.text: This is located in downtown Summerlin which is super convenient for me. Unfortunately, it is not my favorite Mexican in the neighborhood. It is a little overpriced for what it is. There is a good variety of food on the menu. The complementary salsa is kind of bland.

4Tg4xtzhqQRRfWmDm4Knrw.text: Bland.  Service is so so  Too many choices on a hard to read menu.  Food I had the veggies were undercooked. Others didn't care for their food either.

ddhSM8AoTTC7tx4ChVOcxA.text: This place had such an amazing ambience and even more promising buildup as I eagerly was seated with my party way ahead of reservation time.......... Unfortunately little did I know ..... This was the peak of my evening. Overly creative menus and no investment in a cocktail menu left me puzzled and frustrated only to lean on my Negro modelo "standby" beverage w a side shot of ice water . As I sipped on my mildly cold beer and forced my stomach to indulge in some flavor challenged guacamole, I kept thinking to myself - " this has to get better."  Flavorless chicken fajitas and rubbery Camerones (shrimp) left me hating myself after I paid for my overpriced letdown. The only advice I have for anybody reading this is Lindo is down the freeway - if your Yelp motivation is to enjoy better food and less dent to your wallet.

IhXsjwpOV0Lps-VJwReyZw.text: Reminds me of their location in Manhattan Beach. Food was excellent. Although our appetizer was served with our entrees. Kids menu is pricey. Overall a good dining experience. The service staff was very attentive. Good ambiance.

9VipdRMvLJGE-yV5CMRcTw.text: Awful service!  Way over priced, and over rated.  We didn't even stayed to eat.  We we sat and ignored for over 15 minutes.  Never going back.

ZVTHj2c3mpdi-8YUmWhspw.text: First time customer. My date and I only went to the bar for Happy Hour and found out it was Taco Tuesday , they were only $2.50 each which were very good. We each had a house Margarita and they was also very good. The other items on the menu looked to be a bit expensive, but didn't try any so I could not comment about them. The chips and salsa were excellent and the service was great. Our bar tender was Kelly and she was a lot of fun to chat with. I will go back again and try an entree.

LW7iKG7YbLFtej5dLZxWLw.text: We were SO excited about their opening! We had read all about the Manhattan Beach location and had high hopes. Unfortunately, management made the call to open way too early. Servers were not trained at all nor well versed in the menu. Our order came out wrong and had to be sent back. Like other reviewers mentioned, at $18-24 a plate portions are on the small side and with no side dishes included...the prices are exorbitant! The food was average at best. Sad because we were looking for something outstanding.

JoOpwxhD_JiEJ49Rs8i8WA.text: I was soo excited for the restaurant to open since it looks so beautiful and it was much needed in this area.   The interior is gorgeous with the plants, fountain and grand staircase.  The food and service also didn't disappoint. I loved every bite.   BUT, the prices are too expensive.  $10 for a basic KIDS meal that doesn't include the kids drink.   A side of rice was $6.  I had the basic beef taco and cheese enchilada for $17.  These were LV "STRIP" prices.

k_2GwyJdKyp9AFP8M6F6Yg.text: Came in to try this amazing looking Mexican restaurant . Walked in and was seated immediately. After we sat down , we all looked at each other in total shock . The prices here are way ! Over the top ! 19.99 for 2 tacos and rice and beans ? I looked over at the table next to us and asked them how they liked the food . They responded " Food was ok , small portions and they didn't realize how expensive the meals cost and said they will only come back for special occasions . So after the 4 of us looked at the menu .. We all decided to leave and go to macayos . The total bill at macayos was 65 bucks including 4 beers . We figured at "Panchos" the same meal would have been over 125 with out the tip . I really want to like "Panchos" but I can't see my self paying 19.99 for rice and beans and 2 tacos . Hopefully they will realize that there prices are not for the local budget and they are as much as the Las Vegas strip . This is only my opinion and I do hope to return some day . I give it 5 stars for the decor  And the atmosphere . I'm pretty sure it cost a pretty penny to build this place . But that's not a reason to charge so much for Mexican food .

m7Y_JkvD2gifDiEdMUtRLA.text: As someone else pointed out, I gave two stars for the environment. Food is definitely overpriced. I wouldn't mind the price as long as the quality can back it up. Unfortunately, Pancho's fails to deliver. Service was extremely slow and the food was mediocre. It's perfect for a tourist from the Midwest or Eastcoast that has never experienced "good" Mexican food. I will stick to Viva Mercado or Juans Flaming Fajitas when I need my fix.

0phw9pkxibJd18KYxk8seg.text: Food was decent not spectacular.   Prices are a bit over prices.  Margaritas were very good and the fajitas as well.  Enchiladas were decent not amazing. Atmosphere is amazing however the manager is a bit to friendly.   Very nice but I think he wanted my friends wife.

rk-1JgmdP2iqK4H_XAgFNw.text: I have been waiting for this restaurant to open for a while, anticipating the great costal Mexican food that Panchos is famous for.  When I finally dined there the place was really underwhelming. First of all there is no carpet in the restaurant & it sounds like a warehouse. I ordered a chili verde burrito which is a staple in Mexican kitchens & it seemed that the pork was cooked separately from the sauce which enables them to use it with multiple sauces. The pork in Chile Verde should be cooked or braised in the sauce which emparts meat juice in the sauce. This unctuous experience was totally absent at Panchos & considering my companions mediocre dish I most definitely will not return to Panchos. This is a classic Americanized Mexican restaurant and I strongly prefer to eat at more authentic eateries!

czncD2TVSHgbvkGpxDqADw.text: Service was great.  We got to the restaurant and it was half empty. Told it was a 1 hour wait.  We we to the bar and was given a table in 15 minutes.  The guacamole was $ 17.00.   Queso Fundio was  $18.00. Way over priced  The drinks in the restaurant were more expensive than in the bar.  Food was ok not great and very overpriced. This restaurant was so expensive to build and their overhead is so high they gouge the customer.  There is better in town for less money.

f9sCYErs9PcKQEfY5vA5rw.text: I am writing this review feeling very disappointed. I was looking forward to this restaurant opening and hoping for really great, authentic ( or at least USA style authentic), Mexican food. The building is very nice and the server was very polite and attentive....other than that.....  We went early on a Thursday afternoon ( 4 PM) and the restaurant was not busy at this point. The hostess took us to what must be the worst table in the restaurant. It was in the back and near the kitchen door and  the server station. Normally, I would have objected and asked for another table, but this being our first time there, I wanted to see what else was in store. I am familiar with the concept of filling tables back to front, but this was a bit extreme based on the hour and the number of customers. It did give me a good view of part of the kitchen, which looked clean and well maintained. The server was at our table almost immediately and took our drink order. I ordered a traditional Margarita on the rocks. Hubby had a draft beer. The Margarita had a minimal amount of Tequila and was not at all remarkable in taste.Chips and salsa came to the table, and the salsa ,while a bit spicy , was lacking in any depth of flavor. I decided to go with  a classic combo, beef taco and cheese enchilada and my husband ordered the Carne Asada Al La Ab. The combo, priced at $17.95,does not come with salad or soup. Unusual in my experience. My husband's entree did get the soup or salad choice. The Carne Asada has Hanger steak and my husband was not asked how he liked it cooked, which I assume represents that it's already prepared. The entrees were delivered in a timely manner. My entire plate was lackluster and had none of the savory deliciousness that I would expect from that plate. The shredded beef in the taco, the cheese enchilada and even the rice and beans were all very bland. My husband's Hanger steak tasted OK, it was medium well to well done...but had some taste to it. The other components on the plate were the same as mine. Unfortunately, I see no reason to return to this place. The food is pricey for Mexican, which would be OK if it was really good, and it was, at best, just OK.

TukIwZ0fEgMvZSjAgcf06g.text: This is our 2nd visit here, both have been an awesome experience!  The queso fundido is amazing!!! Happy Hour and ladies night on Monday what else can you ask for? Claudia is amazing,  great smile and personality!!! Thank you Pancho ' s we'll be making this a regular date night spot!!

JtmcidJTJCCBNwSozeuHHQ.text: If you're vegan I'd stay away from this place. I went in the other day with my mom super excited because of the location and how pretty it looked. Plus I was seriously craving mexican. Most places have a vegan/vegetarian menu or can accommodate me. Well they had two vegan items. One was a salad (who wants a salad at a mexican place? Not this girl) and the other option had a wheat flour tortilla and I can't have wheat. I asked if there was anything else they could do to help accommodate me and they said no. I then ordered just a side of beans which they brought and it was covered in cheese lol I didn't want to complain since I already felt like a pain and just let my mom eat the beans. I promptly left and went somewhere else to eat. Seriously disappointed considering  nice of a place this is and I love the location.

1kRk1auuI5kN8ya72rsEhg.text: Here was second experience.  BOTH times the food was:  1.  Expensive food ~ $14.95 for side of guacamole?  2.  So-so Margaritas - watered down and hardly a happy hour price at $8.00 3. Bland food - first time EVER added salt to shrimp tacos 4. Good server and nice atmosphere 5. $8.00 for a small bowl of soup?  Prices jacked WAY UP for downtown Summerlin.  Better Mexican at several places nearby.  Sorry to say, it's doubtful we will return or recommend.  Seems other people feel the same according to the reviews.

O_au0M51YRUCCmo1CxtiZQ.text: Just to be objective in my assessment, this is visit #3. I ordered Enchiladas de Mole, traditional Mole Poblano made from Ancho and Pasilla chiles, sesame seeds and peanuts. It was good BUT, what I should have ordered was the Pollo en Mole Verde with a green cilantro lime rice. The food after three visits here both at lunch and dinner is consistently good, spot on high quality ingredients.  The service: in all fairness, my first visit was chaos because it was opening week. The following two visits both dinner and now lunch, the bar staff is exceptionally engaging and gregarious (Kelly & Jessica).  The Margaritas: base tequila is Cuervo Gold. Total liquor is 2.25-oz. at a painful $10.50. The three closest competitors within less than a 5mi radius use a 100% Agave tequila unlike Cuervo's (mixto), pour 3-oz of liquor at $11. One establishment has it at $10 using Patron at 2.75-oz. The bottom line: Food is good, service is good, booze is above average albeit value-wise it fails. One final note; it is truly a shame that anyone can Google their Manhattan Beach menu and see that the Las Vegas pricing is a whopping $3 more straight across the board! Did they not think that the Las Vegas locals were not smart enough to investigate that??? The happy hour is loooong! Starting at 2/2:30 through 6pm but, it is so complicated!! And, worse yet, of no real value. A $2 savings is not a happy hour although, I suppose if you milk it by staying the entire 3+ hours then MAYbe it's a better value.

BFiHFUcwi1cutHqfxmLtQw.text: Had an awesome time Martha was our server and she was absolutely amazing. never had to wait. The food was amazing. Home made salsa rocked our world. Only thing is was a little pricier than i would have liked.

AvD40wZWTmixdA50Ckld7Q.text: Don't order the "queso fundido"! it's straight up cream cheese and if your lucky a crumb of artichoke. Atmosphere is cool, live music was worth the bill.

n8essxffJDGr6oV126qv5g.text: We went to the Sunday brunch using a coupon we got in our snail mail. Everything was very good. The atmosphere was festive and our server, Cesar, rates as one top servers we've had.  We  had the tacos al pastor plate and the artichoke/avocado enchiladas - both were delicious. Check the prices before you go to see if you think they're  too high. With the coupon, we were fine with the bill.

wPLmubCi0WsTmJVxUEqpGg.text: I have been waiting for this place to open a long time.  It did not disappoint!  Food is fresh and authentic. Service is great with Jesus Garcia as the server and Luis Valenzuela as busser. When I asked Cesar Cardona to recommend a dish, he was happy to go to the kitchen to get me taste of it. With so many great dishes on the menu, I can hardly wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smiley face flan.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas del Mar. Tortillas filled with shrimp and then covered with salsa Verde and melted cheese.  Mucho delicious!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas Suizas. Corn tortillas filled and rolled with chicken and then covered with salsa Verde. Excellent!

VFPaSPB1HXtyZ7ANSHrcxA.text: Foods okay... the skinny margaritas are yummy and the live music is too much fun...

iKGk0jAWH9SRtnCeTcgkbQ.text: Couldn't wait for this place to open... When it finally did I waited to see what kind of reviews it was getting .. A friend decided to have lunch there so we did..  The decor is nice but that's it.. The place was pretty empty so we got our table right away .. We ordered two margaritas , they were just ok nothing worth getting excited over especially the high price !! Next we ordered guacamole for an appetizer .. I was expecting a table side creation but that wasn't the case , waitress went to the kitchen and brings a cute "little " bowl of guacamole and chips!! Tasteless , flavorless and down right bland!! We had to add salsa to it to give it some sort of taste !!  Next up ..... Chicken quesadilla and carne asada quesadilla .. We split both and I preferred the carne asada ...  It was ok but again nothing worth $18 for ..  So for 2 margaritas , guacamole , 2 quesadillas.. It came out to $77 FOR LUNCH! $HIT really !  Service was fine , food was subpar .. I figured that because they are located in downtown Summerlin they think they can fool the locals with subpar food and gouge the shit out of us!! Seriously Panchos ?? Think about what you're doing .. I'm a Tex-Mex and have lived here for 25 years, you have no idea what Mexican food is.. Stop trying to fool people with your crappy over priced food .. Totally out of line ... Either drop your prices by 50% or make better food by 100%..  I tried talking a friend out of going but he had to learn the hard way .. He too was very disappointed and said his $23 carne asada plate wasn't worth 1/2 that..  Needless to say we won't be back..

YlPCoUM6OGzwBDZeAtQf-g.text: I've been here 3 times and the first time was good. The second time they messed up my order and the third time my burrito came with Saran Wrap in it! I won't be going back, overpriced too.

H7pjkxm0cZ9-_uqeqGwChQ.text: This place is so yummy!!  I love Mexican food and this is the first place that's got great atmosphere AND food!  Finally.  The service will s always great too.  Prices a bit steep, but they have coupons, so makes up for it.

mgl7hZxCUjDGWD8cECpeCQ.text: Well now! We went to Pancho's when it first opened and I must say that this place has really really gotten it's act together! Chips and salsa appeared on the table, the Margarita's are nice and mid strong and the food oh the food! GREAT portions and home made just like back home in New Mexico. I had the Trios Los Panchos and it was HUGE! This plate has the chicken, beef and cheese enchilada covered with special sauce (chili)  with sour cream and rice and beans. The beans are home made and the chicken was sooo tender! We had the Tres Leche cake for dessert and YUMMMMY! Light and fluffy milk cake with whipped creme frosting. The service was wonderful and our waiter Jose answered all questions regarding the spiciness of the food. Great atmosphere as the plants are real and the sound of a water fountain adds to the enjoyment of your meal. A definitely great dining experience!!

qcPSgbvxNetdfcu1xbMiWg.text: TL;DR - overpriced for mediocre food.   While their website says people love this place I can't say we had s good experience.  A friend went to pickup and order.  Strike #1, they don't take orders over the phone.  My friend went to the bar and ordered without looking at the menu since we did that online.  Strike #2, no prices online.  I get this for really expensive gourmet restaurants, but not Panchos, really?  He gets the food and the bill.  $127 before tip for 4 people!  He gets home and tells us this fact and eat only to find out that the food is DEFINITELY not worth the price we paid.  Strike #3, cost to value of the food is NOT worth it.  Major fail!  We will never go back or recommend this place.  The food was decent but the price was about twice what it should have been for most of the things we ordered ($15 for Guacamole, $20 for two fish tacos, $17 for two beef tacos w/ rice and beans...).  I'll continue to go to Lindo or Frijoles!

Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our 5 shrimp for $25
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our $15 guacamole

3BGwB8e4BtYDczegdKfKog.text: Service is excellent and the chips & salsa are tasty. The food is way overpriced for the bland taste...most dinner entrees are over 20 bucks.  Server claimed everything was "authentic and made from scratch".  No way!  Margaritas are $10+. I left feeling ripped off.

LkDZtGxeTxU0L5MIKFYZqg.text: I grew up going to the one in Manhattan Beach, CA so I couldn't wait for this one to open in Summerlin, but wow you better come with Summerlin money cause this place is WAY WAY WAY overpriced!!  The decor and ambiance is amazing and the customer service was some of the best I've ever had in LV, but scallop ceviche for $20?!  I don't care how beautiful your restaurant is or how great your service is at the end of the day its still just Mexican food and just because your address is on Lavender Hill Dr. doesn't mean you can get away with those prices!  WOW!  Seriously consider before you go there because your wallet WILL feel the effects of eating there and quite frankly its just not worth it and a smack in the face to locals!

Qk1EeHCoEC5suk6pKxuTVA.text: First of all, their food isn't good enough to command such a high price. The tostada I had was fair at best; could have had a better Mexican lunch at Juan's Flaming Fajita's or even Pollo Loco!! My friend had their salmon atop a ridiculous amount of lettuce; that too wasn't good. She sent hers back because it was too salty. I wonder how long people will patronize the restaurant, before they realize it just isn't worth it.

YJrOTaSzbpkWXQzuji6nDw.text: AVOID THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU DON'T MIND PAYING THROUGH THE NOSE FOR BASIC MEXICAN FOOD! I did check Yelp prior to going in and there was only two $$ so I figured it would be reasonably priced. WRONG! We ordered two margaritas which were OK but nothing to write home about. Then we perused the menu. Outrageous prices. Our baby started getting whiny so we used him as an excuse to bone out. $26.00 for 2 margaritas. Dinner would have easily been over $100 and the menu choices are basic. But hey, maybe you guys are rich??

rnLr4nciQXQFnBw508L8SA.text: Wow, I had a shrimp and crab burrito. It was tasty but several hours later I was as sick as a dog. Either the filling was unrefrigerated too long and not kept hot enough or there was cross contamination. I was in the food service for 25 years and have been through food service sanitation courses twice. The restaurant is very nicely decorated and the servers were great. However it cost over $23 for the burrito and iced tea. Too much in my estimation.  I can go to a hole in the wall and not get food poisoning.

ASQLK2_N6KHMgRxqhhhMwg.text: WHAT CAN I SAY!!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE atmosphere, ambiance, customer service, al get % STARS!!! thanks for a wonderful dinner

-8mrPAwCc229WstHOTN1gw.text: Had lunch with few friends to see how the food is and everything was good but the portions were large for lunch and pricey. Maybe a lunch menu would be wise in the future.   Overall good service with a very friendly staff and food was great!

_FsiN7GILnCISSPYawzANQ.text: Our first visit was 9 months ago. While satisfied with the food, the service really wasn't all that great. We returned tonight and the food was great and so was the service! Definitely a bit overpriced, but overall a nice improvement from our last visit.

4fNcsC3osFk2So1JqF59Kg.text: The place looks awesome! But the food is not good at all... Everything that came looked good. The service was fine but the food just wasn't good. Definitely not at these prices. I got the gold Margarita... actually might be the worst Margarita I have ever had. Watered down... Almost no lime. I love Margaritas and am not that picky. I'll drink a Stations 99 cent Margarita and find a way to enjoy it. I could have died for one of those. First time I've considered sending a drink back. If you are considering eating here.... I'd pass. My wife warned me. Even then I was still disappointed. With so many choices you'd think they would have a bar to reach. Not even close... If you have a choice go somewhere else. Go. This was bad enough for me to write a review... Usually I don't write anything but it's worth saving others. My friends want to go back for taco Tuesday. Think I'll decline.

BAc9pEVx8IDjPTWkx9PF0g.text: I would give it no stars if I could. Horrible tasting food. As a proud Mexican we take pride in our Dishes. These are missing taste and Items altogether. The prices are sky high. My son Ordered a personal pizza which was 1O dlrs for a microwaved Wallmart Pizza. Queso Fundido is a dish that is really hard to mess up and somehow they managed to mess that up too. They don't carry seafood!!!! What kind of Mexican restaurant does not carry seafood? Worst Mexican Restaurant I have ever been too and the worst food I've ever had. By the way this restaurant isn't ran by Mexicans either. It's just a Restaurant with a Mexican name to it to attract customers and rip them off. Don't eat there! You'll regret it. PS. They even messed up my Michelada WTF???

ojP4DSGXuzVGxMi1cVy-nQ.text: Food was pretty good! Unfortunately I feel like I got Panched in the Noggin with there ridiculous prices. I got a 2 enchilada combo plate for $17.99. Wife got a bean and cheese burrito for $14.99. Each got 1 alcohol beverage and the bill was $59.60. Yes I seen the prices before I ordered but figured what the hell and that's exactly what I got at the end when it was time to pay up. I guess my fault but will not be returning unless those Summerlin Mexican hot plate prices drop a little. My head is still spinning....

2u-4mkFz80XFnL7281h9ug.text: The service is always good and the food is delicious. I normally stick with enchiladas but have tried other dishes and they are all good! Also, you can never go wrong with Margaritas. It's a little pricey for off-strip food, but we have always had good experiences so we keep returning.

w_7-N5r1nQhPv9tqRht11g.text: I went here last weekend and was fairly unimpressed.  The building looks nice, but then we were sat at the first table upstairs, tucked into a corner with a bunch of bushes.  The table in front of us already had a family at it, and we were maybe two feet reaching distance from them.  It was just odd.  Food was decent; tacos pretty bland, but goodness was it EXPENSIVE.  It's twice the price of similar restaurants and maybe not as good.  It was decent to try, but I'm not going to be going back on the reg.

UNo4FOWffnr6se5IJ2FFgQ.text: Not sure why all the bad reviews... Service was perfect, atmosphere was relaxing and the food was amazing. I wasn't sure if it would be worth the price but you can really taste the quality and freshness of the ingredients. Well worth it in my opinion!

eZ6WnvNae9hBoji8ul29Yw.text: Way over priced!!  They want $18 for a breakfast burrito.  The food is just ok.  I'd rather eat Taco Bell.

EcmjueUObMVB7LDxtkqkaw.text: As the new Mexican restaurant on the block in Downtown Summerlin, I decided it was time to give Pancho's a try.  Upon our arrival at night the restaurant was loud with live rock music from singers on a stage, but the decor was lovely hacienda style.  Guacamole in a metate with a tortilla chip base was real spicy, but there was a ton of it.   We waited a substantial time before anyone appeared to take our order, and then were first contacted by the manager, followed by the hostess, and finally our waiter.  Not too many chips were in the basket provided, so we had to request more; they were quickly supplied.    I enjoyed a good Shredded Beef Taco and an ultra-cheesy Burrito Ranchero with shredded beef, but the interior of Diane's Quesadilla Del Mar (with shrimp) was made wrong, and it seemed to take forever to correct the error.  The lights in the kitchen went off before arrival of the correct version, and we thought the entire kitchen staff had gone home.  But not to worry--the belated replacement entree arrived at our table shortly thereafter, and was accurately prepared to order.  3-1/2 stars overall, but as others have noted, one can find better Mexican fare elsewhere in the city at a much lower price point.  So, it seems dining patrons are being charged extra for the fine special authentic hacienda ambiance.

BHBl0NiMIsOad_9ecZjNPA.text: The service is kind and the atmosphere is welcoming. Now on to the best most satisfying, sit down Mexican food I have had... maybe ever. My someone and I split the burrito vegan style with the veggie mix option. Also grabbed on a side of salsa and chips on top of already eating the complementary chips and salsa... and two cups of the vegan fideo soup. All were super tasty and authentic. The price is on point for this sit down eatery. And you will feel like you're getting your moneys worth as well. Vegans won't suffer here. The menu is full of options... and I saw breakfast options also that I will be in to try. There is actually two menus you are handed when you sit down, one for vegans and one for others. Seriously would be a great place for tacos and beers as they have a nice selection. This place would be perfect for lunch or dinner solo or with family and friends. Tomorrow is taco Tuesday and I may have to swing by for lunch!

HLe_CJWRYo_gJYIAGs-vHw.text: Wow, what a Great place for Mexican food in Summerlin. We stopped by and we're pleasantly surprised. Food great !!!! Waiter great!!!! Saturday night place is packed but no wait , we were seated immediately. Highly recommend...... GET THE FRIED ICE CREAM ..... it's to die for !!!!

IvUI1uT63VWp175_hpoNow.text: Bart Simpson couldn't have said it better..."AY CARUMBA!!!"  Pancho's, while your atmosphere looked beautiful, I was hoping that the food would look and taste just as good, but that's where it went south of the border...WAY south! Our party of 6 decided to check it out after hanging out at nearby TPC Summerlin all day.  The building and decor kinda made you feel like you weren't in Vegas anymore, but when it comes down to it, TASTE is everything. Heading straight for the entrees section of the menu, I like to try a Mexican restaurant's Chile Relleno as a test, so I ordered the three item combo which also came with an enchilada and a taco. Chips and store bought tasting salsa are also brought to the table as well. Entrees arrive, and as I bite into the chile relleno, it has a slight crunch!? A sign of the pepper not being roasted enough before being peeled and stuffed. The enchilada was okay, and the taco shell was stale with the meat being dry. I also tried a bite of Wifey's Seafood Burrito and the seafood definitely wasn't the freshest.  Apparently, there are two kinds of rice served here. A green, and a red. Those in our party who had the green rice enjoyed their order, while people with the red rice had crunchy bits in them. a sign of either sitting out uncovered, or prolonged time under the heating lamp as orders were being filled. Prices here are ridiculously up there(I believe all entrees were $16 or higher). The Company was good and service was pleasant, but I wish I could say the same for the food quality here. With tons of other dining options in Downtown Summerlin, you are seriously better off elsewhere. Just read the reviews and tips if you still plan to take a chance here.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/ Dos, no mas!
