KVVxhZFsBgXKa69OD3y3Iw.text: So I ordered the The Burrito Carnitas Especial.  And I won't lie, it was tasty.  Comes with a dollop of sour cream in the middle, with two slices of avocado on top of a burrito that is semi-glazed with some cheese sauce.  The atmosphere is nice, and so is the server, but when you had to wait about 20+ minutes for Mexican food off-Strip on a Monday night, it's either amazing, or there's something a bit wrong.  I'm actually shifting towards the latter.  The atmosphere is a great place, and perhaps they justify the cost due to it being in Downtown Summerlin.   But, there just wasn't anything enlightening about it.  Maybe it's just me.  The burrito I ordered cost about $19.  Honestly, it's probably worth about $12.  Unless the ingredients were all fresh, farm raised, organic and all that, I just don't see it.  Maybe they do... Trader Joe's is right across from there.  Somehow, I doubt it though.  Vegas isn't SoCal, and this wasn't a Strip experience.  Unfortunate.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gxhyFQRWNcRtzZrZfSZi3Q.text: This is one of my favorite places! The restaurant is so breath taking and the food is so good! Not to mention the very nice people who work there!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A nice man gave the kids a nickel for the fountain
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rajitas. Soooo delicious
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful

HuU68B4DjduTSB6XFtGKVw.text: We came to Pancho's for Taco Tuesday. Food is always ok not great but its close to home. Food was not even good. Service was ok. However tonight the piano man was so LOUD we could not have a conversation. We left with ears ringing and a very large bill. Sorry can't go back for subpar food and LOUD obnoxious music.I am there to have a nice meal not listen to the piano man make a statement.

_AH5tmuilJrixXdbvcITWA.text: Eaten here several times since my husband and I moved here from Florida. Consistent in service & food. We've always enjoyed what we've ordered and being surrounded by such a unique interior has been a nice touch too. Tasty food, pleasant service & great prices. Can't ask for anything more!!!

kCBgVK4N2JLdwWAfOyNrrA.text: The food is overpriced and the quality is not very good. I ordered the Burrito Carnitas Especial which actually has Chile con Queso sauce on the top, and the burrito was still dry. It was an average size burrito for $18/$19.  The service was good, waiter very nice, but way too expensive for what you get. I would not recommend.

U9odc9AFyVdFXd674cEPOQ.text: This is like most of the average Mexican restaurants around town. They are so so, when we went there it was almost dead inside hardly anyone there, but yet the parking lot looked really busy. But it seemed like it took for ever to get our drink orders and then had to keep asking for chips and salsa to be refilled. We had a party of about 6-7 but they seemed like we were more of burden than dinner guests. I mean if you want to try them then you can but I dont think you will be really thrilled since there are much better places to eat.

0sgWIx14lucRVVmHPTYXzA.text: Overpriced and overrated!! You need to have lunch specials and your chips and salsa taste store bought. Authentic this is not. I ended up giving 3 stars because of the decor. I had the chili verde, some warning on just how spicy and salty it was would have been nice. If you're looking for authentic go elsewhere, if cafeteria style Mexican food is your deal then Pancho's is your place, just make sure your wallet is stuffed.

aV7FFPu2sBhSjTJ-_JCNuw.text: I'll give it 3 Stars because it isn't horrible. The food is ok. It is just over priced.  The building is beautiful and I am sure they have high rent to pay, but I'm not paying it anymore...even for the convenience of being close to my to my house. I have been about 10 times.  The do send out a 2 for 1 val pack coupon. I would recommend using that.

N1wFgpWjXDvJ9Y5fseE7xw.text: I was so impressed by this spot! They gave me a great first impression, the atmosphere, lighting. Decorations, & great service all around. You Definetly get what you pay for with the food AND strong drinks. If you're in the area and want authentic Mexican food, do yourself a favor and stop in. Great vibes.

_pKUZM0WJDeMk1axMGpiYg.text: Do not ever go to this Shi*hole the managers are so fin rude Mallory and MIke to be exact they should be fired not even capable of being managers we ordered seafood that smelled old when we got it and let them know and also called later to inform them we felt ill they said oops oh well sorry not sorry basically NEVER EVER will I come back here

qutKL0o1d1klbNU_GKr9ZA.text: Had 3 star reviews..... 5 star place... great music, chips  and salsa awesome and addictive...don't get the overpriced queso there is no real queso and NO HORCHATA .... amazing chimichanga... pierce of food is pricy buuuut... split the food with family.... cuts food price down to 9$ a plate .. will return!!!

zWI_pMhqut-LS-75l-jVDg.text: This is not my 1st lackluster experience here, but it's at least my last. I really JUST wanted 2 hard chicken tacos. I was told I would have to order a combo plate to get them crunchy. That made precisely zero sense but I didn't feel like debating it. I'll be honest, I didn't check the price. Those 2 tacos (chicken, lettuce, cheese, pico) & a half a cup of rice & beans came to a whopping $19 pre-tip. I will pay for scrumptious food. Unfortunately, this was not. The chicken did not have a morsel of flavor & the beans were overcooked. It's also worth noting that making up the salsa were so many huge chunks of what looked like stewed tomatoes that I could have used them to make homemade pasta sauce. & there was so much cilantro in the salsa that it may as well have been a side salad. My assessment? Save your money & hit up Taco Bell.

X851aSoFAFu2itMGp6H9zw.text: We went for Sunday Brunch, and we really enjoyed the lovely ambiance, great service, & food & drinks... The bar was crowded watching football & a lively upbeat vibe... As the designated driver I did not have any margaritas but everyone else did & enjoyed quite a variety... Excellent service...

26xkY8-bxNRgL565mDGI_A.text: Went on a busy Friday night and service was excellent.  The staff was very attentive.  Prices are really high. $15 guacamole that was lacking flavor and $14 chicken and bean burrito with no sides.  Burrito had great flavor but something really upset my stomach.  A friend also went on a different night and 2 people from her dinner party got sick.

xzKsmSi-0LgumgVfWWxtcQ.text: We were really hoping to like this place because of its location. It's really a nice setting but that's about it. Ordered the enchiladas and really couldn't taste anything but bland red sauce. I am no expert but this was not like any other Mexican food I ever had.  Nice people but we will be finding a different place.

bvx6idF7yCyyEUL-yBJYNw.text: There wasn't anything that anyone of us at the table liked. I don't know what the rave reviews were about, but there wasn't anything to brag about. The prices are crazy out of this world and not worth it

zlp6BoCWNjcfoZT826sidQ.text: Cadillac Margarita was not. Came with lemon peel. Cheese enchiladas are unremarkable. Service is less than stellar. Prices are strip prices for bland, uninspired Mexican.

Id5haGLqh_aGVHP2Jg3sgQ.text: Quite possibly the worst 'Mexican' food I have ever had.  I have traveled all over Mexico - even lived in Oaxaca for the better part of a year - and I have never seen anything like this there!  I think it's an attempt at 'Tex-Mex,' that horrible sauce laden aberration that comes from the land of George W. Bush.  I had a chili-relleno and a cheese enchilada.  Of course, both were drowning in the same horrible red sauce (thank you, Texas) but the cheese was strictly American and the Chili was barely cooked.  It was so crunchy, it bordered on raw.  What once may have existed as an eggy batter was musched up with that gross sauce, I mean:  just disgusting!  Anyone claiming that this is 'Authentic' should be flogged.  The only Latino faces in the place belonged to the servers who, I am sure, were secretly apologizing every time they lay down a plate.  The price is as bad as the food - at least 30% more than it should be if not 50%.  $7.50 for a glass of Dos XX in the middle of Sunday afternoon?  Puleeeeeze!!!  Adios, muchachos, dios te bendiga and all that.  Avoid this one like Montezuma's Revenge!

CTtUEXm-WmYzuLZdtsaTVw.text: AS many of the previous reviewers have stated and by now it is obvious to both the owners and the customers, the restaurant is beauftiful and every detail is fantastic, the food however is very average with outrageous pricing for a Las Vegas location.   I truly think the owners have forgotten that this restaurant isn't in Manhattan Beach, or Newport or wherever the other one is.  IF you are interested in paying California prices for average Mexican food, then by all means visit this establishment.  If you know the difference, do like the rest of us and go elsewhere.

7soK0dwzC8tbeujWFI8jGQ.text: The ambiance in this place is great. Has a nice vibe. The staff was friendly. The food was okay but over priced as were the drinks.

lLHq9kJeZmU55OwYeEoJJw.text: Came here for happy hour, sat at the bar they had live music. Everything was great food and drinks were on point as well as customer service. The place was very clean as it should be.

PcxGQMZQiWj3Rq-qWwvFkQ.text: We had Sunday Brunch at Pancho's.  The hostess offered both the dinner menu and the brunch menu.  We decided to have brunch.  The brunch is supposed to come with fresh fruit and champagne, neither was offered to us by the waiter.  I had to ask about the fruit and it was brought out towards the end of the meal rather than a starter.  Never offered champagne.  Then I asked about the bunuelos  which are also included with brunch.  Waiter came back with flan because they did not have any more bunuelos.  When the check came, my order was charged $3.00 more than the price on the menu!!!  Very disappointed Pancho's.

CJm0DVOFV_3-WP79u1kXPw.text: We were so excited for Pancho's to open. We watched it being built and couldn't wait for it to open.  I signed up for information and updates on their website before they opened. I never received any updates or emails,maybe that was an omen?  When we did visit the restaurant we were impressed with the design and decor, its really beautiful. Unfortunately, that was the best part.  The hostesses at the front seemed confused and took a long time to figure out where to seat our party of 4, even thought the restaurant had lots of open tables.  Service was underwhelming, took a long time to get drinks and order our food.  Food was fine, nothing special considering the prices were very high compared to other Mexican restaurants in the area.  They can't beat Juan's Flaming Fajitas for great Mexican food, awesome service and reasonable prices.  I was hoping to find a great Mexican alternative closer to home, but Panchos isn't it for our family unfortunately.

7wgGU8xKhz7RIeTFa3ggSA.text: IT IS ALWAYS THE BEST!! Customer service never fails to amaze me every time that I go in there. The older tall gentlemen who walks around the tables to check how everything is going is wonderful! He makes my experience each time better and makes me feel welcomed! I love bringing friends and family here so they can actually get a taste of Real Mexican food! I cant wait for my next visit!

6ElPBhPkoA6gzk4xqgZbVw.text: My wife and I went to lunch at Pancho's today and needless to say we were anxiously awaiting the opening of this restaurant, but after our experience they might as well not have opened. The place has a nice decor in the main dinning area, but in the bar area it does not. It's just one big room with tvs and uncomfortable high chairs and tables. The food is highly over priced for Mexican food specially for tasteless food. To start with they give you a small basket of chips and the chips tasted greasy. I had Enchiladas Suizas (2) for $19.95, it came with a small portion of beans and rice and it was warm and not hot. My wife had a dish called Pork Tinga $21.95 and it also was warm and not hot, it came with a small ramekin of beans and rice with flour tortillas (she wasn't given a choice between corn or flour) which were thick and cold. Both dishes had no flavor at all. The service was slow even though it was friendly you could tell that it's a very inexperienced staff. In short a three ring circus. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone. For the two dishes an iced tea and Diet Coke the total was $49.53. We don't mind paying for good food, but this place has none. It's a shame that such a great location and beautiful building has the audacity to charge such prices for terrible food and service. If they don't make changes quickly it will be a one time experience for many who try it, therefore, it will fail within the year at most. My recommendation to anyone..... Don't waste your time and money on this restaurant there are other Mexican restaurants in town that are much better than this place and for half the price. Don't waste your time!!!

XIbiiHGJtaSeLiPG4WDOJQ.text: This place knows how to do authentic Mexican food and margaritas! The enchiladas, beans, and rice were all amazing. Service was on point- our food and drinks were served promptly. We didn't have to wait at all to be seated. The atmosphere is beautifully decorated and everything seemed very clean. Our waitress was friendly. The cost of the food seems slightly high but not a deal breaker by any means since the portions are generous. We will be back again!

nuhVBocbQIZto1FX9iprbQ.text: Well, pros and cons. The food is quite expensive and tonight is was salty. We started out with the queso with artichokes. It was not that great. It did not come with tortillas,  which I thought was standard, my mistake. For my main course, I had the enchiladas del Mar with crab and shrimp. The enchiladas by themselves were alright,  but the rice & beans were awful. The garnishment on the rice looked like a side salad of carrots and cabbage....WAY TOO MUCH!  Service was decent. The layout of the restaurant is horrible on the upper level. There is not much space for aisle walking and you walk right past other tables, almost brushing them. I think if I was fat, I would've hit the guests.  Our wait time was 1 hr 45 minutes, we ended up waiting about an hour, which we were happy about. The last thing we ended with was the tres leches, it was the best part of the whole night. Only thing missing is fresh strawberries on top. I won't be back. If you want good Mexican food, go to Lindo Michoacan in Centennial.

lrdoiOFVPqeD9cAeSPSBrQ.text: Read the reviews and still checked it out. what a mistake. So just like the other reviews place is pricey but that's ok if quality is up to par. I ordered the carnitas burrito. The cheese on burrito was absolutely disgusting. Also, 70% of the carnitas in the burrito were so old and over cooked it was like rubber. I opened up the burrito after one bite and showed the bartender. He took it away and removed off the bill.

sEr8T8XRKmkdTioofWd1nQ.text: We were excited to try a new place close to home as Summerlin is in desperate need of a good Mexican restaurant but we left feeling underwhelmed. The wait for a table on a Saturday evening was about an hour so we decided to eat in the bar area. Well, we were informed you can only be served drinks and appetizers in the bar. Really? Big mistake, Pancho's! I know of no other restaurant with such a ridiculous policy. The margaritas were okay and we liked the chips and salsa. Bar waitress was fabulous and fun. I did notice that the Tiffany style chandeliers (I don't know how these fit the Mexican theme) over the bar were an afterthought as they were run on exposed electrical conduit which perplexed me as the building was just constructed.   We were called to the dining area after approximately 45 minutes but of the 5-6 hostesses ready to seat us, not one had a clue of what to do and we waited more than 5 minutes at the hostess stand while they figured it out.  Upon entering the dining room, I literally felt as if I had walked into a jungle. The place is filled with an extreme, almost obnoxious,  amount of artificial plants and trees. Clearly the concept of "less is more" was lost on the designers. The lighting is very bright (might want to heavily consider dimming in the evenings) and there was no background music playing so we weren't impressive with the atmosphere. Our waiter was very good and attentive which made for a pleasant dining experience. I had the lobster enchiladas (really delicious!) and my husband had chicken chimichanga (he liked it but it didn't knock his socks off). We didn't stick around to have another drink or desert because the atmosphere was not inviting. My husband commented on the walk to the car that he probably wouldn't go back and unfortunately, I'd have to agree with him.

96fDDtl7EkzRaXKtTdaHcg.text: Overpriced, under quality ingredients tasteless! Don't waste your money here !!! Horrible horrible food! 20 dollars for a basic ranchero shredded beef burrito which was barely warm.. Roberto's taco shop is even better than this place!

nB7nD6rt5M1XA1cDSCUKRg.text: Panchos is a great restaurant! The food, service and atmosphere is fantastic. Like other yelpers, the prices will affect repeat business. Being that it is located in Summerlin, it will probably be very successful. I wish them the best and will be back only on special occasions.

GZCkqsi0ual2b0PqV9_d8A.text: So I hardly ever write reviews unless I'm extremely satisfied. I would have to say this is my first negative review and simply because I don't go out of my way to tell people how horrible they are. However this time I can't let this go without telling people. This is my second time coming to this restaurant. The first time I came here it was amazing. This time I can't say the same. One thing I will say is our server Carissa was amazing. She was so sweet and came to check on us several times. For the management I can't say the same. There was a older gentleman that would walk around and say hi to the tables and make sure everything is ok. The whole time we sat there he did not come up to us once. The tables around us, yes he did but seemed to just pass us by every time. I thought it was odd until I brought it up to the other two other people with me. They noticed the exact same thing. What did all these tables have in common? They were all white and so was the manager. There were two other  tables he did not go up to. Another table whom were Hispanic like us and a table with Asians. This manager will sit and chat with each table once or twice but yet never made it to our table or the other two tables. I'm sorry I hate to play the race card but I never experienced something like this in my whole life. A restaurant that serves Mexican food and they didn't even acknowledge not just us but two other tables. But the other 6 to 7 tables he could. Blows my mind.

tdo9Ps814wgSF5KN2thj9g.text: Just found this place. I feel like I'm in Mexico! Can't wait to try some more items. Gustavo, our waiter, was very patient and informative. Husband loved the albondigas!

Kgf5Bfa3SiFaFYEW-aLwuw.text: I came here with my family for lunch. The food was not bad, it's just that it was, for lack of a better word, unremarkable. I don't think anyone was overly impressed with their entrees. Average price for standard rice and beans entrees was $15 to &16. I feel better can be found for less.

s7Qkg1RrCDUXgEJE1ndehg.text: Panchos was awesome!! My moms 64th birthday was extra special!!! Thank you for the great service and the staff was great

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xH_wmWRaeE4BzzWEdaEZWA.text: I will never go back. Food is not good. Service is mediocre and we couldn't get more than a handful of chips. No one asked if we wanted anything else to drink and our glasses were empty. The owner/manager was very condescending. Lots better options in the area. This is not like the Cali location at all.

7UM58gqX0vZIb5w6x6p-8Q.text: So we had our first, and last experience at Pancho's today. Decor gets 5 stars but the food is not good, bland on top of bland with an extra side of bland. Nothing we ate was good, service was nothing special, and the food is EXPENSIVE for what you get. I guess they figure they can price gouge you because its in downtown Summerlin.  The carnitas were tough, flavorless, and did not appear to be fresh. The carnitas burrito is $17.95, came topped with cold Chile queso sauce (bland) and not a side of rice and beans in sight. For 18 dollars.... Really? The side of guacamole was 8.95. For a modest scoop of once again, flavorless guacamole. I mean, there isn't an authentic thing about this place, the plates are garnished with parsley for goodness sakes. Where's the cilantro? The limes? The flavor?!?!?!  We paid our $71 tab (no alcohol) (for two people and a toddler) and walked out quietly. The first thing we said to each other when we got to the car was, "never again." Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, nope you won't fool me twice.  If you are looking for decent Mexican in the area try viva mercados on sahara and ft. Apache, or even better, casa don Juan on buffalo and lake Mead, or Frank and finas cocina on flamingo and grand canyon..

r2BagWZVjmYH5kzTK5B4WA.text: What a great place! The food was amazing! The service was outstanding! We had fantastic Margaritas! Happy 5 de Mayo! We ll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a great experience!

ZqHsEmb_r3_bK4BUdvBLtw.text: Roommate and I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally decided to go in today. The decor is fabulous!  I'm a little surprised people are saying the food was overpriced. I ordered a combo plate with an enchilada and a taco, my roommate ordered a combo of 2 chicken tacos. Both had huge portions of rice and beans, and the tacos were served with guac and sour cream. We each got a Diet Coke and the bill was $39 and some change, roughly $20 each before tip. The value of the food for the price was as expected, and not outrageously over priced - to those people I would say that if you can't afford to eat out, simply stay at home; cook and serve your own food if you don't want to pay for it.  As far as the actual food goes, it was very good. I've been looking for good Mexican food in Las Vegas ever since I came from California, I finally found it! :)

4_6G-ZeUTROrhbAXb6VUvw.text: Living 2 blocks from Panchos, I was surprised to see that the new restaurant was located in Downtown Summerlin. We decided to stop for lunch after shopping today. Upon entering we decided to sit at the Bar as it was closest and usually we get better service sitting at the Bar. Our Bartender/server was very nice.  I asked for menus and water. Upon getting the menu I proceeded to check it out.  The cheapest entree for lunch was $15.00. Come on,  really  2 tacos $15.00. 2 enchiladas $15.00.   a house green salad $7.00.  The Margaritas are made with sweet and sour.  Jesus. They don't even know how to make a real margarita  My enchiladas were so bad I only ate one.  I give Panchos 6 months and Adios. Shame because it would be nice to have a fun, quality place close to home.

DAkDO8Tf_1MWKCJSmTTbdQ.text: Three classmates reuniting after 50 years at Panchos.  The place is awesome, colorful expressing the ethnicity. The food is very delicious, most and above all Cesar was smiley greeting us in a very friendly manner.  He did the utmost to make our reunion a very pleasant and happy event.  Cesar deserves FIVE stars.

X0q9Fpxx1KHlWybChjJmYQ.text: Came here last night for dinner and WOW. I had Pollo AL Diablo, the sauce had so many layers of flavor ending with a nice spicy note. The margaritas well I tried five different variations and they where all perfect. The entertainment in the bar was kinda surprising, you would think the would have native Mexican music, but it was not but the group was very good. During their break they stop by the table and chitchated a bit. The wait staff again perfect. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. The price was, for what I had, the entertainment was spot on.

TTWS8m717PT3reaZ-tL7cg.text: I had a enchilada del sol. But this one was filled with crab meat instead of shrimp. My first bite was unbelievable. The sauce was unbelievable. One thing I would suggest. Do not have it with the sour cream on it. It takes away from the sauce. I also had the tortilla soup. This was all so tasty.

K3pVEdtB_bk2oSkc8phPpw.text: Beautiful atmosphere, attentive customer service, delicious fried ice cream, just slightly over priced for the quality of food. May only be back for the fried ice cream and a cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream

TOeCdhcu10EL3RNY38FUCQ.text: Very nice ambiance.  Love sitting in the courtyard area and listening to the fountain. The food was good and very generous portions.  Our server, Claudia, was amazing.  Very helpful, attentive and friendly.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SxO5kL-RUw_c8G6uxgvKWw.text: OMG Mexican food has finally made it to Las Vegas!!!  I wish there was a 6 star option, because Pancho's would get it from me.   When we moved out here 6 years ago we were so disappointed with the lack of great Mexican food.  Lindo Michoacan and Flaming Fajitas are good options we have stuck with, but nothing is really "great" here.  Pancho' has changed that!  Their chicken tortilla soup has the flavor of my grandmother's chicken soup as the base -- the tastiest!  And the mole... yum!  I've ordered mole so many times in vegas and been disappointed that I finally gave up.  My husband ordered it because I refused to take another risk.  Boy was it excellent!  And the service was top notch.  Miguel should get an award for his friendliness.  The bussers stopped by frequently as well, and we even had the manager stop by a few times.  I can't rave enough about this place!  The brunch includes fruit and champagne as standard, even if you don't order off the brunch menu.  We will definitely be back.  I'm disappointed it took us so long to come and try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They had an Easter bunny photo booth!  This place was the friendliest most fun outing we&#39;ve had in while!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing atmosphere -- feels like you&#39;re sitting outdoors in Mexico!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan

1pLsSFoe3SGaO7r6cGxZ7w.text: The service was nice, but took a while.  My friends who I went with are regulars... They said t was unusual the food takes this long.  Chips and salsa kept coming, yummy!  Food was eh, I wouldn't call it bad though... Got the free fried ice cream, YUMMY!! Didn't mind going, but wouldn't go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. part of the upstairs seating

xtA6hU6hsWo9YJGUXc8QWw.text: Beautiful fun atmosphere, there was live music when I went in . the manager was super nice they stayed open later for our group since we got there late after coming from a kindergarten graduation ceremony that ran way longer than we thought. The manager gave all the kids coins just throw into the fountain.  Was Little disappointed that they didn't have horchata maybe there an out for the day ? I don't know maybe but I feel like Mexican restaurants should have it. Good had very good flavor and came out quick

FHBI7es1av6aUVVqQROTZQ.text: This was the worst food I've ever had in my entire life. I always tend to to give the Benefit of the doubt to everyone when I'm first trying their food out, but on top of the food being disgusting & making me have food poisoning. They took so long to serve us!!! They even gave us the wrong check & the manager was walking around with our cards through out the whole restaurant for like 5-7 minuets!!!! All I have to say is HORRIBLE FOOD & horrible service. I'm Mexican & I know how Mexican food tastes like... and that wasn't it. ANDD.... the food is WAY over priced for some disgusting ass food. We spent $70 bucks on 3 people. Just horrible.

iGGQjzvBOFLsk0bvX2vxEQ.text: This is the PF Chang's of Mexican food. I don't mean it as a compliment, but I also understand the need for such places. It is regular Mexican fair at double the price. Maybe it's necessary because of the expense of the DS location. Yes, the food is good, not great, but I wasn't disappointed. The salsa actually had a kick to it. It wasn't watered down. But $15 for a burrito with no sides? I've tried to argue that I could've gotten the same burrito at Cardenas or Roberto's for half that, easy. But then again, Roberto's and Cardenas market food court isn't exactly where Summerlinites would go out for a family meal or a date. I get it.  Just look around you. How many actual hispanic people do you see there (besides the employees)? ZERO. Why would that be? I personally don't eat at Korean restaurants where there are no Koreans eating there no matter how nice the place looks. But I still gave them the benefit of the doubt because of the demographics of Summerlin. But Vegas as a whole has a big enough Hispanic community that you would see at least one person eating here on a busy Saturday afternoon if this place was really that good. The Michiochan restaurants are full of Hispanic families.  The entire decor is designed to attract the non Hispanic Summerlin crowd into thinking they're eating ethnic food without having to drive down to questionable parts of town to do so. I would rather eat at Cardenas market and get similar quality for half the price. But yes, it's not a viable option for some people. Again, I get it. So you must pay double for the atmosphere.   But the final punch in the gut was paying $9.99 for a kids meal that was 1/3 frijoles, 1/3 rice, and 1 enchilada (or 1 taco, but to make it a fish taco was extra $). NO DRINKS included. I guess we live in Summerlin so we can afford to pay, right? It's what Upper-Middle Class people do, overpay for EVERYTHING.

Uwfpksk23o4djeOPdjdIMg.text: Best Mexican food I had in a long time.  Prices are a little high but worth every penny.  Meat used was top notch and service was great.  Free fried ice cream with Yelp check in and it's good for 2-3 people.  Will definitely be back

MhJfp5EtckQKZ57yw9tu0A.text: I loooooove this place  The service is always great!!!! You can never go wrong by going here

H-nMJT6pF9ln33Yp5AT9Kw.text: Went here with my family last weekend. We were told the wait was about 45 minutes but we were seated within 20. The atmosphere was great! The decor made you feel like you were eating in an outdoor garden even though you were inside.  I love that they give you a bowl of fruit to start out with.  Our server was very helpful and they were very quick. The appetizer sampler was great as well as the nachos. Can't wait to go again.

4fmFZK11n3VByNvTk_jRNA.text: OMG! We visited Pancho's at Downtown summerlin, and cannot wait to go back! A little pricey, but the decor is beautiful and the food was AMAZING! Our server was Alfredo.. and he rocks!We will definitely be back!

scmw-npBupKiF4uc-TtFUA.text: Pretty Bad. I was embarrassed with my guests. On the plus side is the interior which is festive and colorful. On the negative, almost everything else. We went there tonight at 6 p.m. with a party of four. Started with premium margaritas all around which were weak and tasted like a lime slurpee. We asked for no salt on all ... nope. Wait staff was very kind and courteous; however, when we received three of our entree's ... the fourth never came. Not for a while. After we decided to "go ahead" figuring the fourth entree' would be right out ... the manager stopped by. He asked how everything was going and we replied that we had been waiting for one of the ordered entree's, "carnitas". He was very apologetic BUT after another 5 or 10 minutes  or so, the entree came ... Fish Tacos. What? The manager came back and was bumbling with excuses about how carnitas couldn't be properly cooked here in Las Vegas unlike in Manhattan Beach, California where the other Pancho's is located. He said, "Princess it must be perfect to serve &  I'm sorry we will not charge you for the entree that you didn't get". Really? So while we waited for the entree' I ordered a Carona Lite (after finishing my watery margarita). We ate the food and all complained how salty it was but so be it... that's a matter of taste (even though all 4 of us said the same thing). The icing on the evening was I never received the beer I ordered. Again, the manager apologized and took one entree (that was never received) and a beer (that was never received) off the bill of well over $120. I paid the bill but needless to say this place failed miserably. Our first time here and we'll not return and tell everybody we know how crappy it was. We have lived in Las Vegas for over 25 years and are used to waiting ... the restaurant was packed. Don't know why as our experience was disappointing compared to even Macayo Vegas which has better quality and for less than half the cost ... BUT they don't have those fun, pretty festive colors. No Mas !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

gU2Lu1Xu7hwSKalkPcHIjw.text: Grossly overpriced, very small portions, and sub-standard ingredients.  I ordered a shrimp and crab chimichanga, which cost $21.95.  For that price, I expected large shrimp and chunks of crab meat, and a reasonably substantial menu item.  Instead, I was served the smallest chimichanga I've seen in any Mexican restaurant, filled with tiny bay shrimp and a miniscule portion of finely shredded crab meat.  My wife ordered nachos with no meat, at a cost of $15.95.  They were half the size of those served at Nacho Daddy for the same price.  My wife and I visit Mexican restaurants for dinner at least twice a month, and have patronized most of the Mexican restaurants in town.  If this wasn't the worst Mexican food experience we've encountered, it certainly comes close.  We will never again be a patron of Pancho's, and would not recommend that restaurant to anyone craving a good dining experience.  It's ashame that the proprietors didn't put as much thought into the food quality and menu pricing as they did regarding the facility's decor

-pTHn1v7XdEVqfGGX55geg.text: I read all of the negative reviews and came with a skeptical view. I have to say that it was really good! We had dinner at the bar, so I can't rate the table service but the bartenders are great! #chavonnerocks We had the taquitos with guacamole to start. Very good. Not the best I have ever had but very solid offering with good home made guac. Chips and Salsa also very good. Previous review of sub-standard salsa is BS. My wife had the Burrito Del Mar with shrimp. Flavor and quality were great but could have included more shrimp than rice (we mentioned that after the fact, because it was not so serious that we would send it back - they comped us tequila shots as an apology #niceform). I had the chicken mole enchiladas. Best Mole in LV! Seriously strong. Really good food, beautiful place, nice bar tenders. We will be back! Regularly! And all of the complaints about pricing? Really? Look at the menu. Read the prices. It is not cheap but given the quality and portion size, I think that it is fair. Not cheap, but not out of line with other high-end mex like Mercardito at Red Rock. Hope that this is helpful and you will give this place a chance. Cheers!

d8V9omxJGEZcgE69j_bH5A.text: Interesting interior decor isn't enough to make up for the the over priced, under seasoned food on a recent visit. We were greeted & seated by a less-than cordial hostess in an uncomfortable table located under a large plastic plant that smacked me on my head throughout the entire meal.  We started our  meal with the guacamole appetizer. It was nothing more than a mashed up avocado with no detectable seasonings. Our three entrees (two seafood entrees and a carne asada dish were lovely to look at, but lacked anything that could be described as interesting flavor. All three dishes required us to look to whatever we had on our table (leftover chip salsa and salt) to perk things up. Three house margaritas at $11 each were as nondescript as our food. Our notably underwhelming dinner for three including a shared appetizer and three house margaritas was $105, not including tip. While not entirely an unpleasant experience, it wasn't worth the price if tasty Mexican food is an expectation.

2C0AKTgrlts3UgrxPsQjnQ.text: Let me start with initial impressions.  Making a reservation was efficient, friendly and painless.  The building is beautiful and it is obvious that it was well thought out.  The interior is equally beautiful with a great looking theme.   Unfortunately the praise stops there.   After we were seated it was just under 9 minutes before our server acknowledged out existence and took our drink order.  Upon his return, he got two of the three incorrect.  Upon his second return he still had one of them incorrect.    After the drinks merry-go-round we ordered our meals. While awaiting our entrees we munched away on the fresh made chips that honestly were the shining star of the food offered here.   A server assistant wandered by and proceeded to refill the half empty glass of Sprite with water.  We pointed out the error and he replaced it fairly quickly.    Our entrees arrived in a reasonable amount of time but unfortunately only two of them along with a partial order for another table.  The third entree was delivered by the manager a couple of minutes later.  Part of me wishes that they never brought them to us.  What an uninspired, boring, and quite frankly tasteless group of entrees.  The chicken tacos has some very flavorful meat tucked inside a corn tortilla with little else.  The refried beans appear to be out of a can and the rice was bland.  This was an $18.00 entree!  The chicken burrito was just downright awful.  I think I have had a more flavorful burrito at Roberto's and Cafe Rio.   The chili verde burrito had some life in it.  The pork was properly cooked, the verde sauce was flavorful and it was presented nicely.   It was not served with the normally present beans/rice which was the same for the chicken burrito.   You would think that for $17.00 it would be a meal not just a burrito on a plate.    I spoke to the manager at length when he came by and sat down at the empty fourth seat.  Nice enough fellow who apologized for the service issues and heard my critique of the meal. I don't think he took my honesty to heart.     Overall I can say this place has some systemic issues that will close the doors within a year if they don't correct them.  The service is awful, the food is mediocre at best, the pricing is way out of line for comparable establishments in the Summerlin Mall.  I won't be back and will not be surprised when the name changes to RANDOM_NAME Michoacan.  What a waste of my money and whomever opened this place.   :(

EdZ-ZcXA1fTAMIU9LIrzcw.text: Wow! This was the worst Mexican food I've had, ever. The rice was bad, the enchilada tortilla's tasted out of date, and I wouldn't be surprised is the chile relleno was for a health choice microwave dish. The place looks awesome. The prices are a little more than most mall Mexican restaurants. Service was prompt. But if you actually want to eat at a restaurant go anywhere else. Anywhere. I'll be surprised if this place stays a float for another year without changing the quality of food.

UBKKdS4QBQeMg_KE47AcLQ.text: This is our 3rd time in 3 weeks.  Love the food, service and hanging out. Chile Relleno is the bomb.

R03gCNZRM0g7R3tntkH8aw.text: Awesome!!!! Delicious fresh Mexican food.  Ice cold beer nachos, tacos, fajitas everything was great.  Service was fast and friendly.  They kept the chips and salsa coming which was very nice.  Classic Mexican food and delicious.

YqmRYPuTY6WTkZvW43Be_Q.text: Food is alright very nice customer service very prompt and on the ball Thank you to our waiter patricio

1WOa6zrZ3R7RJY7Tzh1bbw.text: I'm surprised that this place is rated so mediocrely.  This is a great Mexican place in Summerlin!  They started the service with chips and salsa. The chips were crunchy and tasty and were paired with very fresh tasting salsa. It's also nice and spicy which we appreciated.   The salad was so-so but a good option for those wanting a fresh start. If they could add a Mexican cheese, a bit of guacamole and a salsa verde instead of the regular vinaigrette that would make this dish even better. Ask for a salsa verde on the side.   The tacos al pastor were very good. The meat is generous and marinated well so it was quite tasty.   The taquitos are a must-order. Typically I stay away from taquitos because it is so oily and heavy. But these are not the oil-laden taquitos you get from the neighborhood restaurant. They are lightly fried and stuffed with well-seasoned meat. They were generous with toppings and came with an awesome salsa verde.   But the best part of the night was the plate of carnitas enchiladas. The dish was deeply flavorful. There were so many layers of taste that came out that you can tell someone took great care to make this dish. The pork was so tasty but not overly seasoned as some carnitas can get. The garlic onion and cumin flavors are subtle enough to just bring out the pork flavor. The salsa cut the fatty taste of the pork in just the right way. The cheese and sour cream added heft to the dish. I loved it. The refried beans that came with the plate were not that glop of mush that you normally get in other restaurants. They were whole beans that had wonderful texture and taste.   Lastly, the service was great - Fernando was our server and was very nice. He worked fast and never tried to push us to order anything. When we asked him for suggestions, he didn't push the most expensive dish on the menu and actually told us what he thought was really good. The manager, Doug made sure to go up to every table and ask how things were going. It helped round out a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas

lR1W7UQiGichh5oIVgr1cw.text: Absolutely the worst service. Took an hour just to get our ice tea, and after sitting their for an hour and receiving my sons food- we waited 34 minutes for our waitress to come around to bring us ketchup. Don't waste your time.

The food was some of the best Mexican we have had in Vegas and the prices were reasonable, especially for the amount and quality you get..   Will definitely be going back there again for dinner

We will be back

RXJ9pVgZYJoajnFqog5X1w.text: Service was ok. Brunch & lunch menus available on Sunday @ 12:30PM & the extra options were nice. Chips were ok. Salsa was ok. Food is quite pricy, but maybe that is more "location" than the norm? Kiddo ordered an oven burrito for $16. Just a burrito. No extras. Hunny offered a carne asada chimi for $19.95 & it came beans, rice, guac & sour cream. The inside of the chimi looked like left over steak fajitas, but it wasn't bad tasting. Overall, it was just ok. Finally tried it so I can check this place off my Downtown Summerlin bingo card  but we will probably skip it in the future.

rqJT-hW-FMy1vYSD0IkqhQ.text: Beautiful and welcoming atmosphere as soon as you walk in.  GREAT customer service and wait staff.  Have lived in Vegas 3 years and have not found - until today - a place that could make a chili verde that I actually loved. Today I found that place and its Panchos.  Anyone complaining of price have obviously never been to a high quality Mexican restaurant as Panchos.  They're prices are consistent with other restaurants and yet Panchos food is better.  I highly recommend and will be bring my husband here for date night!!

No, let me take that back its not a Mexican restaurant it Just looks like one .  We had the chimichanga. For 18.95 this should have been 6.00 for bad taste and and size . And the price I was like I'm at Mexican restaurant .  Service was terrible . I should of checked Yelp before going  here.  Never coming here again

5WMg53-b18FU9s20fZ61NA.text: Place has a great atmosphere and the service was super friendly. The manager gave all the kids coins to throw into the fountain. Food was ok and seemed a little pricey.

aKGdrqDWuS_yLoi-NkxAEw.text: Pancho's is a great spot. I love the classic California style Mexican restaurant layout as well as the traditional menu.   The food here is good. Honestly, it's not the best I've ever had, but it hits the spot when I'm craving Mexican, and it's a decent quality.  I'm always treated very well at Pancho's, and some of the servers recognize my family and me. We're always made to feel welcome. Even the management makes an effort to check on guests, which is great in this day and age. These managers are professional, by the way. They know what they're doing.  I agree that the prices are on the high end, but check your Val-Pak and other similar types of mailers. Pancho's puts some good coupons out in these, and you'll end up with a pretty reasonably priced meal for two or three people if you use one.  This is one of my go-to spots, and I'd recommend it if you're in the mood for Mexican food.

BrCIoDOlPysQCgIQJp_cYw.text: Very good Love this place Please come here for the amazing margaritas ! Half off on sunday tequila !

OAdV-JKgQpcYRMghYG8D2g.text: I could not tell you how the food was, as I guess we were not good enough to be served.  This one star rating is strictly for service.  Upon arriving and being seated, my party and I waited approximately 10 minutes after being seated before we were brought chips and salsa.  We are still awaiting the arrival of our water, or even for a waiter to ask if we would like a drink.  It was time to go when we watched as a party of 5 was seated and immediately OUR waiter proceeded to take their drink and appetizer order before they could even push their chairs on all the way.   Terrible service,  which is huge in terms of the dining experience.    As frequent visitors to Summerlin, always looking to try new eateries, especially Mexican food,  the lack of service received today at Pancho's was repelling to say the very least.

JGKoYOHKUtfdnz1V2RbRmg.text: The food, atmosphere, service, everything was top notch. A little pricer then other Mexican restaurants but I think it was worth it for what I got. I got lobster enchiladas which my enchiladas where full of lobster I also had a lot of rice and black beans. I left stuffed. There salsa that they bring to the table with the chips was a bit spicy just right for me, my kids were not a fan and my waiter was wonder and brought them bean dip they were happy. The food came out super fast and the waiter was very attentive to the table. Great experience will have to make another trip there.

o-Y7dk7d2wUFaEuS9QGx2w.text: This is a pretty good restaurant. You've surmised that they serve Mexican food and it's fairly good. It is on the more expensive end though. We had 4 dinner entrees, a glass of wine and a glass of beer. The bill was $133.00 which feels a little steep especially when the food is average. The entrees were reasonably large and perfectly edible so it's unlikely that you'll leave hungry. Our server was Karisa and she was awesome. Her area was very busy, but we never felt neglected. She is efficient and good at her job. She was really good and we appreciated her.  I probably won't be back. If the bill was $80.00, I'd come back, but not for $133.00.

Jnkm0mRTOdcNEtbckPoGJg.text: Amazing food. We had the steak quesadillas and tostada Del Mar. both we so good. Everything was fresh. Augustine was our waiter. He was excellent. Very attentive.

1THEllOpqj8pwIxvDtZptQ.text: I love Pancho's! Great food and cute little spot in DTS. Came for HH on a Friday and of course the bar was packed. Jimmy (manager) was awesome and got us a spot at the bar. The service was excellent and everyone behind the bar was attentive, especially Jimmy.

KEJiyj3TIfX-lpeeaQO5vw.text: Food is great, it is pricy though...get a coupon from your local mailer to save up to $16.00 which I use all the time. Food is very flavorful, service is very good too! Atmosphere is great too! Good place for Mexican food!!!

0deCH4sfqSZ1Bj4CSMX06w.text: Pretty solid Mexican food restaurant. "A-OK" is the description Yelp gives for 3 stars. I think that's exactly right. This place is exactly what I expect from a good Mexican restaurant in a strip mall.  For starters we had the guacamole. This was pretty good, and they were able to give it to me without cilantro! That's a big bonus for me, because I'm one of those people for whom cilantro tastes *terrible*. This also means they are more likely to have made it fresh, which I like.  My wife and I had entrees that were also good. The menu is so big that now, a few days later, I can't remember what I had.   I think that is a good example for this restaurant and why it gets 3 stars instead of 4. I remember that it was good. I remember that I enjoyed it and that I would eat here again if I were in the area. I don't remember anything really stand-out or special about it enough to really remember what I ate. It's just good Mexican food.

zNxnGLocepwUwA-zibIIbQ.text: Very nice atmosphere in here but this restaurant is very expensive for Mexican food.  Sunday brunch is a minimum of $20 a plate even for an appetizer it's nearly $20 and the food is just subpar this is Vegas there are tons of great Mexican Restaurants that are much more affordable.  Not interested in a very small $20 plate of nachos

5tFGm1Qt5vjNvcWPOPRI3g.text: This was my first time here and I can say it was pretty good. The service was on point and the food looked and tasted very fresh.  The prices were a little bit higher then I'd expect for this type of restaurant, but it is what it is.

atmO9ltgwQ5U7PcOtbc0zA.text: Eh.  It's ok.    First impressions are great - it is a *beautiful* restaurant with a nice interior "courtyard" with a big staircase and nice fountain.   Service was also very solid, polite and efficient.   So why three stars?  The food was extremely generic and somewhat flavorless.   The chips tasted like they were out of a bag, the salsa had almost no flavor and each entree was just "meh".    I had a cheese enchilada and taco combo.  I've had tastier microwave Mexican.   There wasn't anything wrong with it, but you would have a better experience at any chain Mexican restaurant.   The other big issue is the insanely high prices.  Expect to pay $17-20 for items that would be $9-11 at most other restaurants.   If the food was unique and flavorful this would be OK... but what we had?  Meh.

CcGcnq74gG9NA6qmLjdWXQ.text: Tried this place for the 1st time today. They don't have a lunch menu. My husband and I shared the Carne Asada Chimichanga. D it was delish. The portion sizes are good and hefty so even with us sharing-i still couldn't finish. If they get a lunch menu, we will be back. Their prices are too high for lunch.

k344y7VeK1ObAUYK_YlUHw.text: Decided to grab lunch after strolling downtown Summerlin. Our server was Claudia and we had a fantastic lunch with great service. The name Pancho's attracted me to check this place out because I remember the name when I lived in Houston which was phenomenal. I don't think they're the same owners. However, we enjoyed the tacos al pastor and chicken quesadillas. The portions are pretty large, since I had a big appetite and bringing home leftovers. We enjoyed the house chips and spicy salsa. Oh yeah, when we checked in on yelp we received a complimentary fried ice cream dessert to share! It's was a pretty good size and delicious! I love the festive decor and ambiance. I'm sure it would look beautiful at night with all of the lights. Will be back and maybe bring my parents for dinner.

x6uC4V9nU9MvNm42c5EAOw.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time with a friend. Nice atmosphere and service was decent. However we were very disappointed with the food. I ordered chicken quesadilla for $16.95 and the chicken was shredded and tasted horrible. I have never seen shredded chicken quesadillas in somewhat of an upscale Mexican restaurant especially for the price that we got charged.  The shredded chicken is a low quality form of chicken that is very cost affective for restaurants . Most if not all Mexican restaurants, I've visited use grilled chicken breast instead.   I returned the dish and decided to ordered the Tacos Al Carbon which suppose to have Carne Asada for almost $20.00. Guess what? The red meat used was not Carne Asada, it was low grade red meat with a dreadful rubbery after taste.   We honestly did not mind the price and the atmosphere, but the quality of the food especially the meat products does not justify such high price on the menu.  I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for authentic and high quality Mexican food. We will definitely not visit this restaurant again.

AYYL1KLjJAaZLUms5IyMqQ.text: This is the most authentic freshest amazing food you'll ever come across the interior of the restaurant is simply gorgeous you would swear you're in Mexico the service is awesome I always get the waiter Augustine he is wonderful. TIXQzFIgpzq7vBwQ6PlrXw.text: I have to agree with most of the reviews. It's average at best and for a few reasons.   We came on Friday night after trying to decide where to go. We had received a coupon (ha!) in the mail and thought really this is the only way to justify overpriced Mexican.   The bar was really bright and they had a cover band  singing  80's/90's rock which was very odd. We opted not for the bar and sat in dining room. It's actually really pretty inside with palm trees, string lights,  fountains, and Spanish tile.   The salsa was good. The guac is 14.95 which is a joke. We didn't receive it after ordering so we canceled it and saved ourselves 15bucks. The food was good enough and decent portions. Still hard to justify 20 bucks on menu items like quesadillas and burritos.   Glad I gave it a try since I see it so often, it's close to home and I love Mexican. Prob would go back to try happy hour (maybe) but def not for regular priced entrees. With so many other great places in the area, it feels semi insulting to offer average food at such a high price point in an inauthentic atmosphere. Esp when there's Roberto's around the corner ;)

Salad appeared smaller then it was on previous visits  ordering  the same dish. It is a beautifully decorated restaurant however the food was just okay and the prices for every dish was 3 or $5 more than an other establishments.

DaAUqZS9VEyvNJDaV_YtZA.text: Fantastic Mexican seafood. Delicious flavors, excellent service, and outstanding margaritas. Highly recommend.

EXVYkpiR5_lpoKm2ffaP9w.text: Got a shrimp special I forgot what it was called and it was amazing !! The green rice was really good the veggies tasted like stir fry, good thing I like stir fry.. The service was great besides the lady In the front making us wait for 10 minutes for nothing tables were open we even walked around and looked.  Everything else was fantastic oh and no horchata that was a bummer.  Salsa a little watery also.. I liked it for my first time! Great waiters

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jXhspaecWIWp2f-Oel4aWQ.text: I've been to Pancho's twice now and have had an amazing experience each time.  Surrounded by colorful decor, the atmosphere and ambiance feels lively and authentic.  Both times I ordered the Chimichanga del Mar and it is one of the absolute best chimis I've ever had (and as a SoCal girl I've had way more than my far share).  During both visits the staff was friendly and accommodating, even though I'm one of those annoying customers who requests "chipotle sour cream instead of regular, guac on the side and all rice / no beans please."  It is one of my new Vegas faves!

BRnJjSKMSEc2YLUGJNfBRw.text: Love this place! The food is excellent and I love the cucumber jalapeno margarita. Wait staff is friendly and service is very good

uGlgG83FreDsRPIJUCUnvg.text: The rajitas were soooo delicious. We ordered shrimp and steak combo. Was perfectly seasoned and succulent. The queso dip appetizer is also a must try. The guacamole was a huge portion that could feed 4-6 easily. It's a nice cozy vibe inside with dim lighting and music that's not overbearing. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sMnrGwc6oSTXD4gwkvFNBA.text: Definitely an American Mexican place. The restaurant it's self is  5 stars. The food is good and the portions are good but it's way too expensive. I feel like I could get a better price sometime else. This place would be nice for a date.

Gg8zuqXBmiWNdEhNABjNZQ.text: I love loved their deco! I just wished they had some Mexican music playing since they didn't have the live band. Anyways that's not the reason why I give it 3 stars. I don't know if its me just expecting too much from Mexican restaurants?! I just thought the food was not amazing and it was overpriced. (Average $17+) They could also do a better job with their food presentation.  On the other hand, their service was great!. Was busy on Sunday brunch time and got seated right away. Friendly staff always made sure we were ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free fried ice cream with Yelp check in :)
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mole Enchiladas, Green burrito, chips with salsa and some fruit.

ER8ftxQJfvhx8AMilWRbhA.text: I tried to get a bar seat or a table tonight but the managers and waitresses kept taking people they knew in front of me and seating them.  I've never had an issue like this before here but the waitress tried to lie and say the other folks were here before me and they spoke up and said I was there first.  Anyway I left, it left a very bad taste in my mouth.

XTFxGbZWOcPFub-p0MznGg.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Summerlin area. The carne Assad's quesadilla is out of this world!! They always seat us promptly and the staff are so nice. The fresh made guacamole and chips are so good too! Great place for kids as their menu tackles even the most Pickiest of eaters!!

TE2B5hJ-xDwHbcPnADMNpA.text: I'm a fan! I definitely wish that it was closer to home, because I find it hard to drive all the way to Summerlin for dinner.  I met some friends here for lunch prior to some shopping in Downtown Summerlin. It was our first time eating at Pancho's, although I had heard a lot of good things about the restaurant. We definitely enjoyed ourselves.  We started with guacamole, which I believe was around $7. Only thing is, it was a HUGE portion and we didn't even come close to finishing it. It was really good.  I ordered one of their combo meals (cheese enchilada and chile relleno), which came with rice and beans. Everything was fresh and tasty. We enjoyed their chips and salsa as well (probably too much). Our server was really friendly and I loved the decor. It reminded me of being home in San Diego and going down to Old Town to eat. I don't really think it's that overpriced, especially considering the portion sizes and the area.

XIf9Ix_m9mWaTA0kuwfhPQ.text: I feel like having Mexican for afternoon snack... The bar is pretty busy...happy hour from open to 7PM woohoo Move to the main restaurant area  Very clean and beautiful inside The burrito del mar - crab and shrimp plus the shrimp Diablo puffy tacos are great Salsa is little too spicy for me Overall and great place to eat

IjMsKj0g38yofLNz4OQeHA.text: My family love this place! Food is good and has a friendly staffs. if you come to this place make sure you don't eat before you come to Pancho's because their food is big!

JsGiz9JJrTEYhzCqwgbUZA.text: I finally decided to try Pancho's, and I'm a fan! The restaurant itself is beautiful. I love the way it looks on the inside and outside. I've never been to a restaurant where you can eat upstairs, so that's pretty cool. The food was delicious. I would've given this place 5 stars if it weren't for the slow service. They were very nice, but we were there for quite a while. We got free fried ice cream after checking in here on Yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free fried ice cream

Ibt1luEESU2D_fz1gp8O5A.text: The first time I ate at Pancho's here, I wasn't impressed or ready to come back anytime soon.  Whatever Mole Enchiladas the waiter said I'd like was not even close to what I described.  He did however bring out another sauce to try for next time I order it, which was awesome.  I love the location, ambience & sports memorabilia, especially the winners circle pix for racehorses!  Instead of giving them a bad rating for the first time, I decided to try them again.  Not only cause they were new at the time, but cause my friend has eaten here about ten times w/ no complaints!  He highly recommends them & knows Mexican food.  I've also been to the one in Manhattan beach which was great.  Older & more authentic feel, but always fantastic.  Helen in the bar area on Monday Night Football w/ happy hour & specials was FANTASTIC!  She not only brought me the mole sauces to taste so that I got the correct dish this time, but she was on top of everything!  The hot sauce, sour cream, oven baked or regular been burrito, etc.  Wow!    Dad ordered the Oven Baked Bean Burrito, I got the Mole Helen recommended & we tore it up lol!  It was so absolutely fantastic!  Mom's fish tacos weren't so good.  Instead of a chuck of Mahi Mahi she got tiny cubes.  Almost mushy & overwhelmed by the pico de gallo & cabbage.  Mom said she loved the chips & dip & service, but will never get the fish tacos.  I took a bite for this review & absolutely agreed.  However, we WILL be back.  5 stars for two of three dishes & exceptional service Helen.  We may only sit wherever she is lol.    Overall, I recommend the brown mole Enchiladas, oven baked bean burritos & fajitas.  Salude!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials menu
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panchos
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oven baked bean burritos mmm

KDwGmp8-9aE9LYM1MtaoTA.text: This place is so much more than the typical Mexican American restaurant.  First, the building is purpose built and has a very authentic feeling.  The stained glass windows throw beautiful light throughout.  The restaurant is much larger than it looks with areas that are broken up.  If you sit in the courtyard area, it can be a bit noisy, but charming.  We enjoyed the chips and salsa.  The salsa while not hot, has a bit of a kick which makes you come back for more.  I had the seafood stuffed poblano pepper which was very enjoyable.  My wife had the fish tacos which were quite flavorful.  The sides of the rice and beans were heads above other Mexican restaurants.    I wish I had room to try desert, but will have to wait till next time.  We will be back!!!!

6x1Y7abpHfAdko3FLH1xVw.text: Came in with a friend who raved about this place. They had a vegetarian menu so I figured why not. Went in ordered happy hour margaritas and a burrito from the specified vegetarian menu. Food came and after eating some of the corner I noticed it was not in fact a vegetarian burrito but a beef burrito! Not sure how that happened since I asked for a vegetarian menu and the waitress even specified if I was okay with sour cream. Highly disappointed didn't even get an apology or manager attention from it. Ended up just munching on my chips and salsa because I didn't want to chance another wrong order. Won't be back

2pTvgwFpzvmbBS6Kei8plA.text: The best part about this place is the decor, it reminds me of being anywhere but the desert. I ordered a beef tostada, very basic. It had so much liquid in it I could barely eat it. It was like having soup in a tortilla shell. Between the dressing, oil from the meat and salsa it was  so over saturated and it made the lettuce soggy.

hFXbX6izPxyE1xaZfbb2iA.text: We were introduced to Pancho's about two months ago. We love this place. We make sure we stop in and have at least two meals, while we are in town. They have a very good happy hour. The employee lace is very clean and can accommodate a lot of people. The food is very good!  I have to send a shout out for Helen in the bar. She has helped us the last three times we have been here. She is an awesome waitress!!!  She takes great care of her customers. It's amazing how much attention she gives even when she is busy. She is so attentive and keeps checking on her tables.  If you are in town and like good Mexican food, stop by Pancho's.

KED6ejF9osjsilPldiCVHg.text: I wached for months as this place was built at downtown summerlin, praying that the food lived up to my expectations. It actually exceeded all expectations. I've enjoyed the food here at least 10 times.   Ambience... The building is beautilful inside. See my pictures. Tons of light comes through the skylights, lighting up the jungle of living plants. Authentic mexican tiles adorn the stairs. This place really transports me out of vegas and into mexican nirvana.  Staff... wow every time they are so friendly and fast. Leaving a big tip is a pleasure when the staff is this good.   Food... I usually get the steak fajitas because they are other worldly good and so large that i don't eat anything else for the rest of the day. I've also tried all of the enchiladas and they are some of the best I've had. Don't even get me started on the amazing house margaritas. Definitely the best I've ever had.   Price... this is a bit more expensive than other mexican joints but ur paying for quality and exceptional service, ambience.   Other reviews... I'm absolutely dumbfounded to see Panchos doesn't have a 5 star rating on yelp. It's truly one of my favs in vegas and I eat at all of the best places. I believe people are ordering simple things like tacos and chimichangas and expecting it to b like taco bell. Or they are just offended by the higher prices.   Do yourself a favor and visit panchos. Ask the friendly waiter to recommend something or go with the fajitas which are called Rajitas at Panchos.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The staircase.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful tiles adorn the stairs at Panchos.
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita close up... did I mention I&#39;m addicted?

CPQkIGqIzyp-NdBS4YQu9A.text: 1st off I would like to say just like many people the venue is beautiful! Very authentic Real plants! Beautiful colors in the restrooms! The wood work omg. It reminds me so much of home! Just gorgeous you guys really did a great job.   If yelp had another category on venue you  would score a 5++++   The food on the other side was a disappointment, really once I walkin I fell in love with the ambiance. During our meal I was still wanted to find reasons to go back!   Sadly we won't.   *The chips and salsa were good portions the salsa, taste and looks like the the Tostitos salsa from Costco and the chips are not consistent half of them stale half of them good. * Order a appetizer fried taquitos flavorful but odd to serve with Verde tomatillo sauce. Weird it wasn't spicy I guess it was for dipping didn't think it needed. Chichen was moist beef was ok. *They don't offer agua Fresca's only soda product not house made lemonade. *The abondigas soup broth was too thick the meatball itself was very flavorful and traditional but the broth and vegetables lacked seasoning. * ordered Lobster enchiladas they came with black beans green rice the green rice was blend no salt not sure if it was supposed to be cilantro rice enchiladas were okay black beans  good. * Then ordered chicken green mole was horrible so much cumin and bland. Accompanied with red rice and pinto beans the rice and beans were the best part of the whole meal. This is not an authentic Mexican style restaurant it caters more to the American palette, the has no indication of what real Mexican food should taste like.  In summerlin people act like they have money. The prices didn't bother me as much as the food is not worth the price. If the food was outstanding I wouldn't mind paying for great food and the amazing atmosphere the venue has.   The service staff on the other hand was very polite very cordial very helpful. Service staff was great so they get a a 5-star! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifull plate presentation, portion size was worth the price!

HmcyxP5TGe8Ekd8k5vFsqw.text: Beautifully designed building with nice decor inside. The service and food were good but the prices were way to high!!!   $13 for a margarita $18 for enchiladas!!   Was looking forward to this place being a regular for Mexican food but not at these prices. Disappointing

gJBK6_Wr8s4v_bXwoPH6Gg.text: I REALLY wanted to like this place. I love Mexican food. The food was pretty tasteless, just bland. Mexican food should never be bland, right?  I've been about four times. The service has always been great for me. The restaurant is pretty, and it's in a great location. I like that they have live music in the bar!  Just don't care for the food.

X8NGWYrzxKlDnZKeqID8YQ.text: Stopped in for lunch have been waiting to try it out. its right down the street from my work and from my house. it needs a lot of improvement with service but the food was really good a little bit pricey.  But they need to work on their bar area only high to bars.  Doc has restricted me from using my right foot so can't stretch it to sit at the bar tops in the bar the hostesses wooden honor the prices for happy hour for a bar only and weren't really accommodating finally the manager came over and said that he was aware of our situations and still honor the price.   So management=great  hostess = horrible service  server he apologize they're still new but we got our water after our meals and we had to ask for chips and salsa and someone had mentioned that you get fruit but we never got.  Willing to try again in 6 months if they last.

Anmi0DuGnYPrikjc4ZWgHQ.text: 2 stars for our server and the decor. Seriously this is far from authentic or traditional. The name of the dishes are as authentic as this place can get. Way over priced for Taco Bell quality food.

-yjfplxAVcsGhyT2CZPHpQ.text: This is so far, my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. I ordered the Pancho's combination plate and it was huge proportions. One deep fried beef taco, perfect chile rellano and cheese enchilada. Came with rice and refried beans cooked to perfection. Their classic margarita was strong and in a large glass too. Soda comes with your own tableside pitcher  for refills. The deep fried ice cream was covered in what looked like corn flakes but it was a chewy and I wouldn't order that dessert again. So 4/5 stars but I will be back.

s7hDSvCmVlZTUp2teJuPmw.text: Good food, good ambiance and good service. We were very satisfied with the food. My wife really loved the enchiladas rancheros. I had the seafood quesadilla and was very good.

xBamUYoX0ZiNQbes1me1jA.text: Me and one of my friends went to Pancho's in downtown summerlin last Sunday - they had just opened October 15/ with a soft opening on the 14th - our server had informed us.   Anyways, the location is awesome, as the downtown summerlin mall continues to grow, everyone loves Mexican food . So, the location was a no brainer. I personally, could see this place as one of my new happy hour spots. One of those places that could be, "the place", this could be it.   So, me and my friend come to eat here after I tell her I ve been waiting for this place to open, I call and found out this place just opened !   The ambiance and architecture are beautiful. When you go inside, you feel like you went on a vacation, it doesn't feel like the Las Vegas desert anymore ! It feels tropical and the glass windows add something new and inviting !   We got free champagne and the lobster taco s were amazing ! My friend's breakfast she said was just ok! Breakfast may not be their speciality !   I love the place so far . I d say to lower prices somewhat and add more marketing and incentives for happy hour and ladies' night . In addition, they did say they do karaoke and play music. The bar area is huge ! I ll be back otherwise !

4jMTRuUuE33kMF2OTMRiLQ.text: Beautiful atmosphere food not bad but so not worth high price tag. I know this is in Downtown Summerlin where rent is high but... 90% of meals are over 15.00 Ridiculous! Two tables came in reviewed menu and I heard them also talking about the high prices. The lowest thing is a plain burrito at 13.95.  So - they started sending out coupons 2 for 1 for dinners but there's s catch.. you have to order two drinks. Watch it a simple soda is 3.75 each! Lol so u really get 8.50 off of highly expensive meals. Really only 50% off your second meal.   Lower ur prices your not that great of food  and I was around people not coming back again.

p7H2y59o9t4AYgq4-8KVsg.text: Haven't found a good Authentic Mexican restaurant until we tried Pancho's. The surroundings felt welcoming and homey. The staff were very friendly and service we good.    Prices were moderate to high, but it pays off with the large servings and tasty food.  I've tried other restaurants, but this place has to be by far the most authentic. Rice and beans define the authenticity of this restaurant. Simple and full of flavor.  Not to much going on.. but its a must order.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pWfaFMZPXQuw150_H6oraA.text: Come here recently for Fathers Day with a group of 5. I had read about this place as one of the top 15 restaurants to eat in the Summerlin area. I don't know if his Pancho's is affiliated with a location that was once in My hometown of Houston, TX but I decided to bring my dad here. Everyone seemed to have loved the food they had chosen. I had eaten my full plate before I even knew it (within 15mins if receiving it). I believe we all either got some type of enchilada or burrito. I was the only one who ordered an adult beverage and tried the cucumber-jalapenos margarita. I initially was going to get the regular jalapeno margarita but the server said this other one was better. Unfortunately, the taste of the cucumber completely took away the spicy kick of the margarita. I was disappointed with it being a Mexican restaurant. To be fair, maybe because Houston, TX is the best place to get your authentic Mexican food and really delicious cocktails. We live our margaritas frozen, and I've only found one place that actually makes a stellar frozen margarita here in Vegas. I would advise not to get the cucumber jalapeno margarita- just stick to the plain jalapeno margarita instead. Besides the good food, I think the entree's were priced almost $2 too high. I definitely would go again if ever I find a date to have dinner with

7enoyZoBoC2dZzFAyulJhw.text: Been looking forward to trying out this new restaurant despite a lot of negative reviews. My wife and i went in today around 2pm and they were busy.  Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table so we went to the bar for a beer and a margarita. $18.95 for 2 drinks, ok a little pricey which now pushed my expectations to a higher level. We both had soup, the Albondigas and their Chicken Tortilla soup were both very good, hot and flavorful. Our entrees were Carnitas Ramon and the Artichoke and Avocado burrito. portions were huge and both dishes were very good. The carnitas was very very lean. Over all the food was plentiful, and delicious. Our server was very polite and helpful. Besides being a little pricey we enjoyed our experience and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Abondigas Soup
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke and Avocado Burrito
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Ramon very lean and plentiful

6fHgDifLoSdFVZx1G328iw.text: This re-creation of a lavish Mexican hacienda serves beautifully presented dishes in very ample portions. My friend and I could have shared one entree and one appetizer however we were eager to try some of the unusual main courses instead. We ordered the Especial de Cabo which was a combination of shrimp, real crab, and chicken breast topped with melted queso and a succulent simmered pork dish---Tinga Poblano.  The sauces on both dishes were complex yet subtle. Of course we ordered Tres leche cake for dessert which arrived with great birthday fanfare in honor of my friend. Pancho's is not just a restaurant, it is an experience.

Ot_DV26vd_S9At8qsT1NtA.text: Decent food- but waaaaaaaay too expensive for Mexican food. Ridiculous. Juan's Flaming Fajitas is much better food. We won't be back.

AxC7y-tyb7UBH-2pGdAIRw.text: Came back a second time, sat in the bar where they had live music which was fun. Food is still pricey and just ok, we had a coupon is which is why we came back to try it again. I would go back and sit in the bar for the live music and just order drinks and maybe an appetizer. My husband ordered the carne asada he only liked the cheese enchilada that came with it. I had the chicken fajitas, they were good.

-_8P3yRxjKXXaXv8GSW6SQ.text: Ate there about 7:00 PM on a Monday evening. Very few people, but they seated most everyone near each other, including near a party of about a dozen unruly young kids, apparently for a party. Despite parents there, extremely loud (average 78 db). Very loud & could not visit with each other. Food was average to good, had fajitas. Served hot & tasty. Prices a little high.

0-a1DF1U5yLTIreOL6OEEg.text: Loved the look and feel of this New Mexican Restaurant in Downtown Summerlin!   Prices were, what I thought, ridiculously high but the fried ice cream made up for it for sure!  It was amazing!   Give it a try!
