Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!  Amazing Fried Ice Cream!

w183zqlG9wO5GeteJ-mgKg.text: I LOVE Pancho's Mexican!!!  Chimichanga shredded chicken dish was mouth watering!!! Last time I had the cheese Enchiladas with Avocado and sour cream so delicious. Cadillac Margarita has a special mix (yummy)"Great job to the mixologist"! I love the festive spirit and pretty decorations and lights that make it a great atmosphere. The bar side is equal fun with a great band to spark up your Saturday night!! I came back twice in one month,since I had such a nice dining experience. A special thanks to the lady food server working in the bar.   I was at the Summerlin Downtown location last night off Sahara and the 215. Thank you, for the great service!!!

pFtQ9so0gWlXkELIz2b_FA.text: This place is not vegan friendly.    We came here after searching for a vegan friendly restaurant. It seems like a nice place, but it is very limited on vegan options.  They cook their rice in chicken broth, which really limits the vegan options.    The happy hour looks good and Monday evening is lady's  We had the Enchiladas with artichoke and avocado which was tasty and filling, but nothing really special.

LotpIFVQI-Cq_PeBeiOzKg.text: Amazing Mexican restaurant, the best I've been to in 8 years. Will return. Cesar is the best, had the smile the whole time while serving is. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the best Mexican food I&#39;ve had in 8years.

ZdzBbzVyCO6NA5VEbH16eg.text: Had such a fun time at Pancho's - it really makes you feel like you're in a Mexican hacienda! Their margaritas are delicious and the mango and chicken salad was my fave!! Looking forward to checking out Ladies' Night!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ozZPpR2Dp7z6NXzJ4wfJKQ.text: The environment is authentic and very green. If you are looking for live entertainment and Mexican backgrounded selfies, choose their concert or happy hour time. Food was average and way overpriced.

BTTtA6tWhlQREHQe9Lwk1A.text: A little pricey but it was worth it. I had their grilled fish tacos and really enjoyed it the portions were good since and the fish was not over done and flavorful.  The service was average my glass was kept full and chip basket was never empty.

_Ypb6zEC_lnkg5m1kVpmgw.text: This place has outstanding food and amazing service. Really good margaritas and highly recommend the white sangria.  Very attentive staff!! The manager Doug saw that one of our dishes was a little too spicy for my girlfriend and instantly came over to exchange it just to ensure we were both happy with our meals.  He was extremely kind and funny. (Awesome glasses by the way.) Jorge, our waiter, was great!!!  I highly recommend this place. We will definitely be back thanks to the amazing service here!!

fQJBVFwvnpvDm4Ew2bumjA.text: Decent food but definitely not worth the price.  Way over priced. $18 for a burrito and $19 for a salad.  Kids menu is $10.  There are a lot of options for Mexican food in town and most are not this expensive.  That will be the only thing keeping me from going back.

OQfqxOMZhgvWkDF-L_d9-g.text: I came here for the first time last week and the food in one word, amazing.  The price is what keep me away for a while but let me tell you it is worth it, very authentic and flavorful. On top of this the employees were very nice, I asked for recommendations and I got so much helpful information and while we were eating our food the owner/manager came over and made us feel so welcome and even covered our alcohol charges! Will rush back!

v1G-c0R8zCqzSGc-IXyylw.text: One of the most incredible parts of this beautiful place is knowing it was a parking lot a mere 6 months ago! The interior of the space is amazing! Truly transformative.  I had heard through the local grapevine they were having some opening bumps, and had decided to wait a bit to let them work it out. When recently invited to meet friends here for dinner, I thought it was perfect timing.  Right off the bat, you are greeted with big smiles, polite staff across the board. Our waiter was awesome. All of that is perfect.   So now you are asking....sounds great, why only 3 stars? The reason for 3 stars is the food was really super mediocre.  And I wanted it to be great! But, sadly it was definitely not.  On top of being completely average, it was very expensive compared to other mexican places of this food caliber. I had an enchilada and a chili relleno, and it was just shy of $20. I could easily list 10 places that are close to 1/2 that price and better food. I suspect this is why the online menu does not have any pricing. Most people in the area will know that it is high. My sentiment regarding the food was the census at the table, no one was thrilled.  Don't get me wrong, I have NO ISSUE with a $20 entree! If the food is amazing, that is all I need to know! But here, the food is far from amazing. Bummer, because it is really a beautiful space, filled with an awesome staff!

XZvKwmGi-MHOtyaVJPv5-g.text: We had dinner here and the grand kids loved the kids menu and my food was amazing. The staff was so friendly. We will definitely be returning.

3kEbDtccHnML8iUrLp8bWA.text: The chicken tortilla soup was so delicious. I got the lobster enchiladas they were excellent but I cannot stop thinking about those margaritas i had the naughty Maggie and the pomegranate freaking awesome coming back next week with my girls from work. Oh and the service was more than I could have wished for

sYHbrJEBJJBbfPLnXE7FSw.text: I liked panchos, not exactly Mexican food but it was good.. I liked the tortilla soup.. the waiter Chris was really nice

IX1YBelNUngW1l7Vhmjxcw.text: The Service is awesome - the Birria Chef Ramon is outstanding - very comfortable - a little pricy but who is not this day and age - all in all good place to check out

-BMQnUa1570FkIaXXQMOIA.text: Decor and atmosphere was very festive and fun. Drunk prices were very reasonable.  Food was a bit expensive  but the portions were huge. Had carnitas burrito and chicken chimichanga. Food was wonderful.

oiMZRB_kE_MdlktUmef9Ug.text: This was our first visit, I was excited about a New Mexican restaurant in town.  What a let down... Food  was blah... Salsa is runny, chips were cold and stale. Service was bad, our waitress Ruth was completely uninterested in helping us, and the prices are outrageously high for what is served. People through out the restaurant were complaining about service. Good luck to Pancho's .. We won't be back

FSqjXXPgQEqVOQb5Sl6CSg.text: This place is in downtown Summerlin. Ambiance was chill and relaxing. Our server Martha was absolutely great. We were a party of 15 and she remembered all of our names. When looking for something to eat the price caught my attention! The prices were unreasonable! For example 2 tacos rice and beans was 22.95! It was so hard to choose something to eat and not hurt my pocket! I just chose the meatball soup! It was delicious but for the portion and the price it wasn't worth the 7.95! It was my friends birthday so the staff came to our table, put a sombrero and sang for him! They also provided fried ice cream and a shot of tequila! That was pretty fun! The overall experience was really nice! I would come back if they would lower the prices.. But I doubt they would so I may not be back unless have to!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albondigas soup! $7.95

Bf-7A-td1mrnnTLDaUISZw.text: Excellent tasting & decent portions! The refried beans were great- my one requirement for trying any Mexican restaurant! Ask for Helen (of Troy) because she was super quick & checked on us many times! Fantastic blended margaritas & $5 on Monday nights from 4pm- close! Yummy! Chicken taquitos & beef nachos were Bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feelin good! Lol!
Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd round &amp; demolished fried ice cream! Soooo good! Had such a great time!! Monday nights are $5 margaritas from 4pm-close...

mf6uJzDOrVLUeS087IGVLQ.text: I have to say that this is one of the most beautiful Mexican restaurants I have ever been to but that's about it. My husband and I sat upstairs , again the the view of the restaurant is pretty, but service is really slow but thankfully friendly.  The reason why I give three out five is the price of the food. To be honest, it's very basic and plain for the price. I know several restaurants that are way cheaper and the food is flavorful.  Other than price, it's a nice restaurant.

MsKozrFOR771jn3vsYaoZw.text: Very nice atmosphere, service was good. Price is a bit high, as it is located in the Summerlin area. Food is below average, compared to other places with same food category. The stake was tasteless.

TbPYDUyswvx9cj0rzCVvnA.text: I really really wanted to like this restaurant. It's at Downtown Summerlin, so I'm thinking "elevated". Not so much. First, the service was AWESOME! Also, the decor and ambiance was fantastic. That's where it gets 2 stars.   The food was just not good. I got the chicken fajitas thinking it was nice and basic. How could you go wrong? Dry chicken, spices that made it taste horrible, brown guacamole and dry rice. Very high priced and a chain restaurant like Chili's leaves it in the dust, which is a shame.   My friend's meal wasn't much better.   This place has potential to be awesome. They have great service from the minute you walk in until the minute you leave. The restaurant itself is beautiful. But the food needs a lot of work for how much you're spending.   Honestly, greasy Roberto's or some of the small taco stands have better food. It's very disappointing.

nw637M2WLFtJgBH7rmR0rw.text: The decor is really pretty. The service is awesome.  The only downfall is the prices.  Regular prices are crazy and happy hour isn't so "happy".  The happy hour prices are what the normal prices should be.

RV_s4ibLp4IEmqaVpvruOg.text: Food was alright , able to digest. WORST EXPERIENCE in my life... I've work in the food industry and I've never seen something so disrespectful. After me and my family paid our bill and continued to enjoy conversation for a hour the manager came over telling us we had to leave . The reason was because they needed the table BUT yet the restaurant was empty, there was open tables, and it was only 3pm. You are never to tell the guest they have to leave for simply paying and enjoying company. #NEVERAGAIN... And the enchiladas had bones in it ..

X1JIetV3R1ISD3Dzw4xgcw.text: The was a disappointment. The interiors are fabulous and the margaritas where good but unfortunately 3 out of 4 of us were not happy wth our meals at all. It's over priced too. The server was nice but it took her nearly an hour to take our order. I hope they figure it out because it's a great location and as mentioned they've put a lot into the interiors.

zKjpRIuEz8Fsn1z8OmtV9Q.text: Checked out Pancho's in DTS for the first time. Sat in the bar to watch the game and have a few appetizers. Decor and atmosphere are very nice.  Service was okay. Drinks were good. Food was average. Prices are ridiculously high for what you get. Well over $40 for two drinks and one average chicken quesadilla!  Could have gone to Mercadito in Red Rock for the same money and had a much better culinary experience.  Sorry Pancho, but I was hoping for better.

hG7Go4RJBqHcfFKZroHWNA.text: My wife and i went to pancho's a couple of times and the food was good.  But this 4th of july i took my wife and parents to pancho's, my wife and i got fajita's chicken and beef combo, my mother got beef fajita's and father got chicken fajita's.  We all got really sick and remained sick for a few days, stomach pains, diarrhea.  It was very bad.  I wouldnt recommend anyone go there.

Sn5Prb6Kdgmi_d7JdAiQ0w.text: So this is going to be a weird review.. the first time I went to this place was this past Memorial Day and it was delicious! the red salsa with the chips was fresh and spicy, I ordered the taquitos dorados and it was the best taquitos I have ever had, the meat was perfectly seasoned, the taquitos were nicely filled and the green salsa was to diiiiieeee for. The ambiance was fun and the service was great.  I couldn't wait to take my husband there especially since he tasted my leftovers and LOVED it so we went the next day... yes, the very next day. Which where this rating comes in... the food tasted NOTHING like the day before.. the salsa was watery and weak. The taquitos were bland and the green salsa was... flavorless. The service was still great but the food was such a disappointment. Upside is that they are True to their word, they make everything fresh. Downside, their chefs are very inconsistent so much so that I will never eat at Pancho's again. Why? because you should never have to pay that much money for disappointing food.

n7WeqaSZlUH4fbAbp9pLyA.text: I would give a 3-1/2 stars for food and price but because of the decor I gave 4 stars. Had the tacos de pescados. The mahi mahi was grilled well, not rubbery but just a tad dry. Tried the fish by itself and it was good but once you add the sides, lemon, and sauce then the taco was really good! The rice was decent and the beans were ok. They melted the cheese on the beans I believe with a torch, like you would with the sugar on creme brulee. The chips were of medium thickness, not greasy, and the salsa was pretty good. One of the waiters offered us a free refill on chips and salsa which was a plus. I've read comments where a bowl of fruit is also complimentary but we didn't get any. Might have been a special or grand opening thing. Lastly, they added a nice little touch to the tacos. They pinned the tacos closed with a strip of bamboo (I believe) shaped into a sword (tied a knot at one end) and used radishes as stoppers. Check out the pic!  As for the decor, gorgeous! Just look at the pictures other people have uploaded. There is a nice little outdoor waiting area that is very charming. Slightly hidden and intimate. I looked at the colorful patterned tiles that were everywhere and from I can tell they are all hand painted or else stamped but none were completely identical. We were a table away from the fountain and didn't smell "mold" like what one person said in review. We walked by it and I took a whiff and didn't smell a thing. We did however get one of the two tables that is right next to the kitchen entrance. It was busy and kind of distracting but luckily no accidents this evening. The "uniforms" of the hostess' were a nice touch, subtle Mexican styled dresses.   I would definitely come back but not as often due to the prices. This would be a great place to take friends and family for dinner due to the "WOW" factor of the decor. By far the coolest looking Mexican cuisine restaurants I've been to. Looking forward to trying the flan next time, it looks similar to how my mom makes them.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco de Pescados

6UaxeCDS40TP-4E7tOteGA.text: I felt the food was fair, in taste and in quality.., but they were EXTREMELY over priced, two people, two drinks, two dinners......eighty bucks, geez Louise, it's beans and rice, not prime rib!

ThU3J6qUCQk0N-tSAFb0-w.text: The food and the service was very good. But don't think the prices are like McDonalds. They are far from they are quite expensive but the food is authentic and fresh. The only problem I had was waiting 10 minutes and the place was half empty. I would recommend this place if my bank account was larger.

z2QKdW0_D2WkE_sAoVCleA.text: The food was awesome!!!!! The place looks really nice and everybody is very friendly. For sure we will come again.

lkvEJC8iJ1Mpd8i9W6VS2A.text: This place has such potential but is sadly disappointing. The restaurant is visually appealing and was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Our server was just friendly enough but was not overly attentive given that we were one of the few tables in the whole restaurant. We felt that the food should have been more than mediocre for the price. Kids plates are $10 and adult plate average around $20. My husband and I ordered signature dishes since they all had enticing descriptions on the menu. The food was beautifully presented and the serving size was more than adequate but the taste failed to live up to expectations. This is not a place I would recommend due to the high price for lackluster food.

_FIKeen8ph_jfmcwO1zeCw.text: We had a coupon for a buy one meal get one free so decided to try it. Sitting in the atrium area is nice, but if you sit anywhere else it's very plain. Food prices were double compared to other restaurants in town (Ricardo's, Jalisco's etc.) Was surprised and disappointed they didn't serve Horchata. Their normal salsa was heavy on the garlic. Service and food were just ok, nothing spectacular. I've had better Mexican food at other places. Would I go back...probably not.

I69oV7EAxrYc8lorC04UjA.text: I enjoyed the Puffy Shrimp Tacos while watching Pancho's hilarious comedy show in the huge cantina! If you're looking for quality Mexican food with a great margarita, this is the place to go!

YrmyqhcXQJy_ebWq3MfzcQ.text: I'm from California so I'm extremely selective about the Mexican restaurants I go to and give my endorsement. Pancho's from its inception here in Downtown Summerlin has definitely earned its endorsement from me. The atmosphere is amazing, the service is great, generally the manager is always walking around--checking in and making sure everyone is comfortable. They have live entertainment and karaoke nights in the bar area on some nights...oh yeah, and the food is amazing. I've tried several things here, the burrito ranchero is probably my favorite dish. If you're a die hard beef burrito fan...you can't go wrong with that selection. If you're looking to have a great nite out with your friends and in you're in the mood for Mexican food--do yourself a favor and come to Pancho's...just as a side note...the price points are a little higher than most of the Mexican restaurants I've gone to, but just know it's worth it!

wil-BfMb4ZijVNYlTwuk4A.text: I gave one star because the bus boy was very nice and attentive and the restaurant decor was adorable.  However everything else was horrid!  Let's start with the unfriendly and borderline snarky hostess.  I didn't get her name, but she had dark brown hair.  The restaurant is lit so darkly at the tables that you can barely see your food.  Which is probably what they intended so you can't see the horrible presentation of the plates.  I ordered the 2 cheese enchilada combo.  The enchiladas had so much cheese on top of them that that's all I could taste.  The rice was hard and not at all like any Mexican or Spanish rice that I've ever had.  How can you possibly serve awful Mexican rice at a Mexican restaurant?  My meal was under $20, which is completely overpriced!  My friend wasn't that hungry so she ordered a side of beans and rice.  The serving she got was baby sized and was $6.  My daughter ordered from the kid's meal a cheese quesadilla.  The kid's meal was $10 for a tiny quesadilla and hard rice.  Let me say that she's had better at Taco Bell.  The tortillas were hard as rocks on her quesadilla.  The flan I ordered for dessert was ok, but was drenched in cinnamon.  I've had Mexican food in many places, even in Mexico.  I've been to taquerias that were amazing and sad to say that I'd rather go to Taco Bell than ever return to this place.  The price point at this place does not match the quality of the food or the service.  The waiter was barely present until I asked our bus person if he could bring my dessert.  We were done with our plates a while, and our server never came back to ask if we were ready for dessert or how our meal was.  He did however bring us the check, and after picking it a back up he opened it right in front of me to see how much tip he received.  How completely rude and unprofessional!  He was a jerk period.  I don't mind paying this price for good food and good service, but this restaurant has neither of those things.  I will NEVER return to this overpriced restaurant with rude service and disgusting food.

K0wW_pjqc0gOTZ2haN9G2w.text: LOVE this place!!!  This is the first Mexican restaurant in Vegas that I would actually return to.  Yes it's a little pricey, but my experience was well worth it.  Delicious food and margs, and outstanding service from everyone!  Thank you Pancho's!!

0Iis_N7zgiUy8NZKUwiCag.text: Great place to go for Taco Tuesdays!  The service has always been good and they have a large selection of dishes to choose from.

NyLbNzd3g2hj1o0gNy6gRw.text: We have always loved Panchos.  The food and service is always 5 star. I never leave reviews though. This time the service was so exceptional I can not help by leave a review. Alfredo was our waiter and he was absolutely incredible. The best service we have had in Las Vegas and we have lived here for 9 years. We will come back to Panchos and we will be asking for Alfredo! Thank you ALFREDO!! Your the best!

FJnilxZrxTiZH6kIVtRuIQ.text: We had brunch on a Sunday and it was absolutely FANTASTIC!!  We got chips and salsa and a fruit salad as a starter.  Each adult was served a glass of champagne (with refills).  The servings sizes were perfect and the food came quickly and was fresh.  I HIGHLY recommend the brunch menu.  The Huevos Rancheros were AMAZING and I can't wait to go back and have them again!  Miguel took fantastic care of us.  I will ask for him by name next time.

24bAExxpv64WNH0rHWrhXA.text: Absolutely fantastic food, ambiance, and service. Food came out quick and everything was delicious. My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Impressed for how new they are. I'll be back for sure.

Q5zG67wa6-H93VeZ0KJDPQ.text: Came to Pancho's be cause a los of My coworkers were talking a lot about it, how beautiful the place was. Came in and I was not dissapointed. The place is beautiful, took me back to when I went to Mexico, not just the restaurant the Service and specially the Food. You guys Should try it.
